module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackInstance

-- | An CloudFormation stack, in a specific account and Region, that's part
--   of a stack set operation. A stack instance is a reference to an
--   attempted or actual stack in a given account within a given Region. A
--   stack instance can exist without a stack—for example, if the stack
--   couldn't be created for some reason. A stack instance is associated
--   with only one stack set. Each stack instance contains the ID of its
--   associated stack set, as well as the ID of the actual stack and the
--   stack status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackInstance</a> smart constructor.
data StackInstance
StackInstance' :: Maybe StackInstanceStatus -> Maybe [Parameter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackDriftStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StackInstance

-- | The status of the stack instance, in terms of its synchronization with
--   its associated stack set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to <tt>true</tt>, to delete the stack
--   instance, and then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because:<ul><li>The associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation.</li><li>The stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or
--   <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation that failed or was stopped before
--   the stack was created or updated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe StackInstanceStatus

-- | A list of parameters from the stack set template whose values have
--   been overridden in this stack instance.
[$sel:parameterOverrides:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe [Parameter]

-- | The ID of the stack instance.
[$sel:stackId:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The detailed status of the stack instance.
[$sel:stackInstanceStatus:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> The organization root ID or
--   organizational unit (OU) IDs that you specified for
--   <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:organizationalUnitId:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Most recent time when CloudFormation performed a drift detection
--   operation on the stack instance. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for
--   any stack instance on which drift detection has not yet been
--   performed.
[$sel:lastDriftCheckTimestamp:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name or unique ID of the stack set that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
[$sel:stackSetId:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Status of the stack instance's actual configuration compared to the
--   expected template and parameter configuration of the stack set to
--   which it belongs.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: The stack differs from the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set to which it belongs. A stack
--   instance is considered to have drifted if one or more of the resources
--   in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the stack
--   instance differs from its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The stack instance's actual configuration
--   matches its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:driftStatus:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe StackDriftStatus

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Self-managed permissions</i> The name of the Amazon Web
--   Services account that the stack instance is associated with.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:account:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Amazon Web Services Region that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
[$sel:region:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The explanation for the specific status code that is assigned to this
--   stack instance.
[$sel:statusReason:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StackInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_status</a> - The
--   status of the stack instance, in terms of its synchronization with its
--   associated stack set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to <tt>true</tt>, to delete the stack
--   instance, and then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because:<ul><li>The associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation.</li><li>The stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or
--   <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation that failed or was stopped before
--   the stack was created or updated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterOverrides:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_parameterOverrides</a> - A list of parameters from
--   the stack set template whose values have been overridden in this stack
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_stackId</a> - The
--   ID of the stack instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackInstanceStatus:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_stackInstanceStatus</a> - The detailed status of the
--   stack instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitId:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_organizationalUnitId</a> - [Service-managed
--   permissions] The organization root ID or organizational unit (OU) IDs
--   that you specified for <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastDriftCheckTimestamp:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_lastDriftCheckTimestamp</a> - Most recent time when
--   CloudFormation performed a drift detection operation on the stack
--   instance. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for any stack instance on
--   which drift detection has not yet been performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetId:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_stackSetId</a>
--   - The name or unique ID of the stack set that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftStatus:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_driftStatus</a> - Status of the stack instance's
--   actual configuration compared to the expected template and parameter
--   configuration of the stack set to which it belongs.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: The stack differs from the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set to which it belongs. A stack
--   instance is considered to have drifted if one or more of the resources
--   in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the stack
--   instance differs from its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The stack instance's actual configuration
--   matches its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:account:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_account</a> -
--   [Self-managed permissions] The name of the Amazon Web Services account
--   that the stack instance is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_region</a> - The
--   name of the Amazon Web Services Region that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusReason:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_statusReason</a> - The explanation for the specific
--   status code that is assigned to this stack instance.
newStackInstance :: StackInstance

-- | The status of the stack instance, in terms of its synchronization with
--   its associated stack set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to <tt>true</tt>, to delete the stack
--   instance, and then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because:<ul><li>The associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation.</li><li>The stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or
--   <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation that failed or was stopped before
--   the stack was created or updated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
stackInstance_status :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe StackInstanceStatus)

-- | A list of parameters from the stack set template whose values have
--   been overridden in this stack instance.
stackInstance_parameterOverrides :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe [Parameter])

-- | The ID of the stack instance.
stackInstance_stackId :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The detailed status of the stack instance.
stackInstance_stackInstanceStatus :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> The organization root ID or
--   organizational unit (OU) IDs that you specified for
--   <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
stackInstance_organizationalUnitId :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Most recent time when CloudFormation performed a drift detection
--   operation on the stack instance. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for
--   any stack instance on which drift detection has not yet been
--   performed.
stackInstance_lastDriftCheckTimestamp :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name or unique ID of the stack set that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
stackInstance_stackSetId :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Status of the stack instance's actual configuration compared to the
--   expected template and parameter configuration of the stack set to
--   which it belongs.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: The stack differs from the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set to which it belongs. A stack
--   instance is considered to have drifted if one or more of the resources
--   in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the stack
--   instance differs from its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The stack instance's actual configuration
--   matches its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
stackInstance_driftStatus :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe StackDriftStatus)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Self-managed permissions</i> The name of the Amazon Web
--   Services account that the stack instance is associated with.</li>
--   </ul>
stackInstance_account :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon Web Services Region that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
stackInstance_region :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The explanation for the specific status code that is assigned to this
--   stack instance.
stackInstance_statusReason :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackInstance.StackInstance
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackInstance.StackInstance
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackInstance.StackInstance
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackInstance.StackInstance
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackInstance.StackInstance
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackInstance.StackInstance
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackInstance.StackInstance


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackInstanceSummary

-- | The structure that contains summary information about a stack
--   instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackInstanceSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StackInstanceSummary
StackInstanceSummary' :: Maybe StackInstanceStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackDriftStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StackInstanceSummary

-- | The status of the stack instance, in terms of its synchronization with
--   its associated stack set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to <tt>true</tt>, to delete the stack
--   instance, and then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because:<ul><li>The associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation.</li><li>The stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or
--   <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation that failed or was stopped before
--   the stack was created or updated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:StackInstanceSummary'] :: StackInstanceSummary -> Maybe StackInstanceStatus

-- | The ID of the stack instance.
[$sel:stackId:StackInstanceSummary'] :: StackInstanceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The detailed status of the stack instance.
[$sel:stackInstanceStatus:StackInstanceSummary'] :: StackInstanceSummary -> Maybe StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> The organization root ID or
--   organizational unit (OU) IDs that you specified for
--   <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:organizationalUnitId:StackInstanceSummary'] :: StackInstanceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Most recent time when CloudFormation performed a drift detection
--   operation on the stack instance. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for
--   any stack instance on which drift detection has not yet been
--   performed.
[$sel:lastDriftCheckTimestamp:StackInstanceSummary'] :: StackInstanceSummary -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name or unique ID of the stack set that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
[$sel:stackSetId:StackInstanceSummary'] :: StackInstanceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Status of the stack instance's actual configuration compared to the
--   expected template and parameter configuration of the stack set to
--   which it belongs.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: The stack differs from the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set to which it belongs. A stack
--   instance is considered to have drifted if one or more of the resources
--   in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the stack
--   instance differs from its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The stack instance's actual configuration
--   matches its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:driftStatus:StackInstanceSummary'] :: StackInstanceSummary -> Maybe StackDriftStatus

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Self-managed permissions</i> The name of the Amazon Web
--   Services account that the stack instance is associated with.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:account:StackInstanceSummary'] :: StackInstanceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Amazon Web Services Region that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
[$sel:region:StackInstanceSummary'] :: StackInstanceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The explanation for the specific status code assigned to this stack
--   instance.
[$sel:statusReason:StackInstanceSummary'] :: StackInstanceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StackInstanceSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_status</a> - The status of the stack instance,
--   in terms of its synchronization with its associated stack set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to <tt>true</tt>, to delete the stack
--   instance, and then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because:<ul><li>The associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation.</li><li>The stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or
--   <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation that failed or was stopped before
--   the stack was created or updated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_stackId</a> - The ID of the stack instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackInstanceStatus:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_stackInstanceStatus</a> - The detailed status
--   of the stack instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitId:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_organizationalUnitId</a> - [Service-managed
--   permissions] The organization root ID or organizational unit (OU) IDs
--   that you specified for <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastDriftCheckTimestamp:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_lastDriftCheckTimestamp</a> - Most recent time
--   when CloudFormation performed a drift detection operation on the stack
--   instance. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for any stack instance on
--   which drift detection has not yet been performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetId:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_stackSetId</a> - The name or unique ID of the
--   stack set that the stack instance is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftStatus:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_driftStatus</a> - Status of the stack
--   instance's actual configuration compared to the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set to which it belongs.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: The stack differs from the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set to which it belongs. A stack
--   instance is considered to have drifted if one or more of the resources
--   in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the stack
--   instance differs from its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The stack instance's actual configuration
--   matches its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:account:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_account</a> - [Self-managed permissions] The
--   name of the Amazon Web Services account that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_region</a> - The name of the Amazon Web
--   Services Region that the stack instance is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusReason:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_statusReason</a> - The explanation for the
--   specific status code assigned to this stack instance.
newStackInstanceSummary :: StackInstanceSummary

-- | The status of the stack instance, in terms of its synchronization with
--   its associated stack set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to <tt>true</tt>, to delete the stack
--   instance, and then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because:<ul><li>The associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation.</li><li>The stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or
--   <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation that failed or was stopped before
--   the stack was created or updated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
stackInstanceSummary_status :: Lens' StackInstanceSummary (Maybe StackInstanceStatus)

-- | The ID of the stack instance.
stackInstanceSummary_stackId :: Lens' StackInstanceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The detailed status of the stack instance.
stackInstanceSummary_stackInstanceStatus :: Lens' StackInstanceSummary (Maybe StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> The organization root ID or
--   organizational unit (OU) IDs that you specified for
--   <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
stackInstanceSummary_organizationalUnitId :: Lens' StackInstanceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Most recent time when CloudFormation performed a drift detection
--   operation on the stack instance. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for
--   any stack instance on which drift detection has not yet been
--   performed.
stackInstanceSummary_lastDriftCheckTimestamp :: Lens' StackInstanceSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name or unique ID of the stack set that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
stackInstanceSummary_stackSetId :: Lens' StackInstanceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Status of the stack instance's actual configuration compared to the
--   expected template and parameter configuration of the stack set to
--   which it belongs.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: The stack differs from the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set to which it belongs. A stack
--   instance is considered to have drifted if one or more of the resources
--   in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the stack
--   instance differs from its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The stack instance's actual configuration
--   matches its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
stackInstanceSummary_driftStatus :: Lens' StackInstanceSummary (Maybe StackDriftStatus)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Self-managed permissions</i> The name of the Amazon Web
--   Services account that the stack instance is associated with.</li>
--   </ul>
stackInstanceSummary_account :: Lens' StackInstanceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon Web Services Region that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
stackInstanceSummary_region :: Lens' StackInstanceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The explanation for the specific status code assigned to this stack
--   instance.
stackInstanceSummary_statusReason :: Lens' StackInstanceSummary (Maybe Text)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackInstanceSummary.StackInstanceSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackInstanceSummary.StackInstanceSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackInstanceSummary.StackInstanceSummary

pattern StackResourceDriftStatus_NOT_CHECKED :: StackResourceDriftStatus

module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary

-- | Summarizes information about whether the resource's actual
--   configuration differs, or has <i>drifted</i>, from its expected
--   configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackResourceDriftInformationSummary</a> smart
--   constructor.
data StackResourceDriftInformationSummary
StackResourceDriftInformationSummary' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> StackResourceDriftStatus -> StackResourceDriftInformationSummary

-- | When CloudFormation last checked if the resource had drifted from its
--   expected configuration.
[$sel:lastCheckTimestamp:StackResourceDriftInformationSummary'] :: StackResourceDriftInformationSummary -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Status of the resource's actual configuration compared to its expected
--   configuration
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration in that it has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the
--   resource differs from its expected configuration.Any resources that do
--   not currently support drift detection have a status of
--   <tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>. For more information, see <a>Resources that
--   Support Drift Detection</a>. If you performed an
--   ContinueUpdateRollback operation on a stack, any resources included in
--   <tt>ResourcesToSkip</tt> will also have a status of
--   <tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>. For more information on skipping resources
--   during rollback operations, see <a>Continue Rolling Back an Update</a>
--   in the CloudFormation User Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:stackResourceDriftStatus:StackResourceDriftInformationSummary'] :: StackResourceDriftInformationSummary -> StackResourceDriftStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>StackResourceDriftInformationSummary</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastCheckTimestamp:StackResourceDriftInformationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDriftInformationSummary_lastCheckTimestamp</a> - When
--   CloudFormation last checked if the resource had drifted from its
--   expected configuration.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackResourceDriftStatus:StackResourceDriftInformationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDriftInformationSummary_stackResourceDriftStatus</a> -
--   Status of the resource's actual configuration compared to its expected
--   configuration
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration in that it has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the
--   resource differs from its expected configuration.Any resources that do
--   not currently support drift detection have a status of
--   <tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>. For more information, see <a>Resources that
--   Support Drift Detection</a>. If you performed an
--   ContinueUpdateRollback operation on a stack, any resources included in
--   <tt>ResourcesToSkip</tt> will also have a status of
--   <tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>. For more information on skipping resources
--   during rollback operations, see <a>Continue Rolling Back an Update</a>
--   in the CloudFormation User Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
newStackResourceDriftInformationSummary :: StackResourceDriftStatus -> StackResourceDriftInformationSummary

-- | When CloudFormation last checked if the resource had drifted from its
--   expected configuration.
stackResourceDriftInformationSummary_lastCheckTimestamp :: Lens' StackResourceDriftInformationSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Status of the resource's actual configuration compared to its expected
--   configuration
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration in that it has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the
--   resource differs from its expected configuration.Any resources that do
--   not currently support drift detection have a status of
--   <tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>. For more information, see <a>Resources that
--   Support Drift Detection</a>. If you performed an
--   ContinueUpdateRollback operation on a stack, any resources included in
--   <tt>ResourcesToSkip</tt> will also have a status of
--   <tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>. For more information on skipping resources
--   during rollback operations, see <a>Continue Rolling Back an Update</a>
--   in the CloudFormation User Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
stackResourceDriftInformationSummary_stackResourceDriftStatus :: Lens' StackResourceDriftInformationSummary StackResourceDriftStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary.StackResourceDriftInformationSummary


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformation

-- | Contains information about whether the resource's actual configuration
--   differs, or has <i>drifted</i>, from its expected configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackResourceDriftInformation</a> smart constructor.
data StackResourceDriftInformation
StackResourceDriftInformation' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> StackResourceDriftStatus -> StackResourceDriftInformation

-- | When CloudFormation last checked if the resource had drifted from its
--   expected configuration.
[$sel:lastCheckTimestamp:StackResourceDriftInformation'] :: StackResourceDriftInformation -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Status of the resource's actual configuration compared to its expected
--   configuration
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration in that it has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the
--   resource differs from its expected configuration.Any resources that do
--   not currently support drift detection have a status of
--   <tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>. For more information, see <a>Resources that
--   Support Drift Detection</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:stackResourceDriftStatus:StackResourceDriftInformation'] :: StackResourceDriftInformation -> StackResourceDriftStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>StackResourceDriftInformation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastCheckTimestamp:StackResourceDriftInformation'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDriftInformation_lastCheckTimestamp</a> - When
--   CloudFormation last checked if the resource had drifted from its
--   expected configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackResourceDriftStatus:StackResourceDriftInformation'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDriftInformation_stackResourceDriftStatus</a> - Status
--   of the resource's actual configuration compared to its expected
--   configuration
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration in that it has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the
--   resource differs from its expected configuration.Any resources that do
--   not currently support drift detection have a status of
--   <tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>. For more information, see <a>Resources that
--   Support Drift Detection</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
newStackResourceDriftInformation :: StackResourceDriftStatus -> StackResourceDriftInformation

-- | When CloudFormation last checked if the resource had drifted from its
--   expected configuration.
stackResourceDriftInformation_lastCheckTimestamp :: Lens' StackResourceDriftInformation (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Status of the resource's actual configuration compared to its expected
--   configuration
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration in that it has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the
--   resource differs from its expected configuration.Any resources that do
--   not currently support drift detection have a status of
--   <tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>. For more information, see <a>Resources that
--   Support Drift Detection</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
stackResourceDriftInformation_stackResourceDriftStatus :: Lens' StackResourceDriftInformation StackResourceDriftStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformation.StackResourceDriftInformation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformation.StackResourceDriftInformation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformation.StackResourceDriftInformation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformation.StackResourceDriftInformation
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformation.StackResourceDriftInformation
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformation.StackResourceDriftInformation
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDriftInformation.StackResourceDriftInformation


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDetail

-- | Contains detailed information about the specified stack resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackResourceDetail</a> smart constructor.
data StackResourceDetail
StackResourceDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe StackResourceDriftInformation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ModuleInfo -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> ISO8601 -> ResourceStatus -> StackResourceDetail

-- | The name associated with the stack.
[$sel:stackName:StackResourceDetail'] :: StackResourceDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about whether the resource's actual configuration differs,
--   or has <i>drifted</i>, from its expected configuration, as defined in
--   the stack template and any values specified as template parameters.
--   For more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration
--   Changes to Stacks and Resources</a>.
[$sel:driftInformation:StackResourceDetail'] :: StackResourceDetail -> Maybe StackResourceDriftInformation

-- | Unique identifier of the stack.
[$sel:stackId:StackResourceDetail'] :: StackResourceDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The content of the <tt>Metadata</tt> attribute declared for the
--   resource. For more information, see <a>Metadata Attribute</a> in the
--   CloudFormation User Guide.
[$sel:metadata:StackResourceDetail'] :: StackResourceDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance
--   ID of a resource supported by CloudFormation.
[$sel:physicalResourceId:StackResourceDetail'] :: StackResourceDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Success/failure message associated with the resource.
[$sel:resourceStatusReason:StackResourceDetail'] :: StackResourceDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains information about the module from which the resource was
--   created, if the resource was created from a module included in the
--   stack template.
[$sel:moduleInfo:StackResourceDetail'] :: StackResourceDetail -> Maybe ModuleInfo

-- | User defined description associated with the resource.
[$sel:description:StackResourceDetail'] :: StackResourceDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The logical name of the resource specified in the template.
[$sel:logicalResourceId:StackResourceDetail'] :: StackResourceDetail -> Text

-- | Type of resource. ((For more information, go to <a>Amazon Web Services
--   Resource Types Reference</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
[$sel:resourceType:StackResourceDetail'] :: StackResourceDetail -> Text

-- | Time the status was updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:StackResourceDetail'] :: StackResourceDetail -> ISO8601

-- | Current status of the resource.
[$sel:resourceStatus:StackResourceDetail'] :: StackResourceDetail -> ResourceStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>StackResourceDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_stackName</a> - The name associated with the
--   stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftInformation:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_driftInformation</a> - Information about
--   whether the resource's actual configuration differs, or has
--   <i>drifted</i>, from its expected configuration, as defined in the
--   stack template and any values specified as template parameters. For
--   more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration Changes
--   to Stacks and Resources</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_stackId</a> - Unique identifier of the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadata:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_metadata</a> - The content of the
--   <tt>Metadata</tt> attribute declared for the resource. For more
--   information, see <a>Metadata Attribute</a> in the CloudFormation User
--   Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:physicalResourceId:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_physicalResourceId</a> - The name or unique
--   identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of a resource
--   supported by CloudFormation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceStatusReason:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_resourceStatusReason</a> - Success/failure
--   message associated with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:moduleInfo:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_moduleInfo</a> - Contains information about the
--   module from which the resource was created, if the resource was
--   created from a module included in the stack template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_description</a> - User defined description
--   associated with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_logicalResourceId</a> - The logical name of the
--   resource specified in the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_resourceType</a> - Type of resource. ((For more
--   information, go to <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types Reference</a>
--   in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_lastUpdatedTimestamp</a> - Time the status was
--   updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceStatus:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_resourceStatus</a> - Current status of the
--   resource.
newStackResourceDetail :: Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> ResourceStatus -> StackResourceDetail

-- | The name associated with the stack.
stackResourceDetail_stackName :: Lens' StackResourceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about whether the resource's actual configuration differs,
--   or has <i>drifted</i>, from its expected configuration, as defined in
--   the stack template and any values specified as template parameters.
--   For more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration
--   Changes to Stacks and Resources</a>.
stackResourceDetail_driftInformation :: Lens' StackResourceDetail (Maybe StackResourceDriftInformation)

-- | Unique identifier of the stack.
stackResourceDetail_stackId :: Lens' StackResourceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The content of the <tt>Metadata</tt> attribute declared for the
--   resource. For more information, see <a>Metadata Attribute</a> in the
--   CloudFormation User Guide.
stackResourceDetail_metadata :: Lens' StackResourceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance
--   ID of a resource supported by CloudFormation.
stackResourceDetail_physicalResourceId :: Lens' StackResourceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Success/failure message associated with the resource.
stackResourceDetail_resourceStatusReason :: Lens' StackResourceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about the module from which the resource was
--   created, if the resource was created from a module included in the
--   stack template.
stackResourceDetail_moduleInfo :: Lens' StackResourceDetail (Maybe ModuleInfo)

-- | User defined description associated with the resource.
stackResourceDetail_description :: Lens' StackResourceDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The logical name of the resource specified in the template.
stackResourceDetail_logicalResourceId :: Lens' StackResourceDetail Text

-- | Type of resource. ((For more information, go to <a>Amazon Web Services
--   Resource Types Reference</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
stackResourceDetail_resourceType :: Lens' StackResourceDetail Text

-- | Time the status was updated.
stackResourceDetail_lastUpdatedTimestamp :: Lens' StackResourceDetail UTCTime

-- | Current status of the resource.
stackResourceDetail_resourceStatus :: Lens' StackResourceDetail ResourceStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDetail.StackResourceDetail
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDetail.StackResourceDetail
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDetail.StackResourceDetail
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDetail.StackResourceDetail
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDetail.StackResourceDetail
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDetail.StackResourceDetail
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDetail.StackResourceDetail


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResource

-- | The StackResource data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackResource</a> smart constructor.
data StackResource
StackResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe StackResourceDriftInformation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ModuleInfo -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> ISO8601 -> ResourceStatus -> StackResource

-- | The name associated with the stack.
[$sel:stackName:StackResource'] :: StackResource -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about whether the resource's actual configuration differs,
--   or has <i>drifted</i>, from its expected configuration, as defined in
--   the stack template and any values specified as template parameters.
--   For more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration
--   Changes to Stacks and Resources</a>.
[$sel:driftInformation:StackResource'] :: StackResource -> Maybe StackResourceDriftInformation

-- | Unique identifier of the stack.
[$sel:stackId:StackResource'] :: StackResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance
--   ID of a resource supported by CloudFormation.
[$sel:physicalResourceId:StackResource'] :: StackResource -> Maybe Text

-- | Success/failure message associated with the resource.
[$sel:resourceStatusReason:StackResource'] :: StackResource -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains information about the module from which the resource was
--   created, if the resource was created from a module included in the
--   stack template.
[$sel:moduleInfo:StackResource'] :: StackResource -> Maybe ModuleInfo

-- | User defined description associated with the resource.
[$sel:description:StackResource'] :: StackResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The logical name of the resource specified in the template.
[$sel:logicalResourceId:StackResource'] :: StackResource -> Text

-- | Type of resource. (For more information, go to <a>Amazon Web Services
--   Resource Types Reference</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
[$sel:resourceType:StackResource'] :: StackResource -> Text

-- | Time the status was updated.
[$sel:timestamp:StackResource'] :: StackResource -> ISO8601

-- | Current status of the resource.
[$sel:resourceStatus:StackResource'] :: StackResource -> ResourceStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>StackResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:StackResource'</a>, <a>stackResource_stackName</a> -
--   The name associated with the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftInformation:StackResource'</a>,
--   <a>stackResource_driftInformation</a> - Information about whether the
--   resource's actual configuration differs, or has <i>drifted</i>, from
--   its expected configuration, as defined in the stack template and any
--   values specified as template parameters. For more information, see
--   <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration Changes to Stacks and
--   Resources</a>.

--   identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of a resource
--   supported by CloudFormation.

--   <a>stackResource_resourceStatusReason</a> - Success/failure message
--   associated with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:moduleInfo:StackResource'</a>, <a>stackResource_moduleInfo</a>
--   - Contains information about the module from which the resource was
--   created, if the resource was created from a module included in the
--   stack template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StackResource'</a>,
--   <a>stackResource_description</a> - User defined description associated
--   with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:StackResource'</a>,
--   <a>stackResource_logicalResourceId</a> - The logical name of the
--   resource specified in the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:StackResource'</a>,

--   <a>stackResource_resourceStatus</a> - Current status of the resource.

module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDrift

-- | Contains the drift information for a resource that has been checked
--   for drift. This includes actual and expected property values for
--   resources in which CloudFormation has detected drift. Only resource
--   properties explicitly defined in the stack template are checked for
--   drift. For more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated
--   Configuration Changes to Stacks and Resources</a>.
--   
--   Resources that do not currently support drift detection cannot be
--   checked. For a list of resources that support drift detection, see
--   <a>Resources that Support Drift Detection</a>.
--   
--   Use DetectStackResourceDrift to detect drift on individual resources,
--   or DetectStackDrift to detect drift on all resources in a given stack
--   that support drift detection.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackResourceDrift</a> smart constructor.
data StackResourceDrift
StackResourceDrift' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ModuleInfo -> Maybe [PropertyDifference] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StackResourceDriftStatus -> ISO8601 -> StackResourceDrift

-- | A JSON structure containing the actual property values of the stack
--   resource.
--   
--   For resources whose <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>, this structure will not be present.
[$sel:actualProperties:StackResourceDrift'] :: StackResourceDrift -> Maybe Text

-- | Context information that enables CloudFormation to uniquely identify a
--   resource. CloudFormation uses context key-value pairs in cases where a
--   resource's logical and physical IDs are not enough to uniquely
--   identify that resource. Each context key-value pair specifies a unique
--   resource that contains the targeted resource.
[$sel:physicalResourceIdContext:StackResourceDrift'] :: StackResourceDrift -> Maybe [PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair]

-- | The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance
--   ID of a resource supported by CloudFormation.
[$sel:physicalResourceId:StackResourceDrift'] :: StackResourceDrift -> Maybe Text

-- | A JSON structure containing the expected property values of the stack
--   resource, as defined in the stack template and any values specified as
--   template parameters.
--   
--   For resources whose <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>, this structure will not be present.
[$sel:expectedProperties:StackResourceDrift'] :: StackResourceDrift -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains information about the module from which the resource was
--   created, if the resource was created from a module included in the
--   stack template.
[$sel:moduleInfo:StackResourceDrift'] :: StackResourceDrift -> Maybe ModuleInfo

-- | A collection of the resource properties whose actual values differ
--   from their expected values. These will be present only for resources
--   whose <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is <tt>MODIFIED</tt>.
[$sel:propertyDifferences:StackResourceDrift'] :: StackResourceDrift -> Maybe [PropertyDifference]

-- | The ID of the stack.
[$sel:stackId:StackResourceDrift'] :: StackResourceDrift -> Text

-- | The logical name of the resource specified in the template.
[$sel:logicalResourceId:StackResourceDrift'] :: StackResourceDrift -> Text

-- | The type of the resource.
[$sel:resourceType:StackResourceDrift'] :: StackResourceDrift -> Text

-- | Status of the resource's actual configuration compared to its expected
--   configuration
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected template
--   configuration because the resource has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: One or more resource properties differ from
--   their expected values (as defined in the stack template and any values
--   specified as template parameters).</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected template configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation does not currently return
--   this value.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:stackResourceDriftStatus:StackResourceDrift'] :: StackResourceDrift -> StackResourceDriftStatus

-- | Time at which CloudFormation performed drift detection on the stack
--   resource.
[$sel:timestamp:StackResourceDrift'] :: StackResourceDrift -> ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>StackResourceDrift</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actualProperties:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_actualProperties</a> - A JSON structure
--   containing the actual property values of the stack resource.
--   
--   For resources whose <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>, this structure will not be present.
--   
--   <a>$sel:physicalResourceIdContext:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_physicalResourceIdContext</a> - Context
--   information that enables CloudFormation to uniquely identify a
--   resource. CloudFormation uses context key-value pairs in cases where a
--   resource's logical and physical IDs are not enough to uniquely
--   identify that resource. Each context key-value pair specifies a unique
--   resource that contains the targeted resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:physicalResourceId:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_physicalResourceId</a> - The name or unique
--   identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of a resource
--   supported by CloudFormation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedProperties:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_expectedProperties</a> - A JSON structure
--   containing the expected property values of the stack resource, as
--   defined in the stack template and any values specified as template
--   parameters.
--   
--   For resources whose <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>, this structure will not be present.
--   
--   <a>$sel:moduleInfo:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_moduleInfo</a> - Contains information about the
--   module from which the resource was created, if the resource was
--   created from a module included in the stack template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyDifferences:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_propertyDifferences</a> - A collection of the
--   resource properties whose actual values differ from their expected
--   values. These will be present only for resources whose
--   <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is <tt>MODIFIED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_stackId</a> - The ID of the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_logicalResourceId</a> - The logical name of the
--   resource specified in the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_resourceType</a> - The type of the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackResourceDriftStatus:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_stackResourceDriftStatus</a> - Status of the
--   resource's actual configuration compared to its expected configuration
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected template
--   configuration because the resource has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: One or more resource properties differ from
--   their expected values (as defined in the stack template and any values
--   specified as template parameters).</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected template configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation does not currently return
--   this value.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_timestamp</a> - Time at which CloudFormation
--   performed drift detection on the stack resource.
newStackResourceDrift :: Text -> Text -> Text -> StackResourceDriftStatus -> UTCTime -> StackResourceDrift

-- | A JSON structure containing the actual property values of the stack
--   resource.
--   
--   For resources whose <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>, this structure will not be present.
stackResourceDrift_actualProperties :: Lens' StackResourceDrift (Maybe Text)

-- | Context information that enables CloudFormation to uniquely identify a
--   resource. CloudFormation uses context key-value pairs in cases where a
--   resource's logical and physical IDs are not enough to uniquely
--   identify that resource. Each context key-value pair specifies a unique
--   resource that contains the targeted resource.
stackResourceDrift_physicalResourceIdContext :: Lens' StackResourceDrift (Maybe [PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair])

-- | The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance
--   ID of a resource supported by CloudFormation.
stackResourceDrift_physicalResourceId :: Lens' StackResourceDrift (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON structure containing the expected property values of the stack
--   resource, as defined in the stack template and any values specified as
--   template parameters.
--   
--   For resources whose <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>, this structure will not be present.
stackResourceDrift_expectedProperties :: Lens' StackResourceDrift (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about the module from which the resource was
--   created, if the resource was created from a module included in the
--   stack template.
stackResourceDrift_moduleInfo :: Lens' StackResourceDrift (Maybe ModuleInfo)

-- | A collection of the resource properties whose actual values differ
--   from their expected values. These will be present only for resources
--   whose <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is <tt>MODIFIED</tt>.
stackResourceDrift_propertyDifferences :: Lens' StackResourceDrift (Maybe [PropertyDifference])

-- | The ID of the stack.
stackResourceDrift_stackId :: Lens' StackResourceDrift Text

-- | The logical name of the resource specified in the template.
stackResourceDrift_logicalResourceId :: Lens' StackResourceDrift Text

-- | The type of the resource.
stackResourceDrift_resourceType :: Lens' StackResourceDrift Text

-- | Status of the resource's actual configuration compared to its expected
--   configuration
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected template
--   configuration because the resource has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: One or more resource properties differ from
--   their expected values (as defined in the stack template and any values
--   specified as template parameters).</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected template configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation does not currently return
--   this value.</li>
--   </ul>
stackResourceDrift_stackResourceDriftStatus :: Lens' StackResourceDrift StackResourceDriftStatus

-- | Time at which CloudFormation performed drift detection on the stack
--   resource.
stackResourceDrift_timestamp :: Lens' StackResourceDrift UTCTime
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDrift.StackResourceDrift
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDrift.StackResourceDrift
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDrift.StackResourceDrift
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDrift.StackResourceDrift
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDrift.StackResourceDrift
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDrift.StackResourceDrift
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceDrift.StackResourceDrift


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceSummary

-- | Contains high-level information about the specified stack resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackResourceSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StackResourceSummary
StackResourceSummary' :: Maybe StackResourceDriftInformationSummary -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ModuleInfo -> Text -> Text -> ISO8601 -> ResourceStatus -> StackResourceSummary

-- | Information about whether the resource's actual configuration differs,
--   or has <i>drifted</i>, from its expected configuration, as defined in
--   the stack template and any values specified as template parameters.
--   For more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration
--   Changes to Stacks and Resources</a>.
[$sel:driftInformation:StackResourceSummary'] :: StackResourceSummary -> Maybe StackResourceDriftInformationSummary

-- | The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance
--   ID of the resource.
[$sel:physicalResourceId:StackResourceSummary'] :: StackResourceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Success/failure message associated with the resource.
[$sel:resourceStatusReason:StackResourceSummary'] :: StackResourceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains information about the module from which the resource was
--   created, if the resource was created from a module included in the
--   stack template.
[$sel:moduleInfo:StackResourceSummary'] :: StackResourceSummary -> Maybe ModuleInfo

-- | The logical name of the resource specified in the template.
[$sel:logicalResourceId:StackResourceSummary'] :: StackResourceSummary -> Text

-- | Type of resource. (For more information, go to <a>Amazon Web Services
--   Resource Types Reference</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
[$sel:resourceType:StackResourceSummary'] :: StackResourceSummary -> Text

-- | Time the status was updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:StackResourceSummary'] :: StackResourceSummary -> ISO8601

-- | Current status of the resource.
[$sel:resourceStatus:StackResourceSummary'] :: StackResourceSummary -> ResourceStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>StackResourceSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftInformation:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_driftInformation</a> - Information about
--   whether the resource's actual configuration differs, or has
--   <i>drifted</i>, from its expected configuration, as defined in the
--   stack template and any values specified as template parameters. For
--   more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration Changes
--   to Stacks and Resources</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:physicalResourceId:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_physicalResourceId</a> - The name or unique
--   identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceStatusReason:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_resourceStatusReason</a> - Success/failure
--   message associated with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:moduleInfo:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_moduleInfo</a> - Contains information about
--   the module from which the resource was created, if the resource was
--   created from a module included in the stack template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_logicalResourceId</a> - The logical name of
--   the resource specified in the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_resourceType</a> - Type of resource. (For more
--   information, go to <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types Reference</a>
--   in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_lastUpdatedTimestamp</a> - Time the status was
--   updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceStatus:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_resourceStatus</a> - Current status of the
--   resource.
newStackResourceSummary :: Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> ResourceStatus -> StackResourceSummary

-- | Information about whether the resource's actual configuration differs,
--   or has <i>drifted</i>, from its expected configuration, as defined in
--   the stack template and any values specified as template parameters.
--   For more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration
--   Changes to Stacks and Resources</a>.
stackResourceSummary_driftInformation :: Lens' StackResourceSummary (Maybe StackResourceDriftInformationSummary)

-- | The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance
--   ID of the resource.
stackResourceSummary_physicalResourceId :: Lens' StackResourceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Success/failure message associated with the resource.
stackResourceSummary_resourceStatusReason :: Lens' StackResourceSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about the module from which the resource was
--   created, if the resource was created from a module included in the
--   stack template.
stackResourceSummary_moduleInfo :: Lens' StackResourceSummary (Maybe ModuleInfo)

-- | The logical name of the resource specified in the template.
stackResourceSummary_logicalResourceId :: Lens' StackResourceSummary Text

-- | Type of resource. (For more information, go to <a>Amazon Web Services
--   Resource Types Reference</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
stackResourceSummary_resourceType :: Lens' StackResourceSummary Text

-- | Time the status was updated.
stackResourceSummary_lastUpdatedTimestamp :: Lens' StackResourceSummary UTCTime

-- | Current status of the resource.
stackResourceSummary_resourceStatus :: Lens' StackResourceSummary ResourceStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceSummary.StackResourceSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceSummary.StackResourceSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceSummary.StackResourceSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceSummary.StackResourceSummary
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceSummary.StackResourceSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceSummary.StackResourceSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackResourceSummary.StackResourceSummary
