module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetDriftDetectionDetails

-- | Detailed information about the drift status of the stack set.
--   
--   For stack sets, contains information about the last <i>completed</i>
--   drift operation performed on the stack set. Information about drift
--   operations in-progress is not included.
--   
--   For stack set operations, includes information about drift operations
--   currently being performed on the stack set.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Detecting Unmanaged Changes in Stack
--   Sets</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSetDriftDetectionDetails</a> smart constructor.
data StackSetDriftDetectionDetails
StackSetDriftDetectionDetails' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe StackSetDriftStatus -> Maybe StackSetDriftDetectionStatus -> Maybe Natural -> StackSetDriftDetectionDetails

-- | The number of stack instances which match the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set.
[$sel:inSyncStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'] :: StackSetDriftDetectionDetails -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of stack instances for which the drift detection operation
--   failed.
[$sel:failedStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'] :: StackSetDriftDetectionDetails -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of stack instances that have drifted from the expected
--   template and parameter configuration of the stack set. A stack
--   instance is considered to have drifted if one or more of the resources
--   in the associated stack do not match their expected configuration.
[$sel:driftedStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'] :: StackSetDriftDetectionDetails -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of stack instances that are currently being checked for
--   drift.
[$sel:inProgressStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'] :: StackSetDriftDetectionDetails -> Maybe Natural

-- | Most recent time when CloudFormation performed a drift detection
--   operation on the stack set. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for any
--   stack set on which drift detection has not yet been performed.
[$sel:lastDriftCheckTimestamp:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'] :: StackSetDriftDetectionDetails -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Status of the stack set's actual configuration compared to its
--   expected template and parameter configuration. A stack set is
--   considered to have drifted if one or more of its stack instances have
--   drifted from their expected template and parameter configuration.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: One or more of the stack instances belonging to
--   the stack set stack differs from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration. A stack instance is considered to have drifted if one
--   or more of the resources in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked the stack set
--   for drift.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: All of the stack instances belonging to the
--   stack set stack match from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:driftStatus:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'] :: StackSetDriftDetectionDetails -> Maybe StackSetDriftStatus

-- | The status of the stack set drift detection operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLETED</tt>: The drift detection operation completed
--   without failing on any stack instances.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The drift detection operation exceeded the
--   specified failure tolerance.</li>
--   <li><tt>PARTIAL_SUCCESS</tt>: The drift detection operation completed
--   without exceeding the failure tolerance for the operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>: The drift detection operation is currently
--   being performed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt>: The user has cancelled the drift detection
--   operation.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:driftDetectionStatus:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'] :: StackSetDriftDetectionDetails -> Maybe StackSetDriftDetectionStatus

-- | The total number of stack instances belonging to this stack set.
--   
--   The total number of stack instances is equal to the total of:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Stack instances that match the stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li>Stack instances that have drifted from the stack set
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li>Stack instances where the drift detection operation has
--   failed.</li>
--   <li>Stack instances currently being checked for drift.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:totalStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'] :: StackSetDriftDetectionDetails -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSetDriftDetectionDetails</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inSyncStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_inSyncStackInstancesCount</a> - The
--   number of stack instances which match the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_failedStackInstancesCount</a> - The
--   number of stack instances for which the drift detection operation
--   failed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftedStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_driftedStackInstancesCount</a> - The
--   number of stack instances that have drifted from the expected template
--   and parameter configuration of the stack set. A stack instance is
--   considered to have drifted if one or more of the resources in the
--   associated stack do not match their expected configuration.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:inProgressStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_inProgressStackInstancesCount</a> -
--   The number of stack instances that are currently being checked for
--   drift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastDriftCheckTimestamp:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_lastDriftCheckTimestamp</a> - Most
--   recent time when CloudFormation performed a drift detection operation
--   on the stack set. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for any stack set
--   on which drift detection has not yet been performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftStatus:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_driftStatus</a> - Status of the stack
--   set's actual configuration compared to its expected template and
--   parameter configuration. A stack set is considered to have drifted if
--   one or more of its stack instances have drifted from their expected
--   template and parameter configuration.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: One or more of the stack instances belonging to
--   the stack set stack differs from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration. A stack instance is considered to have drifted if one
--   or more of the resources in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked the stack set
--   for drift.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: All of the stack instances belonging to the
--   stack set stack match from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftDetectionStatus:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_driftDetectionStatus</a> - The status
--   of the stack set drift detection operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLETED</tt>: The drift detection operation completed
--   without failing on any stack instances.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The drift detection operation exceeded the
--   specified failure tolerance.</li>
--   <li><tt>PARTIAL_SUCCESS</tt>: The drift detection operation completed
--   without exceeding the failure tolerance for the operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>: The drift detection operation is currently
--   being performed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt>: The user has cancelled the drift detection
--   operation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_totalStackInstancesCount</a> - The
--   total number of stack instances belonging to this stack set.
--   
--   The total number of stack instances is equal to the total of:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Stack instances that match the stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li>Stack instances that have drifted from the stack set
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li>Stack instances where the drift detection operation has
--   failed.</li>
--   <li>Stack instances currently being checked for drift.</li>
--   </ul>
newStackSetDriftDetectionDetails :: StackSetDriftDetectionDetails

-- | The number of stack instances which match the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set.
stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_inSyncStackInstancesCount :: Lens' StackSetDriftDetectionDetails (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of stack instances for which the drift detection operation
--   failed.
stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_failedStackInstancesCount :: Lens' StackSetDriftDetectionDetails (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of stack instances that have drifted from the expected
--   template and parameter configuration of the stack set. A stack
--   instance is considered to have drifted if one or more of the resources
--   in the associated stack do not match their expected configuration.
stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_driftedStackInstancesCount :: Lens' StackSetDriftDetectionDetails (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of stack instances that are currently being checked for
--   drift.
stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_inProgressStackInstancesCount :: Lens' StackSetDriftDetectionDetails (Maybe Natural)

-- | Most recent time when CloudFormation performed a drift detection
--   operation on the stack set. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for any
--   stack set on which drift detection has not yet been performed.
stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_lastDriftCheckTimestamp :: Lens' StackSetDriftDetectionDetails (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Status of the stack set's actual configuration compared to its
--   expected template and parameter configuration. A stack set is
--   considered to have drifted if one or more of its stack instances have
--   drifted from their expected template and parameter configuration.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: One or more of the stack instances belonging to
--   the stack set stack differs from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration. A stack instance is considered to have drifted if one
--   or more of the resources in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked the stack set
--   for drift.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: All of the stack instances belonging to the
--   stack set stack match from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_driftStatus :: Lens' StackSetDriftDetectionDetails (Maybe StackSetDriftStatus)

-- | The status of the stack set drift detection operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLETED</tt>: The drift detection operation completed
--   without failing on any stack instances.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The drift detection operation exceeded the
--   specified failure tolerance.</li>
--   <li><tt>PARTIAL_SUCCESS</tt>: The drift detection operation completed
--   without exceeding the failure tolerance for the operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>: The drift detection operation is currently
--   being performed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt>: The user has cancelled the drift detection
--   operation.</li>
--   </ul>
stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_driftDetectionStatus :: Lens' StackSetDriftDetectionDetails (Maybe StackSetDriftDetectionStatus)

-- | The total number of stack instances belonging to this stack set.
--   
--   The total number of stack instances is equal to the total of:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Stack instances that match the stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li>Stack instances that have drifted from the stack set
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li>Stack instances where the drift detection operation has
--   failed.</li>
--   <li>Stack instances currently being checked for drift.</li>
--   </ul>
stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_totalStackInstancesCount :: Lens' StackSetDriftDetectionDetails (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetDriftDetectionDetails.StackSetDriftDetectionDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetDriftDetectionDetails.StackSetDriftDetectionDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetDriftDetectionDetails.StackSetDriftDetectionDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetDriftDetectionDetails.StackSetDriftDetectionDetails

module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationPreferences

-- | The user-specified preferences for how CloudFormation performs a stack
--   set operation.
--   
--   For more information on maximum concurrent accounts and failure
--   tolerance, see <a>Stack set operation options</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSetOperationPreferences</a> smart constructor.
data StackSetOperationPreferences
StackSetOperationPreferences' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe RegionConcurrencyType -> StackSetOperationPreferences

-- | The maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this operation
--   at one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, CloudFormation rounds down to the next whole number. This
--   is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero. In
--   this case, CloudFormation sets the number as one instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the <i>maximum</i> for
--   operations. For large deployments, under certain circumstances the
--   actual number of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to
--   service throttling.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>MaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>MaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   By default, <tt>1</tt> is specified.
[$sel:maxConcurrentPercentage:StackSetOperationPreferences'] :: StackSetOperationPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | The order of the Regions in where you want to perform the stack
--   operation.
[$sel:regionOrder:StackSetOperationPreferences'] :: StackSetOperationPreferences -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The number of accounts, per Region, for which this operation can fail
--   before CloudFormation stops the operation in that Region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a Region, CloudFormation doesn't attempt the
--   operation in any subsequent Regions.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>FailureTolerancePercentage</tt> (but not both).
--   
--   By default, <tt>0</tt> is specified.
[$sel:failureToleranceCount:StackSetOperationPreferences'] :: StackSetOperationPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | The maximum number of accounts in which to perform this operation at
--   one time. This is dependent on the value of
--   <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt>. <tt>MaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most
--   one more than the <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the <i>maximum</i> for
--   operations. For large deployments, under certain circumstances the
--   actual number of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to
--   service throttling.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>MaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>MaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   By default, <tt>1</tt> is specified.
[$sel:maxConcurrentCount:StackSetOperationPreferences'] :: StackSetOperationPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | The percentage of accounts, per Region, for which this stack operation
--   can fail before CloudFormation stops the operation in that Region. If
--   the operation is stopped in a Region, CloudFormation doesn't attempt
--   the operation in any subsequent Regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, CloudFormation rounds <i>down</i> to the next whole
--   number.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>FailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   By default, <tt>0</tt> is specified.
[$sel:failureTolerancePercentage:StackSetOperationPreferences'] :: StackSetOperationPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | The concurrency type of deploying StackSets operations in Regions,
--   could be in parallel or one Region at a time.
[$sel:regionConcurrencyType:StackSetOperationPreferences'] :: StackSetOperationPreferences -> Maybe RegionConcurrencyType

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSetOperationPreferences</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxConcurrentPercentage:StackSetOperationPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationPreferences_maxConcurrentPercentage</a> - The
--   maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this operation at
--   one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, CloudFormation rounds down to the next whole number. This
--   is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero. In
--   this case, CloudFormation sets the number as one instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the <i>maximum</i> for
--   operations. For large deployments, under certain circumstances the
--   actual number of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to
--   service throttling.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>MaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>MaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   By default, <tt>1</tt> is specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:regionOrder:StackSetOperationPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationPreferences_regionOrder</a> - The order of the
--   Regions in where you want to perform the stack operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureToleranceCount:StackSetOperationPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationPreferences_failureToleranceCount</a> - The number
--   of accounts, per Region, for which this operation can fail before
--   CloudFormation stops the operation in that Region. If the operation is
--   stopped in a Region, CloudFormation doesn't attempt the operation in
--   any subsequent Regions.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>FailureTolerancePercentage</tt> (but not both).
--   
--   By default, <tt>0</tt> is specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxConcurrentCount:StackSetOperationPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationPreferences_maxConcurrentCount</a> - The maximum
--   number of accounts in which to perform this operation at one time.
--   This is dependent on the value of <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   <tt>MaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most one more than the
--   <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the <i>maximum</i> for
--   operations. For large deployments, under certain circumstances the
--   actual number of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to
--   service throttling.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>MaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>MaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   By default, <tt>1</tt> is specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureTolerancePercentage:StackSetOperationPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationPreferences_failureTolerancePercentage</a> - The
--   percentage of accounts, per Region, for which this stack operation can
--   fail before CloudFormation stops the operation in that Region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a Region, CloudFormation doesn't attempt the
--   operation in any subsequent Regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, CloudFormation rounds <i>down</i> to the next whole
--   number.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>FailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   By default, <tt>0</tt> is specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:regionConcurrencyType:StackSetOperationPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationPreferences_regionConcurrencyType</a> - The
--   concurrency type of deploying StackSets operations in Regions, could
--   be in parallel or one Region at a time.
newStackSetOperationPreferences :: StackSetOperationPreferences

-- | The maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this operation
--   at one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, CloudFormation rounds down to the next whole number. This
--   is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero. In
--   this case, CloudFormation sets the number as one instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the <i>maximum</i> for
--   operations. For large deployments, under certain circumstances the
--   actual number of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to
--   service throttling.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>MaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>MaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   By default, <tt>1</tt> is specified.
stackSetOperationPreferences_maxConcurrentPercentage :: Lens' StackSetOperationPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The order of the Regions in where you want to perform the stack
--   operation.
stackSetOperationPreferences_regionOrder :: Lens' StackSetOperationPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | The number of accounts, per Region, for which this operation can fail
--   before CloudFormation stops the operation in that Region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a Region, CloudFormation doesn't attempt the
--   operation in any subsequent Regions.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>FailureTolerancePercentage</tt> (but not both).
--   
--   By default, <tt>0</tt> is specified.
stackSetOperationPreferences_failureToleranceCount :: Lens' StackSetOperationPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The maximum number of accounts in which to perform this operation at
--   one time. This is dependent on the value of
--   <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt>. <tt>MaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most
--   one more than the <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the <i>maximum</i> for
--   operations. For large deployments, under certain circumstances the
--   actual number of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to
--   service throttling.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>MaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>MaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   By default, <tt>1</tt> is specified.
stackSetOperationPreferences_maxConcurrentCount :: Lens' StackSetOperationPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The percentage of accounts, per Region, for which this stack operation
--   can fail before CloudFormation stops the operation in that Region. If
--   the operation is stopped in a Region, CloudFormation doesn't attempt
--   the operation in any subsequent Regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, CloudFormation rounds <i>down</i> to the next whole
--   number.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>FailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   By default, <tt>0</tt> is specified.
stackSetOperationPreferences_failureTolerancePercentage :: Lens' StackSetOperationPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The concurrency type of deploying StackSets operations in Regions,
--   could be in parallel or one Region at a time.
stackSetOperationPreferences_regionConcurrencyType :: Lens' StackSetOperationPreferences (Maybe RegionConcurrencyType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationPreferences.StackSetOperationPreferences
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationPreferences.StackSetOperationPreferences
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationPreferences.StackSetOperationPreferences
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationPreferences.StackSetOperationPreferences

module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationResultSummary

-- | The structure that contains information about a specified operation's
--   results for a given account in a given Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSetOperationResultSummary</a> smart
--   constructor.
data StackSetOperationResultSummary
StackSetOperationResultSummary' :: Maybe AccountGateResult -> Maybe StackSetOperationResultStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StackSetOperationResultSummary

-- | The results of the account gate function CloudFormation invokes, if
--   present, before proceeding with stack set operations in an account
[$sel:accountGateResult:StackSetOperationResultSummary'] :: StackSetOperationResultSummary -> Maybe AccountGateResult

-- | The result status of the stack set operation for the given account in
--   the given Region.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CANCELLED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region has been cancelled. This is either because a user has stopped
--   the stack set operation, or because the failure tolerance of the stack
--   set operation has been exceeded.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and Region
--   failed.If the stack set operation fails in enough accounts within a
--   Region, the failure tolerance for the stack set operation as a whole
--   might be exceeded.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region is currently in progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region has yet to start.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region completed successfully.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:StackSetOperationResultSummary'] :: StackSetOperationResultSummary -> Maybe StackSetOperationResultStatus

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> The organization root ID or
--   organizational unit (OU) IDs that you specified for
--   <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:organizationalUnitId:StackSetOperationResultSummary'] :: StackSetOperationResultSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Self-managed permissions</i> The name of the Amazon Web
--   Services account for this operation result.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:account:StackSetOperationResultSummary'] :: StackSetOperationResultSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Amazon Web Services Region for this operation result.
[$sel:region:StackSetOperationResultSummary'] :: StackSetOperationResultSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The reason for the assigned result status.
[$sel:statusReason:StackSetOperationResultSummary'] :: StackSetOperationResultSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSetOperationResultSummary</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountGateResult:StackSetOperationResultSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationResultSummary_accountGateResult</a> - The results
--   of the account gate function CloudFormation invokes, if present,
--   before proceeding with stack set operations in an account
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackSetOperationResultSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationResultSummary_status</a> - The result status of
--   the stack set operation for the given account in the given Region.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CANCELLED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region has been cancelled. This is either because a user has stopped
--   the stack set operation, or because the failure tolerance of the stack
--   set operation has been exceeded.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and Region
--   failed.If the stack set operation fails in enough accounts within a
--   Region, the failure tolerance for the stack set operation as a whole
--   might be exceeded.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region is currently in progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region has yet to start.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region completed successfully.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitId:StackSetOperationResultSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationResultSummary_organizationalUnitId</a> -
--   [Service-managed permissions] The organization root ID or
--   organizational unit (OU) IDs that you specified for
--   <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:account:StackSetOperationResultSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationResultSummary_account</a> - [Self-managed
--   permissions] The name of the Amazon Web Services account for this
--   operation result.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:StackSetOperationResultSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationResultSummary_region</a> - The name of the Amazon
--   Web Services Region for this operation result.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusReason:StackSetOperationResultSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationResultSummary_statusReason</a> - The reason for
--   the assigned result status.
newStackSetOperationResultSummary :: StackSetOperationResultSummary

-- | The results of the account gate function CloudFormation invokes, if
--   present, before proceeding with stack set operations in an account
stackSetOperationResultSummary_accountGateResult :: Lens' StackSetOperationResultSummary (Maybe AccountGateResult)

-- | The result status of the stack set operation for the given account in
--   the given Region.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CANCELLED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region has been cancelled. This is either because a user has stopped
--   the stack set operation, or because the failure tolerance of the stack
--   set operation has been exceeded.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and Region
--   failed.If the stack set operation fails in enough accounts within a
--   Region, the failure tolerance for the stack set operation as a whole
--   might be exceeded.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region is currently in progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region has yet to start.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region completed successfully.</li>
--   </ul>
stackSetOperationResultSummary_status :: Lens' StackSetOperationResultSummary (Maybe StackSetOperationResultStatus)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> The organization root ID or
--   organizational unit (OU) IDs that you specified for
--   <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
stackSetOperationResultSummary_organizationalUnitId :: Lens' StackSetOperationResultSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Self-managed permissions</i> The name of the Amazon Web
--   Services account for this operation result.</li>
--   </ul>
stackSetOperationResultSummary_account :: Lens' StackSetOperationResultSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon Web Services Region for this operation result.
stackSetOperationResultSummary_region :: Lens' StackSetOperationResultSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The reason for the assigned result status.
stackSetOperationResultSummary_statusReason :: Lens' StackSetOperationResultSummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationResultSummary.StackSetOperationResultSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationResultSummary.StackSetOperationResultSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationResultSummary.StackSetOperationResultSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationResultSummary.StackSetOperationResultSummary
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationResultSummary.StackSetOperationResultSummary

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationResultSummary.StackSetOperationResultSummary


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationStatus
newtype StackSetOperationStatus
StackSetOperationStatus' :: Text -> StackSetOperationStatus
[fromStackSetOperationStatus] :: StackSetOperationStatus -> Text
pattern StackSetOperationStatus_FAILED :: StackSetOperationStatus
pattern StackSetOperationStatus_QUEUED :: StackSetOperationStatus
pattern StackSetOperationStatus_RUNNING :: StackSetOperationStatus
pattern StackSetOperationStatus_STOPPED :: StackSetOperationStatus
pattern StackSetOperationStatus_STOPPING :: StackSetOperationStatus
pattern StackSetOperationStatus_SUCCEEDED :: StackSetOperationStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationStatus.StackSetOperationStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationStatus.StackSetOperationStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationStatus.StackSetOperationStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationStatus.StackSetOperationStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationStatus.StackSetOperationStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationStatus.StackSetOperationStatus

instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationStatus.StackSetOperationStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationStatus.StackSetOperationStatus

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationStatus.StackSetOperationStatus


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperation

-- | The structure that contains information about a stack set operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSetOperation</a> smart constructor.
data StackSetOperation
StackSetOperation' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe StackSetOperationStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe DeploymentTargets -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackSetOperationPreferences -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackSetDriftDetectionDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackSetOperationAction -> Maybe Bool -> StackSetOperation

-- | The time at which the operation was initiated. Note that the creation
--   times for the stack set operation might differ from the creation time
--   of the individual stacks themselves. This is because CloudFormation
--   needs to perform preparatory work for the operation, such as
--   dispatching the work to the requested Regions, before actually
--   creating the first stacks.
[$sel:creationTimestamp:StackSetOperation'] :: StackSetOperation -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The status of the operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The operation exceeded the specified failure
--   tolerance. The failure tolerance value that you've set for an
--   operation is applied for each Region during stack create and update
--   operations. If the number of failed stacks within a Region exceeds the
--   failure tolerance, the status of the operation in the Region is set to
--   <tt>FAILED</tt>. This in turn sets the status of the operation as a
--   whole to <tt>FAILED</tt>, and CloudFormation cancels the operation in
--   any remaining Regions.</li>
--   <li><tt>QUEUED</tt>: [Service-managed permissions] For automatic
--   deployments that require a sequence of operations, the operation is
--   queued to be performed. For more information, see the <a>stack set
--   operation status codes</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>: The operation is currently being performed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt>: The user has cancelled the operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt>: The operation is in the process of stopping, at
--   user request.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The operation completed creating or updating
--   all the specified stacks without exceeding the failure tolerance for
--   the operation.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:StackSetOperation'] :: StackSetOperation -> Maybe StackSetOperationStatus

-- | The name of the IAM execution role used to create or update the stack
--   set.
--   
--   Use customized execution roles to control which stack resources users
--   and groups can include in their stack sets.
[$sel:executionRoleName:StackSetOperation'] :: StackSetOperation -> Maybe Text

-- | The time at which the stack set operation ended, across all accounts
--   and Regions specified. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean that
--   the stack set operation was successful, or even attempted, in each
--   account or Region.
[$sel:endTimestamp:StackSetOperation'] :: StackSetOperation -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> The Organizations accounts
--   affected by the stack operation.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:deploymentTargets:StackSetOperation'] :: StackSetOperation -> Maybe DeploymentTargets

-- | The unique ID of a stack set operation.
[$sel:operationId:StackSetOperation'] :: StackSetOperation -> Maybe Text

-- | The preferences for how CloudFormation performs this stack set
--   operation.
[$sel:operationPreferences:StackSetOperation'] :: StackSetOperation -> Maybe StackSetOperationPreferences

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the IAM role used to perform this
--   stack set operation.
--   
--   Use customized administrator roles to control which users or groups
--   can manage specific stack sets within the same administrator account.
--   For more information, see <a>Define Permissions for Multiple
--   Administrators</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
[$sel:administrationRoleARN:StackSetOperation'] :: StackSetOperation -> Maybe Text

-- | Detailed information about the drift status of the stack set. This
--   includes information about drift operations currently being performed
--   on the stack set.
--   
--   this information will only be present for stack set operations whose
--   <tt>Action</tt> type is <tt>DETECT_DRIFT</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Detecting Unmanaged Changes in Stack
--   Sets</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.
[$sel:stackSetDriftDetectionDetails:StackSetOperation'] :: StackSetOperation -> Maybe StackSetDriftDetectionDetails

-- | The ID of the stack set.
[$sel:stackSetId:StackSetOperation'] :: StackSetOperation -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of stack set operation: <tt>CREATE</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>, or
--   <tt>DELETE</tt>. Create and delete operations affect only the
--   specified stack set instances that are associated with the specified
--   stack set. Update operations affect both the stack set itself, as well
--   as <i>all</i> associated stack set instances.
[$sel:action:StackSetOperation'] :: StackSetOperation -> Maybe StackSetOperationAction

-- | For stack set operations of action type <tt>DELETE</tt>, specifies
--   whether to remove the stack instances from the specified stack set,
--   but doesn't delete the stacks. You can't reassociate a retained stack,
--   or add an existing, saved stack to a new stack set.
[$sel:retainStacks:StackSetOperation'] :: StackSetOperation -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSetOperation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTimestamp:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_creationTimestamp</a> - The time at which the
--   operation was initiated. Note that the creation times for the stack
--   set operation might differ from the creation time of the individual
--   stacks themselves. This is because CloudFormation needs to perform
--   preparatory work for the operation, such as dispatching the work to
--   the requested Regions, before actually creating the first stacks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackSetOperation'</a>, <a>stackSetOperation_status</a>
--   - The status of the operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The operation exceeded the specified failure
--   tolerance. The failure tolerance value that you've set for an
--   operation is applied for each Region during stack create and update
--   operations. If the number of failed stacks within a Region exceeds the
--   failure tolerance, the status of the operation in the Region is set to
--   <tt>FAILED</tt>. This in turn sets the status of the operation as a
--   whole to <tt>FAILED</tt>, and CloudFormation cancels the operation in
--   any remaining Regions.</li>
--   <li><tt>QUEUED</tt>: [Service-managed permissions] For automatic
--   deployments that require a sequence of operations, the operation is
--   queued to be performed. For more information, see the <a>stack set
--   operation status codes</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>: The operation is currently being performed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt>: The user has cancelled the operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt>: The operation is in the process of stopping, at
--   user request.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The operation completed creating or updating
--   all the specified stacks without exceeding the failure tolerance for
--   the operation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionRoleName:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_executionRoleName</a> - The name of the IAM
--   execution role used to create or update the stack set.
--   
--   Use customized execution roles to control which stack resources users
--   and groups can include in their stack sets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTimestamp:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_endTimestamp</a> - The time at which the stack
--   set operation ended, across all accounts and Regions specified. Note
--   that this doesn't necessarily mean that the stack set operation was
--   successful, or even attempted, in each account or Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploymentTargets:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_deploymentTargets</a> - [Service-managed
--   permissions] The Organizations accounts affected by the stack
--   operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operationId:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_operationId</a> - The unique ID of a stack set
--   operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operationPreferences:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_operationPreferences</a> - The preferences for
--   how CloudFormation performs this stack set operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:administrationRoleARN:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_administrationRoleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Number (ARN) of the IAM role used to perform this stack set operation.
--   
--   Use customized administrator roles to control which users or groups
--   can manage specific stack sets within the same administrator account.
--   For more information, see <a>Define Permissions for Multiple
--   Administrators</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetDriftDetectionDetails:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_stackSetDriftDetectionDetails</a> - Detailed
--   information about the drift status of the stack set. This includes
--   information about drift operations currently being performed on the
--   stack set.
--   
--   this information will only be present for stack set operations whose
--   <tt>Action</tt> type is <tt>DETECT_DRIFT</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Detecting Unmanaged Changes in Stack
--   Sets</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetId:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_stackSetId</a> - The ID of the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:StackSetOperation'</a>, <a>stackSetOperation_action</a>
--   - The type of stack set operation: <tt>CREATE</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>,
--   or <tt>DELETE</tt>. Create and delete operations affect only the
--   specified stack set instances that are associated with the specified
--   stack set. Update operations affect both the stack set itself, as well
--   as <i>all</i> associated stack set instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retainStacks:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_retainStacks</a> - For stack set operations of
--   action type <tt>DELETE</tt>, specifies whether to remove the stack
--   instances from the specified stack set, but doesn't delete the stacks.
--   You can't reassociate a retained stack, or add an existing, saved
--   stack to a new stack set.
newStackSetOperation :: StackSetOperation

-- | The time at which the operation was initiated. Note that the creation
--   times for the stack set operation might differ from the creation time
--   of the individual stacks themselves. This is because CloudFormation
--   needs to perform preparatory work for the operation, such as
--   dispatching the work to the requested Regions, before actually
--   creating the first stacks.
stackSetOperation_creationTimestamp :: Lens' StackSetOperation (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The status of the operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The operation exceeded the specified failure
--   tolerance. The failure tolerance value that you've set for an
--   operation is applied for each Region during stack create and update
--   operations. If the number of failed stacks within a Region exceeds the
--   failure tolerance, the status of the operation in the Region is set to
--   <tt>FAILED</tt>. This in turn sets the status of the operation as a
--   whole to <tt>FAILED</tt>, and CloudFormation cancels the operation in
--   any remaining Regions.</li>
--   <li><tt>QUEUED</tt>: [Service-managed permissions] For automatic
--   deployments that require a sequence of operations, the operation is
--   queued to be performed. For more information, see the <a>stack set
--   operation status codes</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>: The operation is currently being performed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt>: The user has cancelled the operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt>: The operation is in the process of stopping, at
--   user request.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The operation completed creating or updating
--   all the specified stacks without exceeding the failure tolerance for
--   the operation.</li>
--   </ul>
stackSetOperation_status :: Lens' StackSetOperation (Maybe StackSetOperationStatus)

-- | The name of the IAM execution role used to create or update the stack
--   set.
--   
--   Use customized execution roles to control which stack resources users
--   and groups can include in their stack sets.
stackSetOperation_executionRoleName :: Lens' StackSetOperation (Maybe Text)

-- | The time at which the stack set operation ended, across all accounts
--   and Regions specified. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean that
--   the stack set operation was successful, or even attempted, in each
--   account or Region.
stackSetOperation_endTimestamp :: Lens' StackSetOperation (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> The Organizations accounts
--   affected by the stack operation.</li>
--   </ul>
stackSetOperation_deploymentTargets :: Lens' StackSetOperation (Maybe DeploymentTargets)

-- | The unique ID of a stack set operation.
stackSetOperation_operationId :: Lens' StackSetOperation (Maybe Text)

-- | The preferences for how CloudFormation performs this stack set
--   operation.
stackSetOperation_operationPreferences :: Lens' StackSetOperation (Maybe StackSetOperationPreferences)

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the IAM role used to perform this
--   stack set operation.
--   
--   Use customized administrator roles to control which users or groups
--   can manage specific stack sets within the same administrator account.
--   For more information, see <a>Define Permissions for Multiple
--   Administrators</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
stackSetOperation_administrationRoleARN :: Lens' StackSetOperation (Maybe Text)

-- | Detailed information about the drift status of the stack set. This
--   includes information about drift operations currently being performed
--   on the stack set.
--   
--   this information will only be present for stack set operations whose
--   <tt>Action</tt> type is <tt>DETECT_DRIFT</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Detecting Unmanaged Changes in Stack
--   Sets</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.
stackSetOperation_stackSetDriftDetectionDetails :: Lens' StackSetOperation (Maybe StackSetDriftDetectionDetails)

-- | The ID of the stack set.
stackSetOperation_stackSetId :: Lens' StackSetOperation (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of stack set operation: <tt>CREATE</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>, or
--   <tt>DELETE</tt>. Create and delete operations affect only the
--   specified stack set instances that are associated with the specified
--   stack set. Update operations affect both the stack set itself, as well
--   as <i>all</i> associated stack set instances.
stackSetOperation_action :: Lens' StackSetOperation (Maybe StackSetOperationAction)

-- | For stack set operations of action type <tt>DELETE</tt>, specifies
--   whether to remove the stack instances from the specified stack set,
--   but doesn't delete the stacks. You can't reassociate a retained stack,
--   or add an existing, saved stack to a new stack set.
stackSetOperation_retainStacks :: Lens' StackSetOperation (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperation.StackSetOperation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperation.StackSetOperation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperation.StackSetOperation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperation.StackSetOperation
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperation.StackSetOperation
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperation.StackSetOperation
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperation.StackSetOperation


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationSummary

-- | The structures that contain summary information about the specified
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSetOperationSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StackSetOperationSummary
StackSetOperationSummary' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe StackSetOperationStatus -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackSetOperationAction -> StackSetOperationSummary

-- | The time at which the operation was initiated. Note that the creation
--   times for the stack set operation might differ from the creation time
--   of the individual stacks themselves. This is because CloudFormation
--   needs to perform preparatory work for the operation, such as
--   dispatching the work to the requested Regions, before actually
--   creating the first stacks.
[$sel:creationTimestamp:StackSetOperationSummary'] :: StackSetOperationSummary -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The overall status of the operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The operation exceeded the specified failure
--   tolerance. The failure tolerance value that you've set for an
--   operation is applied for each Region during stack create and update
--   operations. If the number of failed stacks within a Region exceeds the
--   failure tolerance, the status of the operation in the Region is set to
--   <tt>FAILED</tt>. This in turn sets the status of the operation as a
--   whole to <tt>FAILED</tt>, and CloudFormation cancels the operation in
--   any remaining Regions.</li>
--   <li><tt>QUEUED</tt>: [Service-managed permissions] For automatic
--   deployments that require a sequence of operations, the operation is
--   queued to be performed. For more information, see the <a>stack set
--   operation status codes</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>: The operation is currently being performed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt>: The user has cancelled the operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt>: The operation is in the process of stopping, at
--   user request.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The operation completed creating or updating
--   all the specified stacks without exceeding the failure tolerance for
--   the operation.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:StackSetOperationSummary'] :: StackSetOperationSummary -> Maybe StackSetOperationStatus

-- | The time at which the stack set operation ended, across all accounts
--   and Regions specified. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean that
--   the stack set operation was successful, or even attempted, in each
--   account or Region.
[$sel:endTimestamp:StackSetOperationSummary'] :: StackSetOperationSummary -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The unique ID of the stack set operation.
[$sel:operationId:StackSetOperationSummary'] :: StackSetOperationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of operation: <tt>CREATE</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>, or
--   <tt>DELETE</tt>. Create and delete operations affect only the
--   specified stack instances that are associated with the specified stack
--   set. Update operations affect both the stack set itself as well as
--   <i>all</i> associated stack set instances.
[$sel:action:StackSetOperationSummary'] :: StackSetOperationSummary -> Maybe StackSetOperationAction

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSetOperationSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTimestamp:StackSetOperationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationSummary_creationTimestamp</a> - The time at which
--   the operation was initiated. Note that the creation times for the
--   stack set operation might differ from the creation time of the
--   individual stacks themselves. This is because CloudFormation needs to
--   perform preparatory work for the operation, such as dispatching the
--   work to the requested Regions, before actually creating the first
--   stacks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackSetOperationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationSummary_status</a> - The overall status of the
--   operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The operation exceeded the specified failure
--   tolerance. The failure tolerance value that you've set for an
--   operation is applied for each Region during stack create and update
--   operations. If the number of failed stacks within a Region exceeds the
--   failure tolerance, the status of the operation in the Region is set to
--   <tt>FAILED</tt>. This in turn sets the status of the operation as a
--   whole to <tt>FAILED</tt>, and CloudFormation cancels the operation in
--   any remaining Regions.</li>
--   <li><tt>QUEUED</tt>: [Service-managed permissions] For automatic
--   deployments that require a sequence of operations, the operation is
--   queued to be performed. For more information, see the <a>stack set
--   operation status codes</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>: The operation is currently being performed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt>: The user has cancelled the operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt>: The operation is in the process of stopping, at
--   user request.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The operation completed creating or updating
--   all the specified stacks without exceeding the failure tolerance for
--   the operation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTimestamp:StackSetOperationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationSummary_endTimestamp</a> - The time at which the
--   stack set operation ended, across all accounts and Regions specified.
--   Note that this doesn't necessarily mean that the stack set operation
--   was successful, or even attempted, in each account or Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operationId:StackSetOperationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationSummary_operationId</a> - The unique ID of the
--   stack set operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:StackSetOperationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationSummary_action</a> - The type of operation:
--   <tt>CREATE</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>, or <tt>DELETE</tt>. Create and
--   delete operations affect only the specified stack instances that are
--   associated with the specified stack set. Update operations affect both
--   the stack set itself as well as <i>all</i> associated stack set
--   instances.
newStackSetOperationSummary :: StackSetOperationSummary

-- | The time at which the operation was initiated. Note that the creation
--   times for the stack set operation might differ from the creation time
--   of the individual stacks themselves. This is because CloudFormation
--   needs to perform preparatory work for the operation, such as
--   dispatching the work to the requested Regions, before actually
--   creating the first stacks.
stackSetOperationSummary_creationTimestamp :: Lens' StackSetOperationSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The overall status of the operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The operation exceeded the specified failure
--   tolerance. The failure tolerance value that you've set for an
--   operation is applied for each Region during stack create and update
--   operations. If the number of failed stacks within a Region exceeds the
--   failure tolerance, the status of the operation in the Region is set to
--   <tt>FAILED</tt>. This in turn sets the status of the operation as a
--   whole to <tt>FAILED</tt>, and CloudFormation cancels the operation in
--   any remaining Regions.</li>
--   <li><tt>QUEUED</tt>: [Service-managed permissions] For automatic
--   deployments that require a sequence of operations, the operation is
--   queued to be performed. For more information, see the <a>stack set
--   operation status codes</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>: The operation is currently being performed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt>: The user has cancelled the operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt>: The operation is in the process of stopping, at
--   user request.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The operation completed creating or updating
--   all the specified stacks without exceeding the failure tolerance for
--   the operation.</li>
--   </ul>
stackSetOperationSummary_status :: Lens' StackSetOperationSummary (Maybe StackSetOperationStatus)

-- | The time at which the stack set operation ended, across all accounts
--   and Regions specified. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean that
--   the stack set operation was successful, or even attempted, in each
--   account or Region.
stackSetOperationSummary_endTimestamp :: Lens' StackSetOperationSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique ID of the stack set operation.
stackSetOperationSummary_operationId :: Lens' StackSetOperationSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of operation: <tt>CREATE</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>, or
--   <tt>DELETE</tt>. Create and delete operations affect only the
--   specified stack instances that are associated with the specified stack
--   set. Update operations affect both the stack set itself as well as
--   <i>all</i> associated stack set instances.
stackSetOperationSummary_action :: Lens' StackSetOperationSummary (Maybe StackSetOperationAction)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationSummary.StackSetOperationSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationSummary.StackSetOperationSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationSummary.StackSetOperationSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationSummary.StackSetOperationSummary
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationSummary.StackSetOperationSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationSummary.StackSetOperationSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetOperationSummary.StackSetOperationSummary


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus
newtype StackSetStatus
StackSetStatus' :: Text -> StackSetStatus
[fromStackSetStatus] :: StackSetStatus -> Text
pattern StackSetStatus_ACTIVE :: StackSetStatus
pattern StackSetStatus_DELETED :: StackSetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus

instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
