instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetStatus.StackSetStatus


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetSummary

-- | The structures that contain summary information about the specified
--   stack set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSetSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StackSetSummary
StackSetSummary' :: Maybe StackSetStatus -> Maybe PermissionModels -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackDriftStatus -> Maybe AutoDeployment -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StackSetSummary

-- | The status of the stack set.
[$sel:status:StackSetSummary'] :: StackSetSummary -> Maybe StackSetStatus

-- | Describes how the IAM roles required for stack set operations are
--   created.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>With <tt>self-managed</tt> permissions, you must create the
--   administrator and execution roles required to deploy to target
--   accounts. For more information, see <a>Grant Self-Managed Stack Set
--   Permissions</a>.</li>
--   <li>With <tt>service-managed</tt> permissions, StackSets automatically
--   creates the IAM roles required to deploy to accounts managed by
--   Organizations. For more information, see <a>Grant Service-Managed
--   Stack Set Permissions</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:permissionModel:StackSetSummary'] :: StackSetSummary -> Maybe PermissionModels

-- | Most recent time when CloudFormation performed a drift detection
--   operation on the stack set. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for any
--   stack set on which drift detection has not yet been performed.
[$sel:lastDriftCheckTimestamp:StackSetSummary'] :: StackSetSummary -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The ID of the stack set.
[$sel:stackSetId:StackSetSummary'] :: StackSetSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Status of the stack set's actual configuration compared to its
--   expected template and parameter configuration. A stack set is
--   considered to have drifted if one or more of its stack instances have
--   drifted from their expected template and parameter configuration.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: One or more of the stack instances belonging to
--   the stack set stack differs from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration. A stack instance is considered to have drifted if one
--   or more of the resources in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked the stack set
--   for drift.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: All of the stack instances belonging to the
--   stack set stack match from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:driftStatus:StackSetSummary'] :: StackSetSummary -> Maybe StackDriftStatus

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Describes whether StackSets
--   automatically deploys to Organizations accounts that are added to a
--   target organizational unit (OU).</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:autoDeployment:StackSetSummary'] :: StackSetSummary -> Maybe AutoDeployment

-- | A description of the stack set that you specify when the stack set is
--   created or updated.
[$sel:description:StackSetSummary'] :: StackSetSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the stack set.
[$sel:stackSetName:StackSetSummary'] :: StackSetSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSetSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackSetSummary'</a>, <a>stackSetSummary_status</a> -
--   The status of the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionModel:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_permissionModel</a> - Describes how the IAM roles
--   required for stack set operations are created.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>With <tt>self-managed</tt> permissions, you must create the
--   administrator and execution roles required to deploy to target
--   accounts. For more information, see <a>Grant Self-Managed Stack Set
--   Permissions</a>.</li>
--   <li>With <tt>service-managed</tt> permissions, StackSets automatically
--   creates the IAM roles required to deploy to accounts managed by
--   Organizations. For more information, see <a>Grant Service-Managed
--   Stack Set Permissions</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastDriftCheckTimestamp:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_lastDriftCheckTimestamp</a> - Most recent time when
--   CloudFormation performed a drift detection operation on the stack set.
--   This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for any stack set on which drift
--   detection has not yet been performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetId:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_stackSetId</a> - The ID of the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftStatus:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_driftStatus</a> - Status of the stack set's actual
--   configuration compared to its expected template and parameter
--   configuration. A stack set is considered to have drifted if one or
--   more of its stack instances have drifted from their expected template
--   and parameter configuration.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: One or more of the stack instances belonging to
--   the stack set stack differs from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration. A stack instance is considered to have drifted if one
--   or more of the resources in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked the stack set
--   for drift.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: All of the stack instances belonging to the
--   stack set stack match from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoDeployment:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_autoDeployment</a> - [Service-managed permissions]
--   Describes whether StackSets automatically deploys to Organizations
--   accounts that are added to a target organizational unit (OU).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_description</a> - A description of the stack set
--   that you specify when the stack set is created or updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_stackSetName</a> - The name of the stack set.
newStackSetSummary :: StackSetSummary

-- | The status of the stack set.
stackSetSummary_status :: Lens' StackSetSummary (Maybe StackSetStatus)

-- | Describes how the IAM roles required for stack set operations are
--   created.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>With <tt>self-managed</tt> permissions, you must create the
--   administrator and execution roles required to deploy to target
--   accounts. For more information, see <a>Grant Self-Managed Stack Set
--   Permissions</a>.</li>
--   <li>With <tt>service-managed</tt> permissions, StackSets automatically
--   creates the IAM roles required to deploy to accounts managed by
--   Organizations. For more information, see <a>Grant Service-Managed
--   Stack Set Permissions</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
stackSetSummary_permissionModel :: Lens' StackSetSummary (Maybe PermissionModels)

-- | Most recent time when CloudFormation performed a drift detection
--   operation on the stack set. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for any
--   stack set on which drift detection has not yet been performed.
stackSetSummary_lastDriftCheckTimestamp :: Lens' StackSetSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the stack set.
stackSetSummary_stackSetId :: Lens' StackSetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Status of the stack set's actual configuration compared to its
--   expected template and parameter configuration. A stack set is
--   considered to have drifted if one or more of its stack instances have
--   drifted from their expected template and parameter configuration.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: One or more of the stack instances belonging to
--   the stack set stack differs from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration. A stack instance is considered to have drifted if one
--   or more of the resources in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked the stack set
--   for drift.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: All of the stack instances belonging to the
--   stack set stack match from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
stackSetSummary_driftStatus :: Lens' StackSetSummary (Maybe StackDriftStatus)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Describes whether StackSets
--   automatically deploys to Organizations accounts that are added to a
--   target organizational unit (OU).</li>
--   </ul>
stackSetSummary_autoDeployment :: Lens' StackSetSummary (Maybe AutoDeployment)

-- | A description of the stack set that you specify when the stack set is
--   created or updated.
stackSetSummary_description :: Lens' StackSetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the stack set.
stackSetSummary_stackSetName :: Lens' StackSetSummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetSummary.StackSetSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetSummary.StackSetSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetSummary.StackSetSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetSummary.StackSetSummary
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetSummary.StackSetSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetSummary.StackSetSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSetSummary.StackSetSummary


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus
newtype StackStatus
StackStatus' :: Text -> StackStatus
[fromStackStatus] :: StackStatus -> Text
pattern StackStatus_CREATE_COMPLETE :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_CREATE_FAILED :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_CREATE_IN_PROGRESS :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_DELETE_COMPLETE :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_DELETE_FAILED :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_DELETE_IN_PROGRESS :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_IMPORT_COMPLETE :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_IMPORT_IN_PROGRESS :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_IMPORT_ROLLBACK_COMPLETE :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_IMPORT_ROLLBACK_FAILED :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_IMPORT_ROLLBACK_IN_PROGRESS :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_REVIEW_IN_PROGRESS :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_ROLLBACK_COMPLETE :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_ROLLBACK_FAILED :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_ROLLBACK_IN_PROGRESS :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_UPDATE_COMPLETE :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_UPDATE_COMPLETE_CLEANUP_IN_PROGRESS :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_UPDATE_FAILED :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_UPDATE_ROLLBACK_COMPLETE :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_UPDATE_ROLLBACK_COMPLETE_CLEANUP_IN_PROGRESS :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_UPDATE_ROLLBACK_FAILED :: StackStatus
pattern StackStatus_UPDATE_ROLLBACK_IN_PROGRESS :: StackStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackStatus.StackStatus


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSummary

-- | The StackSummary Data Type
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StackSummary
StackSummary' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe StackDriftInformationSummary -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Text -> ISO8601 -> StackStatus -> StackSummary

-- | The time the stack was deleted.
[$sel:deletionTime:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Summarizes information on whether a stack's actual configuration
--   differs, or has <i>drifted</i>, from it's expected configuration, as
--   defined in the stack template and any values specified as template
--   parameters. For more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated
--   Configuration Changes to Stacks and Resources</a>.
[$sel:driftInformation:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe StackDriftInformationSummary

-- | The template description of the template used to create the stack.
[$sel:templateDescription:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Success/Failure message associated with the stack status.
[$sel:stackStatusReason:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Unique stack identifier.
[$sel:stackId:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | For nested stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the
--   stack ID of the top-level stack to which the nested stack ultimately
--   belongs.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
[$sel:rootId:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | For nested stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the
--   stack ID of the direct parent of this stack. For the first level of
--   nested stacks, the root stack is also the parent stack.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
[$sel:parentId:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The time the stack was last updated. This field will only be returned
--   if the stack has been updated at least once.
[$sel:lastUpdatedTime:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name associated with the stack.
[$sel:stackName:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Text

-- | The time the stack was created.
[$sel:creationTime:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> ISO8601

-- | The current status of the stack.
[$sel:stackStatus:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> StackStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionTime:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_deletionTime</a> - The time the stack was deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftInformation:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_driftInformation</a> - Summarizes information on
--   whether a stack's actual configuration differs, or has <i>drifted</i>,
--   from it's expected configuration, as defined in the stack template and
--   any values specified as template parameters. For more information, see
--   <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration Changes to Stacks and
--   Resources</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_templateDescription</a> - The template description of
--   the template used to create the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackStatusReason:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_stackStatusReason</a> - Success/Failure message
--   associated with the stack status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_stackId</a> -
--   Unique stack identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rootId:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_rootId</a> - For
--   nested stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the
--   stack ID of the top-level stack to which the nested stack ultimately
--   belongs.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentId:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_parentId</a> - For
--   nested stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the
--   stack ID of the direct parent of this stack. For the first level of
--   nested stacks, the root stack is also the parent stack.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTime:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_lastUpdatedTime</a> - The time the stack was last
--   updated. This field will only be returned if the stack has been
--   updated at least once.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_stackName</a> -
--   The name associated with the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_creationTime</a> - The time the stack was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackStatus:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_stackStatus</a>
--   - The current status of the stack.
newStackSummary :: Text -> UTCTime -> StackStatus -> StackSummary

-- | The time the stack was deleted.
stackSummary_deletionTime :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Summarizes information on whether a stack's actual configuration
--   differs, or has <i>drifted</i>, from it's expected configuration, as
--   defined in the stack template and any values specified as template
--   parameters. For more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated
--   Configuration Changes to Stacks and Resources</a>.
stackSummary_driftInformation :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe StackDriftInformationSummary)

-- | The template description of the template used to create the stack.
stackSummary_templateDescription :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Success/Failure message associated with the stack status.
stackSummary_stackStatusReason :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Unique stack identifier.
stackSummary_stackId :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | For nested stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the
--   stack ID of the top-level stack to which the nested stack ultimately
--   belongs.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
stackSummary_rootId :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | For nested stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the
--   stack ID of the direct parent of this stack. For the first level of
--   nested stacks, the root stack is also the parent stack.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
stackSummary_parentId :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the stack was last updated. This field will only be returned
--   if the stack has been updated at least once.
stackSummary_lastUpdatedTime :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name associated with the stack.
stackSummary_stackName :: Lens' StackSummary Text

-- | The time the stack was created.
stackSummary_creationTime :: Lens' StackSummary UTCTime

-- | The current status of the stack.
stackSummary_stackStatus :: Lens' StackSummary StackStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Tag

-- | The Tag type enables you to specify a key-value pair that can be used
--   to store information about an CloudFormation stack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | <i>Required</i>. A string used to identify this tag. You can specify a
--   maximum of 128 characters for a tag key. Tags owned by Amazon Web
--   Services (Amazon Web Services) have the reserved prefix:
--   <tt>aws:</tt>.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | <i>Required</i>. A string containing the value for this tag. You can
--   specify a maximum of 256 characters for a tag value.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - <i>Required</i>. A string used
--   to identify this tag. You can specify a maximum of 128 characters for
--   a tag key. Tags owned by Amazon Web Services (Amazon Web Services)
--   have the reserved prefix: <tt>aws:</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - <i>Required</i>. A string
--   containing the value for this tag. You can specify a maximum of 256
--   characters for a tag value.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | <i>Required</i>. A string used to identify this tag. You can specify a
--   maximum of 128 characters for a tag key. Tags owned by Amazon Web
--   Services (Amazon Web Services) have the reserved prefix:
--   <tt>aws:</tt>.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | <i>Required</i>. A string containing the value for this tag. You can
--   specify a maximum of 256 characters for a tag value.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Tag.Tag


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSet

-- | A structure that contains information about a stack set. A stack set
--   enables you to provision stacks into Amazon Web Services accounts and
--   across Regions by using a single CloudFormation template. In the stack
--   set, you specify the template to use, as well as any parameters and
--   capabilities that the template requires.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSet</a> smart constructor.
data StackSet
StackSet' :: Maybe StackSetStatus -> Maybe PermissionModels -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Capability] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackSetDriftDetectionDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe AutoDeployment -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Parameter] -> StackSet

-- | The status of the stack set.
[$sel:status:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe StackSetStatus

-- | Describes how the IAM roles required for stack set operations are
--   created.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>With <tt>self-managed</tt> permissions, you must create the
--   administrator and execution roles required to deploy to target
--   accounts. For more information, see <a>Grant Self-Managed Stack Set
--   Permissions</a>.</li>
--   <li>With <tt>service-managed</tt> permissions, StackSets automatically
--   creates the IAM roles required to deploy to accounts managed by
--   Organizations. For more information, see <a>Grant Service-Managed
--   Stack Set Permissions</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:permissionModel:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe PermissionModels

-- | The name of the IAM execution role used to create or update the stack
--   set.
--   
--   Use customized execution roles to control which stack resources users
--   and groups can include in their stack sets.
[$sel:executionRoleName:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe Text

-- | The capabilities that are allowed in the stack set. Some stack set
--   templates might include resources that can affect permissions in your
--   Amazon Web Services account—for example, by creating new Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) users. For more information, see
--   <a>Acknowledging IAM Resources in CloudFormation Templates.</a>
[$sel:capabilities:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe [Capability]

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> The organization root ID or
--   organizational unit (OU) IDs that you specified for
--   <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:organizationalUnitIds:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the IAM role used to create or
--   update the stack set.
--   
--   Use customized administrator roles to control which users or groups
--   can manage specific stack sets within the same administrator account.
--   For more information, see <a>Prerequisites: Granting Permissions for
--   Stack Set Operations</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
[$sel:administrationRoleARN:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe Text

-- | Detailed information about the drift status of the stack set.
--   
--   For stack sets, contains information about the last <i>completed</i>
--   drift operation performed on the stack set. Information about drift
--   operations currently in progress is not included.
[$sel:stackSetDriftDetectionDetails:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe StackSetDriftDetectionDetails

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the stack set.
[$sel:stackSetARN:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the stack set.
[$sel:stackSetId:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags that specify information about the stack set. A maximum
--   number of 50 tags can be specified.
[$sel:tags:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Describes whether StackSets
--   automatically deploys to Organizations accounts that are added to a
--   target organization or organizational unit (OU).</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:autoDeployment:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe AutoDeployment

-- | A description of the stack set that you specify when the stack set is
--   created or updated.
[$sel:description:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe Text

-- | The name that's associated with the stack set.
[$sel:stackSetName:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe Text

-- | The structure that contains the body of the template that was used to
--   create or update the stack set.
[$sel:templateBody:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of input parameters for a stack set.
[$sel:parameters:StackSet'] :: StackSet -> Maybe [Parameter]

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSet</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_status</a> - The status of
--   the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionModel:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_permissionModel</a>
--   - Describes how the IAM roles required for stack set operations are
--   created.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>With <tt>self-managed</tt> permissions, you must create the
--   administrator and execution roles required to deploy to target
--   accounts. For more information, see <a>Grant Self-Managed Stack Set
--   Permissions</a>.</li>
--   <li>With <tt>service-managed</tt> permissions, StackSets automatically
--   creates the IAM roles required to deploy to accounts managed by
--   Organizations. For more information, see <a>Grant Service-Managed
--   Stack Set Permissions</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionRoleName:StackSet'</a>,
--   <a>stackSet_executionRoleName</a> - The name of the IAM execution role
--   used to create or update the stack set.
--   
--   Use customized execution roles to control which stack resources users
--   and groups can include in their stack sets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilities:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_capabilities</a> - The
--   capabilities that are allowed in the stack set. Some stack set
--   templates might include resources that can affect permissions in your
--   Amazon Web Services account—for example, by creating new Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) users. For more information, see
--   <a>Acknowledging IAM Resources in CloudFormation Templates.</a>
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitIds:StackSet'</a>,
--   <a>stackSet_organizationalUnitIds</a> - [Service-managed permissions]
--   The organization root ID or organizational unit (OU) IDs that you
--   specified for <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:administrationRoleARN:StackSet'</a>,
--   <a>stackSet_administrationRoleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Number
--   (ARN) of the IAM role used to create or update the stack set.
--   
--   Use customized administrator roles to control which users or groups
--   can manage specific stack sets within the same administrator account.
--   For more information, see <a>Prerequisites: Granting Permissions for
--   Stack Set Operations</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetDriftDetectionDetails:StackSet'</a>,
--   <a>stackSet_stackSetDriftDetectionDetails</a> - Detailed information
--   about the drift status of the stack set.
--   
--   For stack sets, contains information about the last <i>completed</i>
--   drift operation performed on the stack set. Information about drift
--   operations currently in progress is not included.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetARN:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_stackSetARN</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetId:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_stackSetId</a> - The ID
--   of the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_tags</a> - A list of tags that
--   specify information about the stack set. A maximum number of 50 tags
--   can be specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoDeployment:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_autoDeployment</a> -
--   [Service-managed permissions] Describes whether StackSets
--   automatically deploys to Organizations accounts that are added to a
--   target organization or organizational unit (OU).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_description</a> - A
--   description of the stack set that you specify when the stack set is
--   created or updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_stackSetName</a> - The
--   name that's associated with the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateBody:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_templateBody</a> - The
--   structure that contains the body of the template that was used to
--   create or update the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_parameters</a> - A list
--   of input parameters for a stack set.
newStackSet :: StackSet

-- | The status of the stack set.
stackSet_status :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe StackSetStatus)

-- | Describes how the IAM roles required for stack set operations are
--   created.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>With <tt>self-managed</tt> permissions, you must create the
--   administrator and execution roles required to deploy to target
--   accounts. For more information, see <a>Grant Self-Managed Stack Set
--   Permissions</a>.</li>
--   <li>With <tt>service-managed</tt> permissions, StackSets automatically
--   creates the IAM roles required to deploy to accounts managed by
--   Organizations. For more information, see <a>Grant Service-Managed
--   Stack Set Permissions</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
stackSet_permissionModel :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe PermissionModels)

-- | The name of the IAM execution role used to create or update the stack
--   set.
--   
--   Use customized execution roles to control which stack resources users
--   and groups can include in their stack sets.
stackSet_executionRoleName :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe Text)

-- | The capabilities that are allowed in the stack set. Some stack set
--   templates might include resources that can affect permissions in your
--   Amazon Web Services account—for example, by creating new Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) users. For more information, see
--   <a>Acknowledging IAM Resources in CloudFormation Templates.</a>
stackSet_capabilities :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe [Capability])

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> The organization root ID or
--   organizational unit (OU) IDs that you specified for
--   <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
stackSet_organizationalUnitIds :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the IAM role used to create or
--   update the stack set.
--   
--   Use customized administrator roles to control which users or groups
--   can manage specific stack sets within the same administrator account.
--   For more information, see <a>Prerequisites: Granting Permissions for
--   Stack Set Operations</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
stackSet_administrationRoleARN :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe Text)

-- | Detailed information about the drift status of the stack set.
--   
--   For stack sets, contains information about the last <i>completed</i>
--   drift operation performed on the stack set. Information about drift
--   operations currently in progress is not included.
stackSet_stackSetDriftDetectionDetails :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe StackSetDriftDetectionDetails)

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the stack set.
stackSet_stackSetARN :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the stack set.
stackSet_stackSetId :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags that specify information about the stack set. A maximum
--   number of 50 tags can be specified.
stackSet_tags :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe [Tag])

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Describes whether StackSets
--   automatically deploys to Organizations accounts that are added to a
--   target organization or organizational unit (OU).</li>
--   </ul>
stackSet_autoDeployment :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe AutoDeployment)

-- | A description of the stack set that you specify when the stack set is
--   created or updated.
stackSet_description :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe Text)

-- | The name that's associated with the stack set.
stackSet_stackSetName :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe Text)

-- | The structure that contains the body of the template that was used to
--   create or update the stack set.
stackSet_templateBody :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of input parameters for a stack set.
stackSet_parameters :: Lens' StackSet (Maybe [Parameter])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSet.StackSet
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSet.StackSet
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSet.StackSet
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSet.StackSet
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSet.StackSet
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSet.StackSet
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.StackSet.StackSet


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Stack

-- | The Stack data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStack</a> smart constructor.
data Stack
Stack' :: Maybe [Output] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe StackDriftInformation -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Capability] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RollbackConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe [Parameter] -> Text -> ISO8601 -> StackStatus -> Stack

-- | A list of output structures.
[$sel:outputs:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe [Output]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role that is associated with the stack. During a stack
--   operation, CloudFormation uses this role's credentials to make calls
--   on your behalf.
[$sel:roleARN:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The time the stack was deleted.
[$sel:deletionTime:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Information on whether a stack's actual configuration differs, or has
--   <i>drifted</i>, from it's expected configuration, as defined in the
--   stack template and any values specified as template parameters. For
--   more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration Changes
--   to Stacks and Resources</a>.
[$sel:driftInformation:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe StackDriftInformation

-- | Whether termination protection is enabled for the stack.
--   
--   For <a>nested stacks</a>, termination protection is set on the root
--   stack and cannot be changed directly on the nested stack. For more
--   information, see <a>Protecting a Stack From Being Deleted</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
[$sel:enableTerminationProtection:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Bool

-- | Success/failure message associated with the stack status.
[$sel:stackStatusReason:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The capabilities allowed in the stack.
[$sel:capabilities:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe [Capability]

-- | Unique identifier of the stack.
[$sel:stackId:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | SNS topic ARNs to which stack related events are published.
[$sel:notificationARNs:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe [Text]

-- | For nested stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the
--   stack ID of the top-level stack to which the nested stack ultimately
--   belongs.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
[$sel:rootId:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of <tt>Tag</tt>s that specify information about the stack.
[$sel:tags:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The unique ID of the change set.
[$sel:changeSetId:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of time within which stack creation should complete.
[$sel:timeoutInMinutes:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Natural

-- | For nested stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the
--   stack ID of the direct parent of this stack. For the first level of
--   nested stacks, the root stack is also the parent stack.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
[$sel:parentId:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The rollback triggers for CloudFormation to monitor during stack
--   creation and updating operations, and for the specified monitoring
--   period afterwards.
[$sel:rollbackConfiguration:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe RollbackConfiguration

-- | A user-defined description associated with the stack.
[$sel:description:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | Boolean to enable or disable rollback on stack creation failures:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>true</tt>: disable rollback</li>
--   <li><tt>false</tt>: enable rollback</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:disableRollback:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Bool

-- | The time the stack was last updated. This field will only be returned
--   if the stack has been updated at least once.
[$sel:lastUpdatedTime:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | A list of <tt>Parameter</tt> structures.
[$sel:parameters:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe [Parameter]

-- | The name associated with the stack.
[$sel:stackName:Stack'] :: Stack -> Text

-- | The time at which the stack was created.
[$sel:creationTime:Stack'] :: Stack -> ISO8601

-- | Current status of the stack.
[$sel:stackStatus:Stack'] :: Stack -> StackStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>Stack</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputs:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_outputs</a> - A list of output
--   structures.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_roleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of an Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that is
--   associated with the stack. During a stack operation, CloudFormation
--   uses this role's credentials to make calls on your behalf.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionTime:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_deletionTime</a> - The time
--   the stack was deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftInformation:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_driftInformation</a> -
--   Information on whether a stack's actual configuration differs, or has
--   <i>drifted</i>, from it's expected configuration, as defined in the
--   stack template and any values specified as template parameters. For
--   more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration Changes
--   to Stacks and Resources</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableTerminationProtection:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_enableTerminationProtection</a> - Whether termination
--   protection is enabled for the stack.
--   
--   For <a>nested stacks</a>, termination protection is set on the root
--   stack and cannot be changed directly on the nested stack. For more
--   information, see <a>Protecting a Stack From Being Deleted</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackStatusReason:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_stackStatusReason</a> -
--   Success/failure message associated with the stack status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilities:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_capabilities</a> - The
--   capabilities allowed in the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_stackId</a> - Unique identifier
--   of the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationARNs:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_notificationARNs</a> -
--   SNS topic ARNs to which stack related events are published.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rootId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_rootId</a> - For nested
--   stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the stack ID of
--   the top-level stack to which the nested stack ultimately belongs.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_tags</a> - A list of <tt>Tag</tt>s
--   that specify information about the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:changeSetId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_changeSetId</a> - The unique
--   ID of the change set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutInMinutes:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_timeoutInMinutes</a> -
--   The amount of time within which stack creation should complete.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_parentId</a> - For nested
--   stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the stack ID of
--   the direct parent of this stack. For the first level of nested stacks,
--   the root stack is also the parent stack.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rollbackConfiguration:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_rollbackConfiguration</a> - The rollback triggers for
--   CloudFormation to monitor during stack creation and updating
--   operations, and for the specified monitoring period afterwards.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_description</a> - A
--   user-defined description associated with the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:disableRollback:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_disableRollback</a> -
--   Boolean to enable or disable rollback on stack creation failures:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>true</tt>: disable rollback</li>
--   <li><tt>false</tt>: enable rollback</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTime:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_lastUpdatedTime</a> - The
--   time the stack was last updated. This field will only be returned if
--   the stack has been updated at least once.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_parameters</a> - A list of
--   <tt>Parameter</tt> structures.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_stackName</a> - The name
--   associated with the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_creationTime</a> - The time
--   at which the stack was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackStatus:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_stackStatus</a> - Current
--   status of the stack.
newStack :: Text -> UTCTime -> StackStatus -> Stack

-- | A list of output structures.
stack_outputs :: Lens' Stack (Maybe [Output])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role that is associated with the stack. During a stack
--   operation, CloudFormation uses this role's credentials to make calls
--   on your behalf.
stack_roleARN :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the stack was deleted.
stack_deletionTime :: Lens' Stack (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Information on whether a stack's actual configuration differs, or has
--   <i>drifted</i>, from it's expected configuration, as defined in the
--   stack template and any values specified as template parameters. For
--   more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration Changes
--   to Stacks and Resources</a>.
stack_driftInformation :: Lens' Stack (Maybe StackDriftInformation)

-- | Whether termination protection is enabled for the stack.
--   
--   For <a>nested stacks</a>, termination protection is set on the root
--   stack and cannot be changed directly on the nested stack. For more
--   information, see <a>Protecting a Stack From Being Deleted</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
stack_enableTerminationProtection :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Bool)

-- | Success/failure message associated with the stack status.
stack_stackStatusReason :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The capabilities allowed in the stack.
stack_capabilities :: Lens' Stack (Maybe [Capability])

-- | Unique identifier of the stack.
stack_stackId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | SNS topic ARNs to which stack related events are published.
stack_notificationARNs :: Lens' Stack (Maybe [Text])

-- | For nested stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the
--   stack ID of the top-level stack to which the nested stack ultimately
--   belongs.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
stack_rootId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of <tt>Tag</tt>s that specify information about the stack.
stack_tags :: Lens' Stack (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The unique ID of the change set.
stack_changeSetId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of time within which stack creation should complete.
stack_timeoutInMinutes :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Natural)

-- | For nested stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the
--   stack ID of the direct parent of this stack. For the first level of
--   nested stacks, the root stack is also the parent stack.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
stack_parentId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The rollback triggers for CloudFormation to monitor during stack
--   creation and updating operations, and for the specified monitoring
--   period afterwards.
stack_rollbackConfiguration :: Lens' Stack (Maybe RollbackConfiguration)

-- | A user-defined description associated with the stack.
stack_description :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | Boolean to enable or disable rollback on stack creation failures:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>true</tt>: disable rollback</li>
--   <li><tt>false</tt>: enable rollback</li>
--   </ul>
stack_disableRollback :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Bool)

-- | The time the stack was last updated. This field will only be returned
--   if the stack has been updated at least once.
stack_lastUpdatedTime :: Lens' Stack (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A list of <tt>Parameter</tt> structures.
stack_parameters :: Lens' Stack (Maybe [Parameter])

-- | The name associated with the stack.
stack_stackName :: Lens' Stack Text

-- | The time at which the stack was created.
stack_creationTime :: Lens' Stack UTCTime

-- | Current status of the stack.
stack_stackStatus :: Lens' Stack StackStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Stack.Stack
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Stack.Stack
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Stack.Stack
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Stack.Stack
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Stack.Stack
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Stack.Stack
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.Stack.Stack


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TemplateParameter

-- | The TemplateParameter data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplateParameter</a> smart constructor.
data TemplateParameter
TemplateParameter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> TemplateParameter

-- | User defined description associated with the parameter.
[$sel:description:TemplateParameter'] :: TemplateParameter -> Maybe Text

-- | The name associated with the parameter.
[$sel:parameterKey:TemplateParameter'] :: TemplateParameter -> Maybe Text

-- | The default value associated with the parameter.
[$sel:defaultValue:TemplateParameter'] :: TemplateParameter -> Maybe Text

-- | Flag indicating whether the parameter should be displayed as plain
--   text in logs and UIs.
[$sel:noEcho:TemplateParameter'] :: TemplateParameter -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>TemplateParameter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:TemplateParameter'</a>,
--   <a>templateParameter_description</a> - User defined description
--   associated with the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterKey:TemplateParameter'</a>,
--   <a>templateParameter_parameterKey</a> - The name associated with the
--   parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultValue:TemplateParameter'</a>,
--   <a>templateParameter_defaultValue</a> - The default value associated
--   with the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noEcho:TemplateParameter'</a>, <a>templateParameter_noEcho</a>
--   - Flag indicating whether the parameter should be displayed as plain
--   text in logs and UIs.
newTemplateParameter :: TemplateParameter

-- | User defined description associated with the parameter.
templateParameter_description :: Lens' TemplateParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The name associated with the parameter.
templateParameter_parameterKey :: Lens' TemplateParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The default value associated with the parameter.
templateParameter_defaultValue :: Lens' TemplateParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Flag indicating whether the parameter should be displayed as plain
--   text in logs and UIs.
templateParameter_noEcho :: Lens' TemplateParameter (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TemplateParameter.TemplateParameter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TemplateParameter.TemplateParameter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TemplateParameter.TemplateParameter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TemplateParameter.TemplateParameter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TemplateParameter.TemplateParameter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TemplateParameter.TemplateParameter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TemplateParameter.TemplateParameter

module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeConfigurationDetails

-- | Detailed information concerning the specification of a CloudFormation
--   extension in a given account and region.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configuring extensions at the account
--   level</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTypeConfigurationDetails</a> smart constructor.
data TypeConfigurationDetails
TypeConfigurationDetails' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> TypeConfigurationDetails

-- | The name of the extension.
[$sel:typeName:TypeConfigurationDetails'] :: TypeConfigurationDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The alias specified for this configuration, if one was specified when
--   the configuration was set.
[$sel:alias:TypeConfigurationDetails'] :: TypeConfigurationDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | A JSON string specifying the configuration data for the extension, in
--   this account and region.
--   
--   If a configuration has not been set for a specified extension,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>{}</tt>.
[$sel:configuration:TypeConfigurationDetails'] :: TypeConfigurationDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the configuration data, in this
--   account and region.
[$sel:arn:TypeConfigurationDetails'] :: TypeConfigurationDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | When the configuration data was last updated for this extension.
--   
--   If a configuration has not been set for a specified extension,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:lastUpdated:TypeConfigurationDetails'] :: TypeConfigurationDetails -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Whether or not this configuration data is the default configuration
--   for the extension.
[$sel:isDefaultConfiguration:TypeConfigurationDetails'] :: TypeConfigurationDetails -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the extension, in this account and
--   region.
--   
--   For public extensions, this will be the ARN assigned when you
--   <a>activate the type</a> in this account and region. For private
--   extensions, this will be the ARN assigned when you <a>register the
--   type</a> in this account and region.
[$sel:typeArn:TypeConfigurationDetails'] :: TypeConfigurationDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TypeConfigurationDetails</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:TypeConfigurationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>typeConfigurationDetails_typeName</a> - The name of the extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alias:TypeConfigurationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>typeConfigurationDetails_alias</a> - The alias specified for this
--   configuration, if one was specified when the configuration was set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configuration:TypeConfigurationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>typeConfigurationDetails_configuration</a> - A JSON string
--   specifying the configuration data for the extension, in this account
--   and region.
--   
--   If a configuration has not been set for a specified extension,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>{}</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:TypeConfigurationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>typeConfigurationDetails_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   for the configuration data, in this account and region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdated:TypeConfigurationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>typeConfigurationDetails_lastUpdated</a> - When the configuration
--   data was last updated for this extension.
--   
--   If a configuration has not been set for a specified extension,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDefaultConfiguration:TypeConfigurationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>typeConfigurationDetails_isDefaultConfiguration</a> - Whether or
--   not this configuration data is the default configuration for the
--   extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeArn:TypeConfigurationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>typeConfigurationDetails_typeArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) for the extension, in this account and region.
--   
--   For public extensions, this will be the ARN assigned when you
--   <a>activate the type</a> in this account and region. For private
--   extensions, this will be the ARN assigned when you <a>register the
--   type</a> in this account and region.
newTypeConfigurationDetails :: TypeConfigurationDetails

-- | The name of the extension.
typeConfigurationDetails_typeName :: Lens' TypeConfigurationDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The alias specified for this configuration, if one was specified when
--   the configuration was set.
typeConfigurationDetails_alias :: Lens' TypeConfigurationDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON string specifying the configuration data for the extension, in
--   this account and region.
--   
--   If a configuration has not been set for a specified extension,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>{}</tt>.
typeConfigurationDetails_configuration :: Lens' TypeConfigurationDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the configuration data, in this
--   account and region.
typeConfigurationDetails_arn :: Lens' TypeConfigurationDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | When the configuration data was last updated for this extension.
--   
--   If a configuration has not been set for a specified extension,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
typeConfigurationDetails_lastUpdated :: Lens' TypeConfigurationDetails (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Whether or not this configuration data is the default configuration
--   for the extension.
typeConfigurationDetails_isDefaultConfiguration :: Lens' TypeConfigurationDetails (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the extension, in this account and
--   region.
--   
--   For public extensions, this will be the ARN assigned when you
--   <a>activate the type</a> in this account and region. For private
--   extensions, this will be the ARN assigned when you <a>register the
--   type</a> in this account and region.
typeConfigurationDetails_typeArn :: Lens' TypeConfigurationDetails (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeConfigurationDetails.TypeConfigurationDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeConfigurationDetails.TypeConfigurationDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeConfigurationDetails.TypeConfigurationDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeConfigurationDetails.TypeConfigurationDetails
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeConfigurationDetails.TypeConfigurationDetails
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeConfigurationDetails.TypeConfigurationDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeConfigurationDetails.TypeConfigurationDetails

--   extension.

--   and region.

--   region.

--   extensions, this will be the ARN assigned when you <a>register the
--   type</a> in this account and region.

module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeFilters

-- | Filter criteria to use in determining which extensions to return.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTypeFilters</a> smart constructor.
data TypeFilters
TypeFilters' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Category -> TypeFilters

-- | A prefix to use as a filter for results.
[$sel:typeNamePrefix:TypeFilters'] :: TypeFilters -> Maybe Text

-- | The id of the publisher of the extension.
--   
--   Extensions published by Amazon are not assigned a publisher ID. Use
--   the <tt>AWS-TYPES</tt> category to specify a list of types published
--   by Amazon.
[$sel:publisherId:TypeFilters'] :: TypeFilters -> Maybe Text

-- | The category of extensions to return.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>REGISTERED</tt>: Private extensions that have been registered
--   for this account and region.</li>
--   <li><tt>ACTIVATED</tt>: Public extensions that have been activated for
--   this account and region.</li>
--   <li><tt>THIRD-PARTY</tt>: Extensions available for use from publishers
--   other than Amazon. This includes:<ul><li>Private extensions registered
--   in the account.</li><li>Public extensions from publishers other than
--   Amazon, whether activated or not.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>AWS-TYPES</tt>: Extensions available for use from Amazon.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:category:TypeFilters'] :: TypeFilters -> Maybe Category

-- | Create a value of <a>TypeFilters</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeNamePrefix:TypeFilters'</a>,
--   <a>typeFilters_typeNamePrefix</a> - A prefix to use as a filter for
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publisherId:TypeFilters'</a>, <a>typeFilters_publisherId</a> -
--   The id of the publisher of the extension.
--   
--   Extensions published by Amazon are not assigned a publisher ID. Use
--   the <tt>AWS-TYPES</tt> category to specify a list of types published
--   by Amazon.
--   
--   <a>$sel:category:TypeFilters'</a>, <a>typeFilters_category</a> - The
--   category of extensions to return.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>REGISTERED</tt>: Private extensions that have been registered
--   for this account and region.</li>
--   <li><tt>ACTIVATED</tt>: Public extensions that have been activated for
--   this account and region.</li>
--   <li><tt>THIRD-PARTY</tt>: Extensions available for use from publishers
--   other than Amazon. This includes:<ul><li>Private extensions registered
--   in the account.</li><li>Public extensions from publishers other than
--   Amazon, whether activated or not.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>AWS-TYPES</tt>: Extensions available for use from Amazon.</li>
--   </ul>
newTypeFilters :: TypeFilters

-- | A prefix to use as a filter for results.
typeFilters_typeNamePrefix :: Lens' TypeFilters (Maybe Text)

-- | The id of the publisher of the extension.
--   
--   Extensions published by Amazon are not assigned a publisher ID. Use
--   the <tt>AWS-TYPES</tt> category to specify a list of types published
--   by Amazon.
typeFilters_publisherId :: Lens' TypeFilters (Maybe Text)

-- | The category of extensions to return.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>REGISTERED</tt>: Private extensions that have been registered
--   for this account and region.</li>
--   <li><tt>ACTIVATED</tt>: Public extensions that have been activated for
--   this account and region.</li>
--   <li><tt>THIRD-PARTY</tt>: Extensions available for use from publishers
--   other than Amazon. This includes:<ul><li>Private extensions registered
--   in the account.</li><li>Public extensions from publishers other than
--   Amazon, whether activated or not.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>AWS-TYPES</tt>: Extensions available for use from Amazon.</li>
--   </ul>
typeFilters_category :: Lens' TypeFilters (Maybe Category)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeFilters.TypeFilters
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeFilters.TypeFilters
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeFilters.TypeFilters
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeFilters.TypeFilters
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeFilters.TypeFilters
