instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeFilters.TypeFilters


module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeSummary

-- | Contains summary information about the specified CloudFormation
--   extension.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTypeSummary</a> smart constructor.
data TypeSummary
TypeSummary' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IdentityProvider -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RegistryType -> Maybe Text -> TypeSummary

-- | Whether or not the extension is activated for this account and region.
--   
--   This applies only to third-party public extensions. Extensions
--   published by Amazon are activated by default.
[$sel:isActivated:TypeSummary'] :: TypeSummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when you <a>activate this
--   extension</a> in your account and region, CloudFormation considers
--   that alias as the type name.
[$sel:typeName:TypeSummary'] :: TypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The publisher name, as defined in the public profile for that
--   publisher in the service used to verify the publisher identity.
[$sel:publisherName:TypeSummary'] :: TypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the extension publisher, if the extension is published by a
--   third party. Extensions published by Amazon do not return a publisher
--   ID.
[$sel:publisherId:TypeSummary'] :: TypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | For public extensions that have been activated for this account and
--   region, the latest version of the public extension <i>that is
--   available</i>. For any extensions other than activated third-arty
--   extensions, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   How you specified <tt>AutoUpdate</tt> when enabling the extension
--   affects whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extention in
--   this account and region when a new version is released. For more
--   information, see <a>Setting CloudFormation to automatically use new
--   versions of extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
[$sel:latestPublicVersion:TypeSummary'] :: TypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | When the specified extension version was registered. This applies only
--   to:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Private extensions you have registered in your account. For more
--   information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.</li>
--   <li>Public extensions you have activated in your account with
--   auto-update specified. For more information, see
--   <a>ActivateType</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For all other extension types, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:lastUpdated:TypeSummary'] :: TypeSummary -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The ID of the default version of the extension. The default version is
--   used when the extension version is not specified.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account. For public extensions, both those provided by Amazon and
--   published by third parties, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>. For
--   more information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.
--   
--   To set the default version of an extension, use <tt>
--   SetTypeDefaultVersion </tt>.
[$sel:defaultVersionId:TypeSummary'] :: TypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the extension.
[$sel:description:TypeSummary'] :: TypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | For public extensions that have been activated for this account and
--   region, the type name of the public extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when enabling the extension
--   in this account and region, CloudFormation treats that alias as the
--   extension's type name within the account and region, not the type name
--   of the public extension. For more information, see <a>Specifying
--   aliases to refer to extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:originalTypeName:TypeSummary'] :: TypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The service used to verify the publisher identity.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Registering your account to publish
--   CloudFormation extensions</a> in the <i>CFN-CLI User Guide for
--   Extension Development</i>.
[$sel:publisherIdentity:TypeSummary'] :: TypeSummary -> Maybe IdentityProvider

-- | For public extensions that have been activated for this account and
--   region, the version of the public extension to be used for
--   CloudFormation operations in this account and region.
--   
--   How you specified <tt>AutoUpdate</tt> when enabling the extension
--   affects whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extention in
--   this account and region when a new version is released. For more
--   information, see <a>Setting CloudFormation to automatically use new
--   versions of extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
[$sel:publicVersionNumber:TypeSummary'] :: TypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The kind of extension.
[$sel:type':TypeSummary'] :: TypeSummary -> Maybe RegistryType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the extension.
[$sel:typeArn:TypeSummary'] :: TypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TypeSummary</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isActivated:TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_isActivated</a> -
--   Whether or not the extension is activated for this account and region.
--   
--   This applies only to third-party public extensions. Extensions
--   published by Amazon are activated by default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_typeName</a> - The
--   name of the extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when you <a>activate this
--   extension</a> in your account and region, CloudFormation considers
--   that alias as the type name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publisherName:TypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeSummary_publisherName</a> - The publisher name, as defined in
--   the public profile for that publisher in the service used to verify
--   the publisher identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publisherId:TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_publisherId</a> -
--   The ID of the extension publisher, if the extension is published by a
--   third party. Extensions published by Amazon do not return a publisher
--   ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestPublicVersion:TypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeSummary_latestPublicVersion</a> - For public extensions that
--   have been activated for this account and region, the latest version of
--   the public extension <i>that is available</i>. For any extensions
--   other than activated third-arty extensions, CloudFormation returns
--   <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   How you specified <tt>AutoUpdate</tt> when enabling the extension
--   affects whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extention in
--   this account and region when a new version is released. For more
--   information, see <a>Setting CloudFormation to automatically use new
--   versions of extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdated:TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_lastUpdated</a> -
--   When the specified extension version was registered. This applies only
--   to:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Private extensions you have registered in your account. For more
--   information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.</li>
--   <li>Public extensions you have activated in your account with
--   auto-update specified. For more information, see
--   <a>ActivateType</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For all other extension types, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultVersionId:TypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeSummary_defaultVersionId</a> - The ID of the default version of
--   the extension. The default version is used when the extension version
--   is not specified.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account. For public extensions, both those provided by Amazon and
--   published by third parties, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>. For
--   more information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.
--   
--   To set the default version of an extension, use <tt>
--   SetTypeDefaultVersion </tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_description</a> -
--   The description of the extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originalTypeName:TypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeSummary_originalTypeName</a> - For public extensions that have
--   been activated for this account and region, the type name of the
--   public extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when enabling the extension
--   in this account and region, CloudFormation treats that alias as the
--   extension's type name within the account and region, not the type name
--   of the public extension. For more information, see <a>Specifying
--   aliases to refer to extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publisherIdentity:TypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeSummary_publisherIdentity</a> - The service used to verify the
--   publisher identity.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Registering your account to publish
--   CloudFormation extensions</a> in the <i>CFN-CLI User Guide for
--   Extension Development</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicVersionNumber:TypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeSummary_publicVersionNumber</a> - For public extensions that
--   have been activated for this account and region, the version of the
--   public extension to be used for CloudFormation operations in this
--   account and region.
--   
--   How you specified <tt>AutoUpdate</tt> when enabling the extension
--   affects whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extention in
--   this account and region when a new version is released. For more
--   information, see <a>Setting CloudFormation to automatically use new
--   versions of extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_type</a> - The kind of
--   extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeArn:TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_typeArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the extension.
newTypeSummary :: TypeSummary

-- | Whether or not the extension is activated for this account and region.
--   
--   This applies only to third-party public extensions. Extensions
--   published by Amazon are activated by default.
typeSummary_isActivated :: Lens' TypeSummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when you <a>activate this
--   extension</a> in your account and region, CloudFormation considers
--   that alias as the type name.
typeSummary_typeName :: Lens' TypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The publisher name, as defined in the public profile for that
--   publisher in the service used to verify the publisher identity.
typeSummary_publisherName :: Lens' TypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the extension publisher, if the extension is published by a
--   third party. Extensions published by Amazon do not return a publisher
--   ID.
typeSummary_publisherId :: Lens' TypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | For public extensions that have been activated for this account and
--   region, the latest version of the public extension <i>that is
--   available</i>. For any extensions other than activated third-arty
--   extensions, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   How you specified <tt>AutoUpdate</tt> when enabling the extension
--   affects whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extention in
--   this account and region when a new version is released. For more
--   information, see <a>Setting CloudFormation to automatically use new
--   versions of extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
typeSummary_latestPublicVersion :: Lens' TypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | When the specified extension version was registered. This applies only
--   to:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Private extensions you have registered in your account. For more
--   information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.</li>
--   <li>Public extensions you have activated in your account with
--   auto-update specified. For more information, see
--   <a>ActivateType</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For all other extension types, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
typeSummary_lastUpdated :: Lens' TypeSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the default version of the extension. The default version is
--   used when the extension version is not specified.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account. For public extensions, both those provided by Amazon and
--   published by third parties, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>. For
--   more information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.
--   
--   To set the default version of an extension, use <tt>
--   SetTypeDefaultVersion </tt>.
typeSummary_defaultVersionId :: Lens' TypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the extension.
typeSummary_description :: Lens' TypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | For public extensions that have been activated for this account and
--   region, the type name of the public extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when enabling the extension
--   in this account and region, CloudFormation treats that alias as the
--   extension's type name within the account and region, not the type name
--   of the public extension. For more information, see <a>Specifying
--   aliases to refer to extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
typeSummary_originalTypeName :: Lens' TypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The service used to verify the publisher identity.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Registering your account to publish
--   CloudFormation extensions</a> in the <i>CFN-CLI User Guide for
--   Extension Development</i>.
typeSummary_publisherIdentity :: Lens' TypeSummary (Maybe IdentityProvider)

-- | For public extensions that have been activated for this account and
--   region, the version of the public extension to be used for
--   CloudFormation operations in this account and region.
--   
--   How you specified <tt>AutoUpdate</tt> when enabling the extension
--   affects whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extention in
--   this account and region when a new version is released. For more
--   information, see <a>Setting CloudFormation to automatically use new
--   versions of extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
typeSummary_publicVersionNumber :: Lens' TypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The kind of extension.
typeSummary_type :: Lens' TypeSummary (Maybe RegistryType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the extension.
typeSummary_typeArn :: Lens' TypeSummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeSummary.TypeSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeSummary.TypeSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeSummary.TypeSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeSummary.TypeSummary
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeSummary.TypeSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeSummary.TypeSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeSummary.TypeSummary

pattern TypeTestsStatus_FAILED :: TypeTestsStatus
pattern TypeTestsStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: TypeTestsStatus
pattern TypeTestsStatus_NOT_TESTED :: TypeTestsStatus
pattern TypeTestsStatus_PASSED :: TypeTestsStatus

module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeVersionSummary

-- | Contains summary information about a specific version of a
--   CloudFormation extension.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTypeVersionSummary</a> smart constructor.
data TypeVersionSummary
TypeVersionSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RegistryType -> Maybe ISO8601 -> TypeVersionSummary

-- | The name of the extension.
[$sel:typeName:TypeVersionSummary'] :: TypeVersionSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the extension version.
[$sel:arn:TypeVersionSummary'] :: TypeVersionSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of a specific version of the extension. The version ID is the
--   value at the end of the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the
--   extension version when it is registered.
[$sel:versionId:TypeVersionSummary'] :: TypeVersionSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the extension version.
[$sel:description:TypeVersionSummary'] :: TypeVersionSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether the specified extension version is set as the default version.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account, and extensions published by Amazon. For public third-party
--   extensions, whether or not they are activated in your account,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:isDefaultVersion:TypeVersionSummary'] :: TypeVersionSummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | For public extensions that have been activated for this account and
--   region, the version of the public extension to be used for
--   CloudFormation operations in this account and region. For any
--   extensions other than activated third-arty extensions, CloudFormation
--   returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   How you specified <tt>AutoUpdate</tt> when enabling the extension
--   affects whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extention in
--   this account and region when a new version is released. For more
--   information, see <a>Setting CloudFormation to automatically use new
--   versions of extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
[$sel:publicVersionNumber:TypeVersionSummary'] :: TypeVersionSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The kind of extension.
[$sel:type':TypeVersionSummary'] :: TypeVersionSummary -> Maybe RegistryType

-- | When the version was registered.
[$sel:timeCreated:TypeVersionSummary'] :: TypeVersionSummary -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>TypeVersionSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:TypeVersionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeVersionSummary_typeName</a> - The name of the extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:TypeVersionSummary'</a>, <a>typeVersionSummary_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the extension version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:TypeVersionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeVersionSummary_versionId</a> - The ID of a specific version of
--   the extension. The version ID is the value at the end of the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the extension version when it is
--   registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:TypeVersionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeVersionSummary_description</a> - The description of the
--   extension version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDefaultVersion:TypeVersionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeVersionSummary_isDefaultVersion</a> - Whether the specified
--   extension version is set as the default version.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account, and extensions published by Amazon. For public third-party
--   extensions, whether or not they are activated in your account,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicVersionNumber:TypeVersionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeVersionSummary_publicVersionNumber</a> - For public extensions
--   that have been activated for this account and region, the version of
--   the public extension to be used for CloudFormation operations in this
--   account and region. For any extensions other than activated third-arty
--   extensions, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   How you specified <tt>AutoUpdate</tt> when enabling the extension
--   affects whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extention in
--   this account and region when a new version is released. For more
--   information, see <a>Setting CloudFormation to automatically use new
--   versions of extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':TypeVersionSummary'</a>, <a>typeVersionSummary_type</a>
--   - The kind of extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeCreated:TypeVersionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeVersionSummary_timeCreated</a> - When the version was
--   registered.
newTypeVersionSummary :: TypeVersionSummary

-- | The name of the extension.
typeVersionSummary_typeName :: Lens' TypeVersionSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the extension version.
typeVersionSummary_arn :: Lens' TypeVersionSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of a specific version of the extension. The version ID is the
--   value at the end of the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the
--   extension version when it is registered.
typeVersionSummary_versionId :: Lens' TypeVersionSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the extension version.
typeVersionSummary_description :: Lens' TypeVersionSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether the specified extension version is set as the default version.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account, and extensions published by Amazon. For public third-party
--   extensions, whether or not they are activated in your account,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
typeVersionSummary_isDefaultVersion :: Lens' TypeVersionSummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | For public extensions that have been activated for this account and
--   region, the version of the public extension to be used for
--   CloudFormation operations in this account and region. For any
--   extensions other than activated third-arty extensions, CloudFormation
--   returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   How you specified <tt>AutoUpdate</tt> when enabling the extension
--   affects whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extention in
--   this account and region when a new version is released. For more
--   information, see <a>Setting CloudFormation to automatically use new
--   versions of extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
typeVersionSummary_publicVersionNumber :: Lens' TypeVersionSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The kind of extension.
typeVersionSummary_type :: Lens' TypeVersionSummary (Maybe RegistryType)

-- | When the version was registered.
typeVersionSummary_timeCreated :: Lens' TypeVersionSummary (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeVersionSummary.TypeVersionSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeVersionSummary.TypeVersionSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeVersionSummary.TypeVersionSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeVersionSummary.TypeVersionSummary
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeVersionSummary.TypeVersionSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeVersionSummary.TypeVersionSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types.TypeVersionSummary.TypeVersionSummary

module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.Types

-- | API version <tt>2010-05-15</tt> of the Amazon CloudFormation SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The template contains resources with capabilities that weren't
--   specified in the Capabilities parameter.
_InsufficientCapabilitiesException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Another operation has been performed on this stack set since the
--   specified operation was performed.
_StaleRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified ID refers to an operation that doesn't exist.
_OperationNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified name is already in use.
_NameAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified change set can't be used to update the stack. For
--   example, the change set status might be <tt>CREATE_IN_PROGRESS</tt>,
--   or the stack status might be <tt>UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS</tt>.
_InvalidChangeSetStatusException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Error reserved for use by the <a>CloudFormation CLI</a>.
--   CloudFormation does not return this error to users.
_OperationStatusCheckFailedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified operation isn't valid.
_InvalidOperationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You can't yet delete this stack set, because it still contains one or
--   more stack instances. Delete all stack instances from the stack set
--   before deleting the stack set.
_StackSetNotEmptyException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified change set name or ID doesn't exit. To view valid change
--   sets for a stack, use the <tt>ListChangeSets</tt> action.
_ChangeSetNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Another operation is currently in progress for this stack set. Only
--   one operation can be performed for a stack set at a given time.
_OperationInProgressException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified stack set doesn't exist.
_StackSetNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource exists, but has been changed.
_CreatedButModifiedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A client request token already exists.
_TokenAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified extension configuration cannot be found.
_TypeConfigurationNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified extension does not exist in the CloudFormation registry.
_TypeNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource with the name requested already exists.
_AlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified operation ID already exists.
_OperationIdAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The quota for the resource has already been reached.
--   
--   For information on resource and stack limitations, see <a>Limits</a>
--   in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An error occurred during a CloudFormation registry operation.
_CFNRegistryException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Error reserved for use by the <a>CloudFormation CLI</a>.
--   CloudFormation does not return this error to users.
_InvalidStateTransitionException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified stack instance doesn't exist.
_StackInstanceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified stack ARN doesn’t exist or stack doesn’t exist
--   corresponding to the ARN in input.
_StackNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

pattern Replacement_True :: Replacement

-- | Structure that contains the results of the account gate function which
--   CloudFormation invokes, if present, before proceeding with a stack set
--   operation in an account and Region.
--   
--   For each account and Region, CloudFormation lets you specify a Lambda
--   function that encapsulates any requirements that must be met before
--   CloudFormation can proceed with a stack set operation in that account
--   and Region. CloudFormation invokes the function each time a stack set
--   operation is requested for that account and Region; if the function
--   returns <tt>FAILED</tt>, CloudFormation cancels the operation in that
--   account and Region, and sets the stack set operation result status for
--   that account and Region to <tt>FAILED</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configuring a target account gate</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccountGateResult</a> smart constructor.
data AccountGateResult
AccountGateResult' :: Maybe AccountGateStatus -> Maybe Text -> AccountGateResult

-- | The status of the account gate function.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The account gate function has determined that
--   the account and Region passes any requirements for a stack set
--   operation to occur. CloudFormation proceeds with the stack operation
--   in that account and Region.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The account gate function has determined that the
--   account and Region does not meet the requirements for a stack set
--   operation to occur. AWS CloudFormation cancels the stack set operation
--   in that account and Region, and sets the stack set operation result
--   status for that account and Region to <tt>FAILED</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>SKIPPED</tt>: CloudFormation has skipped calling the account
--   gate function for this account and Region, for one of the following
--   reasons:<ul><li>An account gate function has not been specified for
--   the account and Region. CloudFormation proceeds with the stack set
--   operation in this account and Region.</li><li>The
--   <tt>AWSCloudFormationStackSetExecutionRole</tt> of the stack set
--   adminstration account lacks permissions to invoke the function.
--   CloudFormation proceeds with the stack set operation in this account
--   and Region.</li><li>Either no action is necessary, or no action is
--   possible, on the stack. CloudFormation skips the stack set operation
--   in this account and Region.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:AccountGateResult'] :: AccountGateResult -> Maybe AccountGateStatus

-- | The reason for the account gate status assigned to this account and
--   Region for the stack set operation.
[$sel:statusReason:AccountGateResult'] :: AccountGateResult -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AccountGateResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AccountGateResult'</a>, <a>accountGateResult_status</a>
--   - The status of the account gate function.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The account gate function has determined that
--   the account and Region passes any requirements for a stack set
--   operation to occur. CloudFormation proceeds with the stack operation
--   in that account and Region.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The account gate function has determined that the
--   account and Region does not meet the requirements for a stack set
--   operation to occur. AWS CloudFormation cancels the stack set operation
--   in that account and Region, and sets the stack set operation result
--   status for that account and Region to <tt>FAILED</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>SKIPPED</tt>: CloudFormation has skipped calling the account
--   gate function for this account and Region, for one of the following
--   reasons:<ul><li>An account gate function has not been specified for
--   the account and Region. CloudFormation proceeds with the stack set
--   operation in this account and Region.</li><li>The
--   <tt>AWSCloudFormationStackSetExecutionRole</tt> of the stack set
--   adminstration account lacks permissions to invoke the function.
--   CloudFormation proceeds with the stack set operation in this account
--   and Region.</li><li>Either no action is necessary, or no action is
--   possible, on the stack. CloudFormation skips the stack set operation
--   in this account and Region.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusReason:AccountGateResult'</a>,
--   <a>accountGateResult_statusReason</a> - The reason for the account
--   gate status assigned to this account and Region for the stack set
--   operation.
newAccountGateResult :: AccountGateResult

-- | The status of the account gate function.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The account gate function has determined that
--   the account and Region passes any requirements for a stack set
--   operation to occur. CloudFormation proceeds with the stack operation
--   in that account and Region.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The account gate function has determined that the
--   account and Region does not meet the requirements for a stack set
--   operation to occur. AWS CloudFormation cancels the stack set operation
--   in that account and Region, and sets the stack set operation result
--   status for that account and Region to <tt>FAILED</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>SKIPPED</tt>: CloudFormation has skipped calling the account
--   gate function for this account and Region, for one of the following
--   reasons:<ul><li>An account gate function has not been specified for
--   the account and Region. CloudFormation proceeds with the stack set
--   operation in this account and Region.</li><li>The
--   <tt>AWSCloudFormationStackSetExecutionRole</tt> of the stack set
--   adminstration account lacks permissions to invoke the function.
--   CloudFormation proceeds with the stack set operation in this account
--   and Region.</li><li>Either no action is necessary, or no action is
--   possible, on the stack. CloudFormation skips the stack set operation
--   in this account and Region.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
accountGateResult_status :: Lens' AccountGateResult (Maybe AccountGateStatus)

-- | The reason for the account gate status assigned to this account and
--   Region for the stack set operation.
accountGateResult_statusReason :: Lens' AccountGateResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The AccountLimit data type.
--   
--   CloudFormation has the following limits per account:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Number of concurrent resources</li>
--   <li>Number of stacks</li>
--   <li>Number of stack outputs</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about these account limits, and other
--   CloudFormation limits, see <a>CloudFormation Limits</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccountLimit</a> smart constructor.
data AccountLimit
AccountLimit' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> AccountLimit

-- | The name of the account limit.
--   
--   Values: <tt>ConcurrentResourcesLimit</tt> | <tt>StackLimit</tt> |
--   <tt>StackOutputsLimit</tt>
[$sel:name:AccountLimit'] :: AccountLimit -> Maybe Text

-- | The value that is associated with the account limit name.
[$sel:value:AccountLimit'] :: AccountLimit -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>AccountLimit</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AccountLimit'</a>, <a>accountLimit_name</a> - The name of
--   the account limit.
--   
--   Values: <tt>ConcurrentResourcesLimit</tt> | <tt>StackLimit</tt> |
--   <tt>StackOutputsLimit</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:AccountLimit'</a>, <a>accountLimit_value</a> - The value
--   that is associated with the account limit name.
newAccountLimit :: AccountLimit

-- | The name of the account limit.
--   
--   Values: <tt>ConcurrentResourcesLimit</tt> | <tt>StackLimit</tt> |
--   <tt>StackOutputsLimit</tt>
accountLimit_name :: Lens' AccountLimit (Maybe Text)

-- | The value that is associated with the account limit name.
accountLimit_value :: Lens' AccountLimit (Maybe Int)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Describes whether StackSets
--   automatically deploys to Organizations accounts that are added to a
--   target organization or organizational unit (OU).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoDeployment</a> smart constructor.
data AutoDeployment
AutoDeployment' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> AutoDeployment

-- | If set to <tt>true</tt>, StackSets automatically deploys additional
--   stack instances to Organizations accounts that are added to a target
--   organization or organizational unit (OU) in the specified Regions. If
--   an account is removed from a target organization or OU, StackSets
--   deletes stack instances from the account in the specified Regions.
[$sel:enabled:AutoDeployment'] :: AutoDeployment -> Maybe Bool

-- | If set to <tt>true</tt>, stack resources are retained when an account
--   is removed from a target organization or OU. If set to <tt>false</tt>,
--   stack resources are deleted. Specify only if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set
--   to <tt>True</tt>.
[$sel:retainStacksOnAccountRemoval:AutoDeployment'] :: AutoDeployment -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoDeployment</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:AutoDeployment'</a>, <a>autoDeployment_enabled</a> -
--   If set to <tt>true</tt>, StackSets automatically deploys additional
--   stack instances to Organizations accounts that are added to a target
--   organization or organizational unit (OU) in the specified Regions. If
--   an account is removed from a target organization or OU, StackSets
--   deletes stack instances from the account in the specified Regions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retainStacksOnAccountRemoval:AutoDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>autoDeployment_retainStacksOnAccountRemoval</a> - If set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, stack resources are retained when an account is removed
--   from a target organization or OU. If set to <tt>false</tt>, stack
--   resources are deleted. Specify only if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to
--   <tt>True</tt>.
newAutoDeployment :: AutoDeployment

-- | If set to <tt>true</tt>, StackSets automatically deploys additional
--   stack instances to Organizations accounts that are added to a target
--   organization or organizational unit (OU) in the specified Regions. If
--   an account is removed from a target organization or OU, StackSets
--   deletes stack instances from the account in the specified Regions.
autoDeployment_enabled :: Lens' AutoDeployment (Maybe Bool)

-- | If set to <tt>true</tt>, stack resources are retained when an account
--   is removed from a target organization or OU. If set to <tt>false</tt>,
--   stack resources are deleted. Specify only if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set
--   to <tt>True</tt>.
autoDeployment_retainStacksOnAccountRemoval :: Lens' AutoDeployment (Maybe Bool)

-- | The <tt>Change</tt> structure describes the changes CloudFormation
--   will perform if you execute the change set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChange</a> smart constructor.
data Change
Change' :: Maybe ResourceChange -> Maybe ChangeType -> Change

-- | A <tt>ResourceChange</tt> structure that describes the resource and
--   action that CloudFormation will perform.
[$sel:resourceChange:Change'] :: Change -> Maybe ResourceChange

-- | The type of entity that CloudFormation changes. Currently, the only
--   entity type is <tt>Resource</tt>.
[$sel:type':Change'] :: Change -> Maybe ChangeType

-- | Create a value of <a>Change</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceChange:Change'</a>, <a>change_resourceChange</a> - A
--   <tt>ResourceChange</tt> structure that describes the resource and
--   action that CloudFormation will perform.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Change'</a>, <a>change_type</a> - The type of entity
--   that CloudFormation changes. Currently, the only entity type is
--   <tt>Resource</tt>.
newChange :: Change

-- | A <tt>ResourceChange</tt> structure that describes the resource and
--   action that CloudFormation will perform.
change_resourceChange :: Lens' Change (Maybe ResourceChange)

-- | The type of entity that CloudFormation changes. Currently, the only
--   entity type is <tt>Resource</tt>.
change_type :: Lens' Change (Maybe ChangeType)

-- | The <tt>ChangeSetSummary</tt> structure describes a change set, its
--   status, and the stack with which it's associated.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChangeSetSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ChangeSetSummary
ChangeSetSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe ChangeSetStatus -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ChangeSetSummary

-- | The root change set ID.
[$sel:rootChangeSetId:ChangeSetSummary'] :: ChangeSetSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The start time when the change set was created, in UTC.
[$sel:creationTime:ChangeSetSummary'] :: ChangeSetSummary -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The state of the change set, such as <tt>CREATE_IN_PROGRESS</tt>,
--   <tt>CREATE_COMPLETE</tt>, or <tt>FAILED</tt>.
[$sel:status:ChangeSetSummary'] :: ChangeSetSummary -> Maybe ChangeSetStatus

-- | Specifies the current setting of <tt>IncludeNestedStacks</tt> for the
--   change set.
[$sel:includeNestedStacks:ChangeSetSummary'] :: ChangeSetSummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the stack with which the change set is associated.
[$sel:stackName:ChangeSetSummary'] :: ChangeSetSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | If the change set execution status is <tt>AVAILABLE</tt>, you can
--   execute the change set. If you can’t execute the change set, the
--   status indicates why. For example, a change set might be in an
--   <tt>UNAVAILABLE</tt> state because CloudFormation is still creating it
--   or in an <tt>OBSOLETE</tt> state because the stack was already
--   updated.
[$sel:executionStatus:ChangeSetSummary'] :: ChangeSetSummary -> Maybe ExecutionStatus

-- | The ID of the stack with which the change set is associated.
[$sel:stackId:ChangeSetSummary'] :: ChangeSetSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The parent change set ID.
[$sel:parentChangeSetId:ChangeSetSummary'] :: ChangeSetSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the change set.
[$sel:changeSetId:ChangeSetSummary'] :: ChangeSetSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Descriptive information about the change set.
[$sel:description:ChangeSetSummary'] :: ChangeSetSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the change set.
[$sel:changeSetName:ChangeSetSummary'] :: ChangeSetSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the change set's status. For example, if your change
--   set is in the <tt>FAILED</tt> state, CloudFormation shows the error
--   message.
[$sel:statusReason:ChangeSetSummary'] :: ChangeSetSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ChangeSetSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rootChangeSetId:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_rootChangeSetId</a> - The root change set ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_creationTime</a> - The start time when the change
--   set was created, in UTC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ChangeSetSummary'</a>, <a>changeSetSummary_status</a> -
--   The state of the change set, such as <tt>CREATE_IN_PROGRESS</tt>,
--   <tt>CREATE_COMPLETE</tt>, or <tt>FAILED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeNestedStacks:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_includeNestedStacks</a> - Specifies the current
--   setting of <tt>IncludeNestedStacks</tt> for the change set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_stackName</a> - The name of the stack with which
--   the change set is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionStatus:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_executionStatus</a> - If the change set execution
--   status is <tt>AVAILABLE</tt>, you can execute the change set. If you
--   can’t execute the change set, the status indicates why. For example, a
--   change set might be in an <tt>UNAVAILABLE</tt> state because
--   CloudFormation is still creating it or in an <tt>OBSOLETE</tt> state
--   because the stack was already updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:ChangeSetSummary'</a>, <a>changeSetSummary_stackId</a>
--   - The ID of the stack with which the change set is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentChangeSetId:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_parentChangeSetId</a> - The parent change set ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:changeSetId:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_changeSetId</a> - The ID of the change set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_description</a> - Descriptive information about
--   the change set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:changeSetName:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_changeSetName</a> - The name of the change set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusReason:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_statusReason</a> - A description of the change
--   set's status. For example, if your change set is in the
--   <tt>FAILED</tt> state, CloudFormation shows the error message.
newChangeSetSummary :: ChangeSetSummary

-- | The root change set ID.
changeSetSummary_rootChangeSetId :: Lens' ChangeSetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The start time when the change set was created, in UTC.
changeSetSummary_creationTime :: Lens' ChangeSetSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The state of the change set, such as <tt>CREATE_IN_PROGRESS</tt>,
--   <tt>CREATE_COMPLETE</tt>, or <tt>FAILED</tt>.
changeSetSummary_status :: Lens' ChangeSetSummary (Maybe ChangeSetStatus)

-- | Specifies the current setting of <tt>IncludeNestedStacks</tt> for the
--   change set.
changeSetSummary_includeNestedStacks :: Lens' ChangeSetSummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the stack with which the change set is associated.
changeSetSummary_stackName :: Lens' ChangeSetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | If the change set execution status is <tt>AVAILABLE</tt>, you can
--   execute the change set. If you can’t execute the change set, the
--   status indicates why. For example, a change set might be in an
--   <tt>UNAVAILABLE</tt> state because CloudFormation is still creating it
--   or in an <tt>OBSOLETE</tt> state because the stack was already
--   updated.
changeSetSummary_executionStatus :: Lens' ChangeSetSummary (Maybe ExecutionStatus)

-- | The ID of the stack with which the change set is associated.
changeSetSummary_stackId :: Lens' ChangeSetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The parent change set ID.
changeSetSummary_parentChangeSetId :: Lens' ChangeSetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the change set.
changeSetSummary_changeSetId :: Lens' ChangeSetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Descriptive information about the change set.
changeSetSummary_description :: Lens' ChangeSetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the change set.
changeSetSummary_changeSetName :: Lens' ChangeSetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the change set's status. For example, if your change
--   set is in the <tt>FAILED</tt> state, CloudFormation shows the error
--   message.
changeSetSummary_statusReason :: Lens' ChangeSetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> The Organizations accounts to
--   which StackSets deploys. StackSets does not deploy stack instances to
--   the organization management account, even if the organization
--   management account is in your organization or in an OU in your
--   organization.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For update operations, you can specify either <tt>Accounts</tt> or
--   <tt>OrganizationalUnitIds</tt>. For create and delete operations,
--   specify <tt>OrganizationalUnitIds</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeploymentTargets</a> smart constructor.
data DeploymentTargets
DeploymentTargets' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> DeploymentTargets

-- | The organization root ID or organizational unit (OU) IDs to which
--   StackSets deploys.
[$sel:organizationalUnitIds:DeploymentTargets'] :: DeploymentTargets -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The names of one or more Amazon Web Services accounts for which you
--   want to deploy stack set updates.
[$sel:accounts:DeploymentTargets'] :: DeploymentTargets -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Returns the value of the <tt>AccountsUrl</tt> property.
[$sel:accountsUrl:DeploymentTargets'] :: DeploymentTargets -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeploymentTargets</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitIds:DeploymentTargets'</a>,
--   <a>deploymentTargets_organizationalUnitIds</a> - The organization root
--   ID or organizational unit (OU) IDs to which StackSets deploys.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accounts:DeploymentTargets'</a>,
--   <a>deploymentTargets_accounts</a> - The names of one or more Amazon
--   Web Services accounts for which you want to deploy stack set updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountsUrl:DeploymentTargets'</a>,
--   <a>deploymentTargets_accountsUrl</a> - Returns the value of the
--   <tt>AccountsUrl</tt> property.
newDeploymentTargets :: DeploymentTargets

-- | The organization root ID or organizational unit (OU) IDs to which
--   StackSets deploys.
deploymentTargets_organizationalUnitIds :: Lens' DeploymentTargets (Maybe [Text])

-- | The names of one or more Amazon Web Services accounts for which you
--   want to deploy stack set updates.
deploymentTargets_accounts :: Lens' DeploymentTargets (Maybe [Text])

-- | Returns the value of the <tt>AccountsUrl</tt> property.
deploymentTargets_accountsUrl :: Lens' DeploymentTargets (Maybe Text)

-- | The <tt>Export</tt> structure describes the exported output values for
--   a stack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExport</a> smart constructor.
data Export
Export' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Export

-- | The name of exported output value. Use this name and the
--   <tt>Fn::ImportValue</tt> function to import the associated value into
--   other stacks. The name is defined in the <tt>Export</tt> field in the
--   associated stack's <tt>Outputs</tt> section.
[$sel:name:Export'] :: Export -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack that contains the exported output name and value.
[$sel:exportingStackId:Export'] :: Export -> Maybe Text

-- | The value of the exported output, such as a resource physical ID. This
--   value is defined in the <tt>Export</tt> field in the associated
--   stack's <tt>Outputs</tt> section.
[$sel:value:Export'] :: Export -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Export</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Export'</a>, <a>export_name</a> - The name of exported
--   output value. Use this name and the <tt>Fn::ImportValue</tt> function
--   to import the associated value into other stacks. The name is defined
--   in the <tt>Export</tt> field in the associated stack's
--   <tt>Outputs</tt> section.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exportingStackId:Export'</a>, <a>export_exportingStackId</a> -
--   The stack that contains the exported output name and value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Export'</a>, <a>export_value</a> - The value of the
--   exported output, such as a resource physical ID. This value is defined
--   in the <tt>Export</tt> field in the associated stack's
--   <tt>Outputs</tt> section.
newExport :: Export

-- | The name of exported output value. Use this name and the
--   <tt>Fn::ImportValue</tt> function to import the associated value into
--   other stacks. The name is defined in the <tt>Export</tt> field in the
--   associated stack's <tt>Outputs</tt> section.
export_name :: Lens' Export (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack that contains the exported output name and value.
export_exportingStackId :: Lens' Export (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the exported output, such as a resource physical ID. This
--   value is defined in the <tt>Export</tt> field in the associated
--   stack's <tt>Outputs</tt> section.
export_value :: Lens' Export (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains logging configuration information for an extension.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoggingConfig</a> smart constructor.
data LoggingConfig
LoggingConfig' :: Text -> Text -> LoggingConfig

-- | The ARN of the role that CloudFormation should assume when sending log
--   entries to CloudWatch logs.
[$sel:logRoleArn:LoggingConfig'] :: LoggingConfig -> Text

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch log group to which CloudFormation sends error
--   logging information when invoking the extension's handlers.
[$sel:logGroupName:LoggingConfig'] :: LoggingConfig -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoggingConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:logRoleArn:LoggingConfig'</a>, <a>loggingConfig_logRoleArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the role that CloudFormation should assume when sending
--   log entries to CloudWatch logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logGroupName:LoggingConfig'</a>,
--   <a>loggingConfig_logGroupName</a> - The Amazon CloudWatch log group to
--   which CloudFormation sends error logging information when invoking the
--   extension's handlers.
newLoggingConfig :: Text -> Text -> LoggingConfig

-- | The ARN of the role that CloudFormation should assume when sending log
--   entries to CloudWatch logs.
loggingConfig_logRoleArn :: Lens' LoggingConfig Text

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch log group to which CloudFormation sends error
--   logging information when invoking the extension's handlers.
loggingConfig_logGroupName :: Lens' LoggingConfig Text

-- | Contains information about the module from which the resource was
--   created, if the resource was created from a module included in the
--   stack template.
--   
--   For more information on modules, see <a>Using modules to encapsulate
--   and reuse resource configurations</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newModuleInfo</a> smart constructor.
data ModuleInfo
ModuleInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ModuleInfo

-- | A concantenated list of the logical IDs of the module or modules
--   containing the resource. Modules are listed starting with the
--   inner-most nested module, and separated by <tt>/</tt>.
--   
--   In the following example, the resource was created from a module,
--   <tt>moduleA</tt>, that is nested inside a parent module,
--   <tt>moduleB</tt>.
--   
--   <pre>
--   moduleA/moduleB
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Referencing resources in a module</a> in
--   the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
[$sel:logicalIdHierarchy:ModuleInfo'] :: ModuleInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A concantenated list of the the module type or types containing the
--   resource. Module types are listed starting with the inner-most nested
--   module, and separated by <tt>/</tt>.
--   
--   In the following example, the resource was created from a module of
--   type <tt>AWS::First::Example::MODULE</tt>, that is nested inside a
--   parent module of type <tt>AWS::Second::Example::MODULE</tt>.
--   
--   <pre>
--   AWS::First::Example::MODULE/AWS::Second::Example::MODULE
--   </pre>
[$sel:typeHierarchy:ModuleInfo'] :: ModuleInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ModuleInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalIdHierarchy:ModuleInfo'</a>,
--   <a>moduleInfo_logicalIdHierarchy</a> - A concantenated list of the
--   logical IDs of the module or modules containing the resource. Modules
--   are listed starting with the inner-most nested module, and separated
--   by <tt>/</tt>.
--   
--   In the following example, the resource was created from a module,
--   <tt>moduleA</tt>, that is nested inside a parent module,
--   <tt>moduleB</tt>.
--   
--   <pre>
--   moduleA/moduleB
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Referencing resources in a module</a> in
--   the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeHierarchy:ModuleInfo'</a>, <a>moduleInfo_typeHierarchy</a>
--   - A concantenated list of the the module type or types containing the
--   resource. Module types are listed starting with the inner-most nested
--   module, and separated by <tt>/</tt>.
--   
--   In the following example, the resource was created from a module of
--   type <tt>AWS::First::Example::MODULE</tt>, that is nested inside a
--   parent module of type <tt>AWS::Second::Example::MODULE</tt>.
--   
--   <pre>
--   AWS::First::Example::MODULE/AWS::Second::Example::MODULE
--   </pre>
newModuleInfo :: ModuleInfo

-- | A concantenated list of the logical IDs of the module or modules
--   containing the resource. Modules are listed starting with the
--   inner-most nested module, and separated by <tt>/</tt>.
--   
--   In the following example, the resource was created from a module,
--   <tt>moduleA</tt>, that is nested inside a parent module,
--   <tt>moduleB</tt>.
--   
--   <pre>
--   moduleA/moduleB
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Referencing resources in a module</a> in
--   the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
moduleInfo_logicalIdHierarchy :: Lens' ModuleInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A concantenated list of the the module type or types containing the
--   resource. Module types are listed starting with the inner-most nested
--   module, and separated by <tt>/</tt>.
--   
--   In the following example, the resource was created from a module of
--   type <tt>AWS::First::Example::MODULE</tt>, that is nested inside a
--   parent module of type <tt>AWS::Second::Example::MODULE</tt>.
--   
--   <pre>
--   AWS::First::Example::MODULE/AWS::Second::Example::MODULE
--   </pre>
moduleInfo_typeHierarchy :: Lens' ModuleInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The Output data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutput</a> smart constructor.
data Output
Output' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Output

-- | The key associated with the output.
[$sel:outputKey:Output'] :: Output -> Maybe Text

-- | The value associated with the output.
[$sel:outputValue:Output'] :: Output -> Maybe Text

-- | User defined description associated with the output.
[$sel:description:Output'] :: Output -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the export associated with the output.
[$sel:exportName:Output'] :: Output -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Output</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputKey:Output'</a>, <a>output_outputKey</a> - The key
--   associated with the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputValue:Output'</a>, <a>output_outputValue</a> - The value
--   associated with the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Output'</a>, <a>output_description</a> - User
--   defined description associated with the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exportName:Output'</a>, <a>output_exportName</a> - The name of
--   the export associated with the output.
newOutput :: Output

-- | The key associated with the output.
output_outputKey :: Lens' Output (Maybe Text)

-- | The value associated with the output.
output_outputValue :: Lens' Output (Maybe Text)

-- | User defined description associated with the output.
output_description :: Lens' Output (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the export associated with the output.
output_exportName :: Lens' Output (Maybe Text)

-- | The Parameter data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParameter</a> smart constructor.
data Parameter
Parameter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Parameter

-- | The input value associated with the parameter.
[$sel:parameterValue:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | During a stack update, use the existing parameter value that the stack
--   is using for a given parameter key. If you specify <tt>true</tt>, do
--   not specify a parameter value.
[$sel:usePreviousValue:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Bool

-- | The key associated with the parameter. If you don't specify a key and
--   value for a particular parameter, CloudFormation uses the default
--   value that is specified in your template.
[$sel:parameterKey:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | Read-only. The value that corresponds to a Systems Manager parameter
--   key. This field is returned only for <a>SSM parameter types</a> in the
--   template.
[$sel:resolvedValue:Parameter'] :: Parameter -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Parameter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterValue:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_parameterValue</a>
--   - The input value associated with the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:usePreviousValue:Parameter'</a>,
--   <a>parameter_usePreviousValue</a> - During a stack update, use the
--   existing parameter value that the stack is using for a given parameter
--   key. If you specify <tt>true</tt>, do not specify a parameter value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterKey:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_parameterKey</a> -
--   The key associated with the parameter. If you don't specify a key and
--   value for a particular parameter, CloudFormation uses the default
--   value that is specified in your template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resolvedValue:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_resolvedValue</a> -
--   Read-only. The value that corresponds to a Systems Manager parameter
--   key. This field is returned only for <a>SSM parameter types</a> in the
--   template.
newParameter :: Parameter

-- | The input value associated with the parameter.
parameter_parameterValue :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | During a stack update, use the existing parameter value that the stack
--   is using for a given parameter key. If you specify <tt>true</tt>, do
--   not specify a parameter value.
parameter_usePreviousValue :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Bool)

-- | The key associated with the parameter. If you don't specify a key and
--   value for a particular parameter, CloudFormation uses the default
--   value that is specified in your template.
parameter_parameterKey :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Read-only. The value that corresponds to a Systems Manager parameter
--   key. This field is returned only for <a>SSM parameter types</a> in the
--   template.
parameter_resolvedValue :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | A set of criteria that CloudFormation uses to validate parameter
--   values. Although other constraints might be defined in the stack
--   template, CloudFormation returns only the <tt>AllowedValues</tt>
--   property.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParameterConstraints</a> smart constructor.
data ParameterConstraints
ParameterConstraints' :: Maybe [Text] -> ParameterConstraints

-- | A list of values that are permitted for a parameter.
[$sel:allowedValues:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ParameterConstraints</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedValues:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_allowedValues</a> - A list of values that are
--   permitted for a parameter.
newParameterConstraints :: ParameterConstraints

-- | A list of values that are permitted for a parameter.
parameterConstraints_allowedValues :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe [Text])

-- | The ParameterDeclaration data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParameterDeclaration</a> smart constructor.
data ParameterDeclaration
ParameterDeclaration' :: Maybe ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> ParameterDeclaration

-- | The criteria that CloudFormation uses to validate parameter values.
[$sel:parameterConstraints:ParameterDeclaration'] :: ParameterDeclaration -> Maybe ParameterConstraints

-- | The type of parameter.
[$sel:parameterType:ParameterDeclaration'] :: ParameterDeclaration -> Maybe Text

-- | The description that is associate with the parameter.
[$sel:description:ParameterDeclaration'] :: ParameterDeclaration -> Maybe Text

-- | The name that is associated with the parameter.
[$sel:parameterKey:ParameterDeclaration'] :: ParameterDeclaration -> Maybe Text

-- | The default value of the parameter.
[$sel:defaultValue:ParameterDeclaration'] :: ParameterDeclaration -> Maybe Text

-- | Flag that indicates whether the parameter value is shown as plain text
--   in logs and in the Amazon Web Services Management Console.
[$sel:noEcho:ParameterDeclaration'] :: ParameterDeclaration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ParameterDeclaration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterConstraints:ParameterDeclaration'</a>,
--   <a>parameterDeclaration_parameterConstraints</a> - The criteria that
--   CloudFormation uses to validate parameter values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterType:ParameterDeclaration'</a>,
--   <a>parameterDeclaration_parameterType</a> - The type of parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ParameterDeclaration'</a>,
--   <a>parameterDeclaration_description</a> - The description that is
--   associate with the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterKey:ParameterDeclaration'</a>,
--   <a>parameterDeclaration_parameterKey</a> - The name that is associated
--   with the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultValue:ParameterDeclaration'</a>,
--   <a>parameterDeclaration_defaultValue</a> - The default value of the
--   parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noEcho:ParameterDeclaration'</a>,
--   <a>parameterDeclaration_noEcho</a> - Flag that indicates whether the
--   parameter value is shown as plain text in logs and in the Amazon Web
--   Services Management Console.
newParameterDeclaration :: ParameterDeclaration

-- | The criteria that CloudFormation uses to validate parameter values.
parameterDeclaration_parameterConstraints :: Lens' ParameterDeclaration (Maybe ParameterConstraints)

-- | The type of parameter.
parameterDeclaration_parameterType :: Lens' ParameterDeclaration (Maybe Text)

-- | The description that is associate with the parameter.
parameterDeclaration_description :: Lens' ParameterDeclaration (Maybe Text)

-- | The name that is associated with the parameter.
parameterDeclaration_parameterKey :: Lens' ParameterDeclaration (Maybe Text)

-- | The default value of the parameter.
parameterDeclaration_defaultValue :: Lens' ParameterDeclaration (Maybe Text)

-- | Flag that indicates whether the parameter value is shown as plain text
--   in logs and in the Amazon Web Services Management Console.
parameterDeclaration_noEcho :: Lens' ParameterDeclaration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Context information that enables CloudFormation to uniquely identify a
--   resource. CloudFormation uses context key-value pairs in cases where a
--   resource's logical and physical IDs are not enough to uniquely
--   identify that resource. Each context key-value pair specifies a
--   resource that contains the targeted resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair
PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair' :: Text -> Text -> PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair

-- | The resource context key.
[$sel:key:PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair'] :: PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair -> Text

-- | The resource context value.
[$sel:value:PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair'] :: PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair'</a>,
--   <a>physicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair_key</a> - The resource
--   context key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair'</a>,
--   <a>physicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair_value</a> - The resource
--   context value.
newPhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair :: Text -> Text -> PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair

-- | The resource context key.
physicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair_key :: Lens' PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair Text

-- | The resource context value.
physicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair_value :: Lens' PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair Text

-- | Information about a resource property whose actual value differs from
--   its expected value, as defined in the stack template and any values
--   specified as template parameters. These will be present only for
--   resources whose <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is
--   <tt>MODIFIED</tt>. For more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated
--   Configuration Changes to Stacks and Resources</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPropertyDifference</a> smart constructor.
data PropertyDifference
PropertyDifference' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DifferenceType -> PropertyDifference

-- | The fully-qualified path to the resource property.
[$sel:propertyPath:PropertyDifference'] :: PropertyDifference -> Text

-- | The expected property value of the resource property, as defined in
--   the stack template and any values specified as template parameters.
[$sel:expectedValue:PropertyDifference'] :: PropertyDifference -> Text

-- | The actual property value of the resource property.
[$sel:actualValue:PropertyDifference'] :: PropertyDifference -> Text

-- | The type of property difference.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ADD</tt>: A value has been added to a resource property that
--   is an array or list data type.</li>
--   <li><tt>REMOVE</tt>: The property has been removed from the current
--   resource configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_EQUAL</tt>: The current property value differs from its
--   expected value (as defined in the stack template and any values
--   specified as template parameters).</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:differenceType:PropertyDifference'] :: PropertyDifference -> DifferenceType

-- | Create a value of <a>PropertyDifference</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyPath:PropertyDifference'</a>,
--   <a>propertyDifference_propertyPath</a> - The fully-qualified path to
--   the resource property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedValue:PropertyDifference'</a>,
--   <a>propertyDifference_expectedValue</a> - The expected property value
--   of the resource property, as defined in the stack template and any
--   values specified as template parameters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actualValue:PropertyDifference'</a>,
--   <a>propertyDifference_actualValue</a> - The actual property value of
--   the resource property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:differenceType:PropertyDifference'</a>,
--   <a>propertyDifference_differenceType</a> - The type of property
--   difference.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ADD</tt>: A value has been added to a resource property that
--   is an array or list data type.</li>
--   <li><tt>REMOVE</tt>: The property has been removed from the current
--   resource configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_EQUAL</tt>: The current property value differs from its
--   expected value (as defined in the stack template and any values
--   specified as template parameters).</li>
--   </ul>
newPropertyDifference :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DifferenceType -> PropertyDifference

-- | The fully-qualified path to the resource property.
propertyDifference_propertyPath :: Lens' PropertyDifference Text

-- | The expected property value of the resource property, as defined in
--   the stack template and any values specified as template parameters.
propertyDifference_expectedValue :: Lens' PropertyDifference Text

-- | The actual property value of the resource property.
propertyDifference_actualValue :: Lens' PropertyDifference Text

-- | The type of property difference.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ADD</tt>: A value has been added to a resource property that
--   is an array or list data type.</li>
--   <li><tt>REMOVE</tt>: The property has been removed from the current
--   resource configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_EQUAL</tt>: The current property value differs from its
--   expected value (as defined in the stack template and any values
--   specified as template parameters).</li>
--   </ul>
propertyDifference_differenceType :: Lens' PropertyDifference DifferenceType

-- | For extensions that are modules, a public third-party extension that
--   must be activated in your account in order for the module itself to be
--   activated.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Activating public modules for use in your
--   account</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRequiredActivatedType</a> smart constructor.
data RequiredActivatedType
RequiredActivatedType' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Natural] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RequiredActivatedType

-- | The publisher ID of the extension publisher.
[$sel:publisherId:RequiredActivatedType'] :: RequiredActivatedType -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the major versions of the extension type that the macro
--   supports.
[$sel:supportedMajorVersions:RequiredActivatedType'] :: RequiredActivatedType -> Maybe [Natural]

-- | An alias assigned to the public extension, in this account and region.
--   If you specify an alias for the extension, CloudFormation treats the
--   alias as the extension type name within this account and region. You
--   must use the alias to refer to the extension in your templates, API
--   calls, and CloudFormation console.
[$sel:typeNameAlias:RequiredActivatedType'] :: RequiredActivatedType -> Maybe Text

-- | The type name of the public extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when enabling the extension
--   in this account and region, CloudFormation treats that alias as the
--   extension's type name within the account and region, not the type name
--   of the public extension. For more information, see <a>Specifying
--   aliases to refer to extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:originalTypeName:RequiredActivatedType'] :: RequiredActivatedType -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RequiredActivatedType</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:publisherId:RequiredActivatedType'</a>,
--   <a>requiredActivatedType_publisherId</a> - The publisher ID of the
--   extension publisher.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportedMajorVersions:RequiredActivatedType'</a>,
--   <a>requiredActivatedType_supportedMajorVersions</a> - A list of the
--   major versions of the extension type that the macro supports.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeNameAlias:RequiredActivatedType'</a>,
--   <a>requiredActivatedType_typeNameAlias</a> - An alias assigned to the
--   public extension, in this account and region. If you specify an alias
--   for the extension, CloudFormation treats the alias as the extension
--   type name within this account and region. You must use the alias to
--   refer to the extension in your templates, API calls, and
--   CloudFormation console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originalTypeName:RequiredActivatedType'</a>,
--   <a>requiredActivatedType_originalTypeName</a> - The type name of the
--   public extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when enabling the extension
--   in this account and region, CloudFormation treats that alias as the
--   extension's type name within the account and region, not the type name
--   of the public extension. For more information, see <a>Specifying
--   aliases to refer to extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
newRequiredActivatedType :: RequiredActivatedType

-- | The publisher ID of the extension publisher.
requiredActivatedType_publisherId :: Lens' RequiredActivatedType (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the major versions of the extension type that the macro
--   supports.
requiredActivatedType_supportedMajorVersions :: Lens' RequiredActivatedType (Maybe [Natural])

-- | An alias assigned to the public extension, in this account and region.
--   If you specify an alias for the extension, CloudFormation treats the
--   alias as the extension type name within this account and region. You
--   must use the alias to refer to the extension in your templates, API
--   calls, and CloudFormation console.
requiredActivatedType_typeNameAlias :: Lens' RequiredActivatedType (Maybe Text)

-- | The type name of the public extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when enabling the extension
--   in this account and region, CloudFormation treats that alias as the
--   extension's type name within the account and region, not the type name
--   of the public extension. For more information, see <a>Specifying
--   aliases to refer to extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
requiredActivatedType_originalTypeName :: Lens' RequiredActivatedType (Maybe Text)

-- | The <tt>ResourceChange</tt> structure describes the resource and the
--   action that CloudFormation will perform on it if you execute this
--   change set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceChange</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceChange
ResourceChange' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ResourceChangeDetail] -> Maybe [ResourceAttribute] -> Maybe ModuleInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChangeAction -> Maybe Replacement -> ResourceChange

-- | The type of CloudFormation resource, such as <tt>AWS::S3::Bucket</tt>.
[$sel:resourceType:ResourceChange'] :: ResourceChange -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource's physical ID (resource name). Resources that you are
--   adding don't have physical IDs because they haven't been created.
