-- | Tests a registered extension to make sure it meets all necessary
--   requirements for being published in the CloudFormation registry.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For resource types, this includes passing all contracts tests
--   defined for the type.</li>
--   <li>For modules, this includes determining if the module's model meets
--   all necessary requirements.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Testing your public extension prior to
--   publishing</a> in the <i>CloudFormation CLI User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you do not specify a version, CloudFormation uses the default
--   version of the extension in your account and region for testing.
--   
--   To perform testing, CloudFormation assumes the execution role
--   specified when the type was registered. For more information, see
--   <a>RegisterType</a>.
--   
--   Once you've initiated testing on an extension using <tt>TestType</tt>,
--   you can use <a>DescribeType</a> to monitor the current test status and
--   test status description for the extension.
--   
--   An extension must have a test status of <tt>PASSED</tt> before it can
--   be published. For more information, see <a>Publishing extensions to
--   make them available for public use</a> in the <i>CloudFormation CLI
--   User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.TestType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTestType</a> smart constructor.
data TestType
TestType' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ThirdPartyType -> TestType

-- | The name of the extension to test.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>Arn</tt>, or <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>.
[$sel:typeName:TestType'] :: TestType -> Maybe Text

-- | The S3 bucket to which CloudFormation delivers the contract test
--   execution logs.
--   
--   CloudFormation delivers the logs by the time contract testing has
--   completed and the extension has been assigned a test type status of
--   <tt>PASSED</tt> or <tt>FAILED</tt>.
--   
--   The user calling <tt>TestType</tt> must be able to access items in the
--   specified S3 bucket. Specifically, the user needs the following
--   permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>GetObject</li>
--   <li>PutObject</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Actions, Resources, and Condition Keys
--   for Amazon S3</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services Identity and Access
--   Management User Guide</i>.
[$sel:logDeliveryBucket:TestType'] :: TestType -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>Arn</tt>, or <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>.
[$sel:arn:TestType'] :: TestType -> Maybe Text

-- | The version of the extension to test.
--   
--   You can specify the version id with either <tt>Arn</tt>, or with
--   <tt>TypeName</tt> and <tt>Type</tt>.
--   
--   If you do not specify a version, CloudFormation uses the default
--   version of the extension in this account and region for testing.
[$sel:versionId:TestType'] :: TestType -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the extension to test.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>Arn</tt>, or <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>.
[$sel:type':TestType'] :: TestType -> Maybe ThirdPartyType

-- | Create a value of <a>TestType</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   CloudFormation delivers the contract test execution logs.

-- | Stops an in-progress operation on a stack set and its associated stack
--   instances.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.StopStackSetOperation

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStopStackSetOperation</a> smart constructor.
data StopStackSetOperation
StopStackSetOperation' :: Maybe CallAs -> Text -> Text -> StopStackSetOperation

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Specifies whether you are
--   acting as an account administrator in the organization's management
--   account or as a delegated administrator in a member account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:callAs:StopStackSetOperation'] :: StopStackSetOperation -> Maybe CallAs

-- | The name or unique ID of the stack set that you want to stop the
--   operation for.
[$sel:stackSetName:StopStackSetOperation'] :: StopStackSetOperation -> Text

-- | The ID of the stack operation.
[$sel:operationId:StopStackSetOperation'] :: StopStackSetOperation -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StopStackSetOperation</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAs:StopStackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stopStackSetOperation_callAs</a> - [Service-managed permissions]
--   Specifies whether you are acting as an account administrator in the
--   organization's management account or as a delegated administrator in a
--   member account.
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:StopStackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stopStackSetOperation_stackSetName</a> - The name or unique ID of
--   the stack set that you want to stop the operation for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operationId:StopStackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stopStackSetOperation_operationId</a> - The ID of the stack
--   operation.
newStopStackSetOperation :: Text -> Text -> StopStackSetOperation

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Specifies whether you are
--   acting as an account administrator in the organization's management
--   account or as a delegated administrator in a member account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
stopStackSetOperation_callAs :: Lens' StopStackSetOperation (Maybe CallAs)

-- | The name or unique ID of the stack set that you want to stop the
--   operation for.
stopStackSetOperation_stackSetName :: Lens' StopStackSetOperation Text

-- | The ID of the stack operation.
stopStackSetOperation_operationId :: Lens' StopStackSetOperation Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStopStackSetOperationResponse</a> smart constructor.
data StopStackSetOperationResponse
StopStackSetOperationResponse' :: Int -> StopStackSetOperationResponse

-- | The response's http status code.

-- | Sends a signal to the specified resource with a success or failure
--   status. You can use the SignalResource API in conjunction with a
--   creation policy or update policy. CloudFormation doesn't proceed with
--   a stack creation or update until resources receive the required number
--   of signals or the timeout period is exceeded. The SignalResource API
--   is useful in cases where you want to send signals from anywhere other
--   than an Amazon EC2 instance.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.SignalResource

-- | The input for the SignalResource action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSignalResource</a> smart constructor.
data SignalResource
SignalResource' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ResourceSignalStatus -> SignalResource

-- | The stack name or unique stack ID that includes the resource that you
--   want to signal.
[$sel:stackName:SignalResource'] :: SignalResource -> Text

-- | The logical ID of the resource that you want to signal. The logical ID
--   is the name of the resource that given in the template.
[$sel:logicalResourceId:SignalResource'] :: SignalResource -> Text

-- | A unique ID of the signal. When you signal Amazon EC2 instances or
--   Auto Scaling groups, specify the instance ID that you are signaling as
--   the unique ID. If you send multiple signals to a single resource (such
--   as signaling a wait condition), each signal requires a different
--   unique ID.
[$sel:uniqueId:SignalResource'] :: SignalResource -> Text

-- | The status of the signal, which is either success or failure. A
--   failure signal causes CloudFormation to immediately fail the stack
--   creation or update.
[$sel:status:SignalResource'] :: SignalResource -> ResourceSignalStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>SignalResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:SignalResource'</a>, <a>signalResource_stackName</a>
--   - The stack name or unique stack ID that includes the resource that
--   you want to signal.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:SignalResource'</a>,
--   <a>signalResource_logicalResourceId</a> - The logical ID of the
--   resource that you want to signal. The logical ID is the name of the
--   resource that given in the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uniqueId:SignalResource'</a>, <a>signalResource_uniqueId</a> -
--   A unique ID of the signal. When you signal Amazon EC2 instances or
--   Auto Scaling groups, specify the instance ID that you are signaling as
--   the unique ID. If you send multiple signals to a single resource (such
--   as signaling a wait condition), each signal requires a different
--   unique ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:SignalResource'</a>, <a>signalResource_status</a> - The
--   status of the signal, which is either success or failure. A failure
--   signal causes CloudFormation to immediately fail the stack creation or
--   update.
newSignalResource :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ResourceSignalStatus -> SignalResource

-- | The stack name or unique stack ID that includes the resource that you
--   want to signal.
signalResource_stackName :: Lens' SignalResource Text

-- | The logical ID of the resource that you want to signal. The logical ID
--   is the name of the resource that given in the template.
signalResource_logicalResourceId :: Lens' SignalResource Text

-- | A unique ID of the signal. When you signal Amazon EC2 instances or
--   Auto Scaling groups, specify the instance ID that you are signaling as
--   the unique ID. If you send multiple signals to a single resource (such
--   as signaling a wait condition), each signal requires a different
--   unique ID.
signalResource_uniqueId :: Lens' SignalResource Text

-- | The status of the signal, which is either success or failure. A
--   failure signal causes CloudFormation to immediately fail the stack
--   creation or update.
signalResource_status :: Lens' SignalResource ResourceSignalStatus

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSignalResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SignalResourceResponse
SignalResourceResponse' :: SignalResourceResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>SignalResourceResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newSignalResourceResponse :: SignalResourceResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.SignalResource.SignalResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.SignalResource.SignalResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.SignalResource.SignalResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.SignalResource.SignalResource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.SignalResource.SignalResourceResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.SignalResource.SignalResourceResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.SignalResource.SignalResourceResponse

-- | Specifies the configuration data for a registered CloudFormation
--   extension, in the given account and region.
--   
--   To view the current configuration data for an extension, refer to the
--   <tt>ConfigurationSchema</tt> element of <a>DescribeType</a>. For more
--   information, see <a>Configuring extensions at the account level</a> in
--   the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   It is strongly recommended that you use dynamic references to restrict
--   sensitive configuration definitions, such as third-party credentials.
--   For more details on dynamic references, see <a>Using dynamic
--   references to specify template values</a> in the <i>CloudFormation
--   User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.SetTypeConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSetTypeConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data SetTypeConfiguration
SetTypeConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ThirdPartyType -> Maybe Text -> Text -> SetTypeConfiguration

-- | The name of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>ConfigurationArn</tt>, or
--   <tt>Type</tt> and <tt>TypeName</tt>.
[$sel:typeName:SetTypeConfiguration'] :: SetTypeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | An alias by which to refer to this extension configuration data.
--   
--   Conditional: Specifying a configuration alias is required when setting
--   a configuration for a resource type extension.
[$sel:configurationAlias:SetTypeConfiguration'] :: SetTypeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>ConfigurationArn</tt>, or
--   <tt>Type</tt> and <tt>TypeName</tt>.
[$sel:type':SetTypeConfiguration'] :: SetTypeConfiguration -> Maybe ThirdPartyType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the extension, in this account and
--   region.
--   
--   For public extensions, this will be the ARN assigned when you
--   <a>activate the type</a> in this account and region. For private
--   extensions, this will be the ARN assigned when you <a>register the
--   type</a> in this account and region.
--   
--   Do not include the extension versions suffix at the end of the ARN.
--   You can set the configuration for an extension, but not for a specific
--   extension version.
[$sel:typeArn:SetTypeConfiguration'] :: SetTypeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The configuration data for the extension, in this account and region.
--   
--   The configuration data must be formatted as JSON, and validate against
--   the schema returned in the <tt>ConfigurationSchema</tt> response
--   element of <a>API_DescribeType</a>. For more information, see
--   <a>Defining account-level configuration data for an extension</a> in
--   the <i>CloudFormation CLI User Guide</i>.
[$sel:configuration:SetTypeConfiguration'] :: SetTypeConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SetTypeConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:SetTypeConfiguration'</a>,

--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>ConfigurationArn</tt>, or
--   <tt>Type</tt> and <tt>TypeName</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationAlias:SetTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>setTypeConfiguration_configurationAlias</a> - An alias by which to
--   refer to this extension configuration data.
--   
--   Conditional: Specifying a configuration alias is required when setting
--   a configuration for a resource type extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':SetTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>setTypeConfiguration_type</a> - The type of extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>ConfigurationArn</tt>, or
--   <tt>Type</tt> and <tt>TypeName</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeArn:SetTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>setTypeConfiguration_typeArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   for the extension, in this account and region.
--   
--   For public extensions, this will be the ARN assigned when you
--   <a>activate the type</a> in this account and region. For private
--   extensions, this will be the ARN assigned when you <a>register the

-- | Sets a stack policy for a specified stack.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.SetStackPolicy

-- | The input for the SetStackPolicy action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSetStackPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data SetStackPolicy
SetStackPolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> SetStackPolicy

-- | Structure containing the stack policy body. For more information, go
--   to <a>Prevent Updates to Stack Resources</a> in the CloudFormation
--   User Guide. You can specify either the <tt>StackPolicyBody</tt> or the
--   <tt>StackPolicyURL</tt> parameter, but not both.
[$sel:stackPolicyBody:SetStackPolicy'] :: SetStackPolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | Location of a file containing the stack policy. The URL must point to
--   a policy (maximum size: 16 KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same
--   Region as the stack. You can specify either the
--   <tt>StackPolicyBody</tt> or the <tt>StackPolicyURL</tt> parameter, but
--   not both.
[$sel:stackPolicyURL:SetStackPolicy'] :: SetStackPolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | The name or unique stack ID that you want to associate a policy with.
[$sel:stackName:SetStackPolicy'] :: SetStackPolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SetStackPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackPolicyBody:SetStackPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>setStackPolicy_stackPolicyBody</a> - Structure containing the stack
--   policy body. For more information, go to <a>Prevent Updates to Stack
--   Resources</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide. You can specify either
--   the <tt>StackPolicyBody</tt> or the <tt>StackPolicyURL</tt> parameter,
--   but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackPolicyURL:SetStackPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>setStackPolicy_stackPolicyURL</a> - Location of a file containing
--   the stack policy. The URL must point to a policy (maximum size: 16 KB)
--   located in an S3 bucket in the same Region as the stack. You can
--   specify either the <tt>StackPolicyBody</tt> or the
--   <tt>StackPolicyURL</tt> parameter, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:SetStackPolicy'</a>, <a>setStackPolicy_stackName</a>
--   - The name or unique stack ID that you want to associate a policy
--   with.
newSetStackPolicy :: Text -> SetStackPolicy

-- | Structure containing the stack policy body. For more information, go
--   to <a>Prevent Updates to Stack Resources</a> in the CloudFormation
--   User Guide. You can specify either the <tt>StackPolicyBody</tt> or the
--   <tt>StackPolicyURL</tt> parameter, but not both.
setStackPolicy_stackPolicyBody :: Lens' SetStackPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | Location of a file containing the stack policy. The URL must point to
--   a policy (maximum size: 16 KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same
--   Region as the stack. You can specify either the
--   <tt>StackPolicyBody</tt> or the <tt>StackPolicyURL</tt> parameter, but
--   not both.
setStackPolicy_stackPolicyURL :: Lens' SetStackPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The name or unique stack ID that you want to associate a policy with.
setStackPolicy_stackName :: Lens' SetStackPolicy Text

SetStackPolicyResponse' :: SetStackPolicyResponse

--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newSetStackPolicyResponse :: SetStackPolicyResponse

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.SetStackPolicy.SetStackPolicy

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudFormation.SetStackPolicy.SetStackPolicy


-- | When specifying <tt>RollbackStack</tt>, you preserve the state of
--   previously provisioned resources when an operation fails. You can
--   check the status of the stack through the DescribeStacks API.
--   
--   Rolls back the specified stack to the last known stable state from
--   <tt>CREATE_FAILED</tt> or <tt>UPDATE_FAILED</tt> stack statuses.
--   
--   This operation will delete a stack if it doesn't contain a last known
--   stable state. A last known stable state includes any status in a
--   <tt>*_COMPLETE</tt>. This includes the following stack statuses.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>CREATE_COMPLETE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UPDATE_COMPLETE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UPDATE_ROLLBACK_COMPLETE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>IMPORT_COMPLETE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>IMPORT_ROLLBACK_COMPLETE</pre></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RollbackStack

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRollbackStack</a> smart constructor.
data RollbackStack
RollbackStack' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> RollbackStack

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Identity and Access Management
--   role that CloudFormation assumes to rollback the stack.
[$sel:roleARN:RollbackStack'] :: RollbackStack -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for this <tt>RollbackStack</tt> request.
[$sel:clientRequestToken:RollbackStack'] :: RollbackStack -> Maybe Text

-- | The name that is associated with the stack.
[$sel:stackName:RollbackStack'] :: RollbackStack -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RollbackStack</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:RollbackStack'</a>, <a>rollbackStack_roleARN</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Identity and Access Management role
--   that CloudFormation assumes to rollback the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientRequestToken:RollbackStack'</a>,
--   <a>rollbackStack_clientRequestToken</a> - A unique identifier for this
--   <tt>RollbackStack</tt> request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:RollbackStack'</a>, <a>rollbackStack_stackName</a> -
--   The name that is associated with the stack.
newRollbackStack :: Text -> RollbackStack

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Identity and Access Management
--   role that CloudFormation assumes to rollback the stack.
rollbackStack_roleARN :: Lens' RollbackStack (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for this <tt>RollbackStack</tt> request.
rollbackStack_clientRequestToken :: Lens' RollbackStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The name that is associated with the stack.
rollbackStack_stackName :: Lens' RollbackStack Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRollbackStackResponse</a> smart constructor.
data RollbackStackResponse
RollbackStackResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> RollbackStackResponse

-- | Unique identifier of the stack.
[$sel:stackId:RollbackStackResponse'] :: RollbackStackResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:RollbackStackResponse'] :: RollbackStackResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RollbackStackResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:RollbackStackResponse'</a>,
--   <a>rollbackStackResponse_stackId</a> - Unique identifier of the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:RollbackStackResponse'</a>,
--   <a>rollbackStackResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newRollbackStackResponse :: Int -> RollbackStackResponse

-- | Unique identifier of the stack.
rollbackStackResponse_stackId :: Lens' RollbackStackResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
rollbackStackResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RollbackStackResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RollbackStack.RollbackStack
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RollbackStack.RollbackStack
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RollbackStack.RollbackStack
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RollbackStack.RollbackStack
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RollbackStack.RollbackStackResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RollbackStack.RollbackStackResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RollbackStack.RollbackStackResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RollbackStack.RollbackStackResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RollbackStack.RollbackStack

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RollbackStack.RollbackStack


-- | Registers an extension with the CloudFormation service. Registering an
--   extension makes it available for use in CloudFormation templates in
--   your Amazon Web Services account, and includes:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Validating the extension schema</li>
--   <li>Determining which handlers, if any, have been specified for the
--   extension</li>
--   <li>Making the extension available for use in your account</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on how to develop extensions and ready them for
--   registeration, see <a>Creating Resource Providers</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation CLI User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can have a maximum of 50 resource extension versions registered at
--   a time. This maximum is per account and per region. Use
--   <a>DeregisterType</a> to deregister specific extension versions if
--   necessary.
--   
--   Once you have initiated a registration request using <tt> RegisterType
--   </tt>, you can use <tt> DescribeTypeRegistration </tt> to monitor the
--   progress of the registration request.
--   
--   Once you have registered a private extension in your account and
--   region, use <a>SetTypeConfiguration</a> to specify configuration
--   properties for the extension. For more information, see <a>Configuring
--   extensions at the account level</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RegisterType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterType</a> smart constructor.
data RegisterType
RegisterType' :: Maybe LoggingConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RegistryType -> Text -> Text -> RegisterType

-- | Specifies logging configuration information for an extension.
[$sel:loggingConfig:RegisterType'] :: RegisterType -> Maybe LoggingConfig

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role for CloudFormation to
--   assume when invoking the extension.
--   
--   For CloudFormation to assume the specified execution role, the role
--   must contain a trust relationship with the CloudFormation service
--   principle (<tt>resources.cloudformation.amazonaws.com</tt>). For more
--   information on adding trust relationships, see <a>Modifying a role
--   trust policy</a> in the <i>Identity and Access Management User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   If your extension calls Amazon Web Services APIs in any of its
--   handlers, you must create an
--   <i>&lt;https:</i><i>docs.aws.amazon.com</i>IAM<i>latest</i>UserGuide<i>id_roles.html
--   IAM execution role&gt;</i> that includes the necessary permissions to
--   call those Amazon Web Services APIs, and provision that execution role
--   in your account. When CloudFormation needs to invoke the resource type
--   handler, CloudFormation assumes this execution role to create a
--   temporary session token, which it then passes to the resource type
--   handler, thereby supplying your resource type with the appropriate
--   credentials.
[$sel:executionRoleArn:RegisterType'] :: RegisterType -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier that acts as an idempotency key for this
--   registration request. Specifying a client request token prevents
--   CloudFormation from generating more than one version of an extension
--   from the same registeration request, even if the request is submitted
--   multiple times.
[$sel:clientRequestToken:RegisterType'] :: RegisterType -> Maybe Text

-- | The kind of extension.
[$sel:type':RegisterType'] :: RegisterType -> Maybe RegistryType

-- | The name of the extension being registered.
--   
--   We recommend that extension names adhere to the following patterns:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For resource types,
--   <i>company_or_organization</i>::<i>service</i>::<i>type</i>.</li>
--   <li>For modules,
--   <i>company_or_organization</i>::<i>service</i>::<i>type</i>::MODULE.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The following organization namespaces are reserved and cannot be used
--   in your extension names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>Alexa</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AMZN</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Amazon</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AWS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Custom</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Dev</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:typeName:RegisterType'] :: RegisterType -> Text

-- | A url to the S3 bucket containing the extension project package that
--   contains the neccessary files for the extension you want to register.
--   
--   For information on generating a schema handler package for the
--   extension you want to register, see <a>submit</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation CLI User Guide</i>.
--   
--   The user registering the extension must be able to access the package
--   in the S3 bucket. That is, the user needs to have <a>GetObject</a>
--   permissions for the schema handler package. For more information, see
--   <a>Actions, Resources, and Condition Keys for Amazon S3</a> in the
--   <i>Identity and Access Management User Guide</i>.
[$sel:schemaHandlerPackage:RegisterType'] :: RegisterType -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loggingConfig:RegisterType'</a>,
--   <a>registerType_loggingConfig</a> - Specifies logging configuration
--   information for an extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionRoleArn:RegisterType'</a>,
--   <a>registerType_executionRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the IAM role for CloudFormation to assume when invoking the
--   extension.
--   
--   For CloudFormation to assume the specified execution role, the role
--   must contain a trust relationship with the CloudFormation service
--   principle (<tt>resources.cloudformation.amazonaws.com</tt>). For more
--   information on adding trust relationships, see <a>Modifying a role
--   trust policy</a> in the <i>Identity and Access Management User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   If your extension calls Amazon Web Services APIs in any of its
--   handlers, you must create an
--   <i>&lt;https:</i><i>docs.aws.amazon.com</i>IAM<i>latest</i>UserGuide<i>id_roles.html
--   IAM execution role&gt;</i> that includes the necessary permissions to
--   call those Amazon Web Services APIs, and provision that execution role
--   in your account. When CloudFormation needs to invoke the resource type
--   handler, CloudFormation assumes this execution role to create a
--   temporary session token, which it then passes to the resource type
--   handler, thereby supplying your resource type with the appropriate
--   credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientRequestToken:RegisterType'</a>,
--   <a>registerType_clientRequestToken</a> - A unique identifier that acts
--   as an idempotency key for this registration request. Specifying a
--   client request token prevents CloudFormation from generating more than
--   one version of an extension from the same registeration request, even
--   if the request is submitted multiple times.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':RegisterType'</a>, <a>registerType_type</a> - The kind
--   of extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:RegisterType'</a>, <a>registerType_typeName</a> - The
--   name of the extension being registered.
--   
--   We recommend that extension names adhere to the following patterns:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For resource types,
--   <i>company_or_organization</i>::<i>service</i>::<i>type</i>.</li>
--   <li>For modules,
--   <i>company_or_organization</i>::<i>service</i>::<i>type</i>::MODULE.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The following organization namespaces are reserved and cannot be used
--   in your extension names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>Alexa</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AMZN</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Amazon</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AWS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Custom</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Dev</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:schemaHandlerPackage:RegisterType'</a>,
--   <a>registerType_schemaHandlerPackage</a> - A url to the S3 bucket
--   containing the extension project package that contains the neccessary
--   files for the extension you want to register.
--   
--   For information on generating a schema handler package for the
--   extension you want to register, see <a>submit</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation CLI User Guide</i>.
--   
--   The user registering the extension must be able to access the package
--   in the S3 bucket. That is, the user needs to have <a>GetObject</a>
--   permissions for the schema handler package. For more information, see
--   <a>Actions, Resources, and Condition Keys for Amazon S3</a> in the
--   <i>Identity and Access Management User Guide</i>.
newRegisterType :: Text -> Text -> RegisterType

-- | Specifies logging configuration information for an extension.
registerType_loggingConfig :: Lens' RegisterType (Maybe LoggingConfig)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role for CloudFormation to
--   assume when invoking the extension.
--   
--   For CloudFormation to assume the specified execution role, the role
--   must contain a trust relationship with the CloudFormation service
--   principle (<tt>resources.cloudformation.amazonaws.com</tt>). For more
--   information on adding trust relationships, see <a>Modifying a role
--   trust policy</a> in the <i>Identity and Access Management User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   If your extension calls Amazon Web Services APIs in any of its
--   handlers, you must create an
--   <i>&lt;https:</i><i>docs.aws.amazon.com</i>IAM<i>latest</i>UserGuide<i>id_roles.html
--   IAM execution role&gt;</i> that includes the necessary permissions to
--   call those Amazon Web Services APIs, and provision that execution role
--   in your account. When CloudFormation needs to invoke the resource type
--   handler, CloudFormation assumes this execution role to create a
--   temporary session token, which it then passes to the resource type
--   handler, thereby supplying your resource type with the appropriate
--   credentials.
registerType_executionRoleArn :: Lens' RegisterType (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier that acts as an idempotency key for this
--   registration request. Specifying a client request token prevents
--   CloudFormation from generating more than one version of an extension
--   from the same registeration request, even if the request is submitted
--   multiple times.
registerType_clientRequestToken :: Lens' RegisterType (Maybe Text)

-- | The kind of extension.
registerType_type :: Lens' RegisterType (Maybe RegistryType)

-- | The name of the extension being registered.
--   
--   We recommend that extension names adhere to the following patterns:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For resource types,
--   <i>company_or_organization</i>::<i>service</i>::<i>type</i>.</li>
--   <li>For modules,
--   <i>company_or_organization</i>::<i>service</i>::<i>type</i>::MODULE.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The following organization namespaces are reserved and cannot be used
--   in your extension names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>Alexa</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AMZN</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Amazon</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AWS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Custom</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Dev</pre></li>
--   </ul>
registerType_typeName :: Lens' RegisterType Text

-- | A url to the S3 bucket containing the extension project package that
--   contains the neccessary files for the extension you want to register.
--   
--   For information on generating a schema handler package for the
--   extension you want to register, see <a>submit</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation CLI User Guide</i>.
--   
--   The user registering the extension must be able to access the package
--   in the S3 bucket. That is, the user needs to have <a>GetObject</a>
--   permissions for the schema handler package. For more information, see
--   <a>Actions, Resources, and Condition Keys for Amazon S3</a> in the
--   <i>Identity and Access Management User Guide</i>.
registerType_schemaHandlerPackage :: Lens' RegisterType Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterTypeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data RegisterTypeResponse
RegisterTypeResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> RegisterTypeResponse

-- | The identifier for this registration request.
--   
--   Use this registration token when calling <tt> DescribeTypeRegistration
--   </tt>, which returns information about the status and IDs of the
--   extension registration.
[$sel:registrationToken:RegisterTypeResponse'] :: RegisterTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:RegisterTypeResponse'] :: RegisterTypeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterTypeResponse</a> with all optional fields

--   extension registration.

--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:RegisterTypeResponse'</a>,

--   code.
newRegisterTypeResponse :: Int -> RegisterTypeResponse

-- | The identifier for this registration request.

--   </tt>, which returns information about the status and IDs of the
--   extension registration.

-- | Registers your account as a publisher of public extensions in the
--   CloudFormation registry. Public extensions are available for use by
--   all CloudFormation users. This publisher ID applies to your account in
--   all Amazon Web Services Regions.
--   
--   For information on requirements for registering as a public extension
--   publisher, see <a>Registering your account to publish CloudFormation
--   extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation CLI User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RegisterPublisher

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterPublisher</a> smart constructor.
data RegisterPublisher
RegisterPublisher' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> RegisterPublisher

-- | Whether you accept the <a>Terms and Conditions</a> for publishing
--   extensions in the CloudFormation registry. You must accept the terms
--   and conditions in order to register to publish public extensions to
--   the CloudFormation registry.
--   
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:acceptTermsAndConditions:RegisterPublisher'] :: RegisterPublisher -> Maybe Bool

-- | If you are using a Bitbucket or GitHub account for identity
--   verification, the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for your connection to
--   that account.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Registering your account to publish
--   CloudFormation extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation CLI User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:connectionArn:RegisterPublisher'] :: RegisterPublisher -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterPublisher</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptTermsAndConditions:RegisterPublisher'</a>,
--   <a>registerPublisher_acceptTermsAndConditions</a> - Whether you accept
--   the <a>Terms and Conditions</a> for publishing extensions in the
--   CloudFormation registry. You must accept the terms and conditions in
--   order to register to publish public extensions to the CloudFormation
--   registry.
--   
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionArn:RegisterPublisher'</a>,
--   <a>registerPublisher_connectionArn</a> - If you are using a Bitbucket
--   or GitHub account for identity verification, the Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) for your connection to that account.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Registering your account to publish
--   CloudFormation extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation CLI User
--   Guide</i>.
newRegisterPublisher :: RegisterPublisher

-- | Whether you accept the <a>Terms and Conditions</a> for publishing
--   extensions in the CloudFormation registry. You must accept the terms
--   and conditions in order to register to publish public extensions to
--   the CloudFormation registry.
--   
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
registerPublisher_acceptTermsAndConditions :: Lens' RegisterPublisher (Maybe Bool)

-- | If you are using a Bitbucket or GitHub account for identity
--   verification, the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for your connection to
--   that account.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Registering your account to publish
--   CloudFormation extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation CLI User
--   Guide</i>.
registerPublisher_connectionArn :: Lens' RegisterPublisher (Maybe Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterPublisherResponse</a> smart constructor.
data RegisterPublisherResponse
RegisterPublisherResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> RegisterPublisherResponse

-- | The ID assigned this account by CloudFormation for publishing
--   extensions.
[$sel:publisherId:RegisterPublisherResponse'] :: RegisterPublisherResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:RegisterPublisherResponse'] :: RegisterPublisherResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterPublisherResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:publisherId:RegisterPublisherResponse'</a>,
--   <a>registerPublisherResponse_publisherId</a> - The ID assigned this
--   account by CloudFormation for publishing extensions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:RegisterPublisherResponse'</a>,
--   <a>registerPublisherResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newRegisterPublisherResponse :: Int -> RegisterPublisherResponse

--   extensions.
registerPublisherResponse_publisherId :: Lens' RegisterPublisherResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Reports progress of a resource handler to CloudFormation.
--   
--   Reserved for use by the <a>CloudFormation CLI</a>. Do not use this API
--   in your code.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.RecordHandlerProgress

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRecordHandlerProgress</a> smart constructor.
data RecordHandlerProgress
RecordHandlerProgress' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OperationStatus -> Maybe HandlerErrorCode -> Text -> OperationStatus -> RecordHandlerProgress

-- | Reserved for use by the <a>CloudFormation CLI</a>.
[$sel:statusMessage:RecordHandlerProgress'] :: RecordHandlerProgress -> Maybe Text

-- | Reserved for use by the <a>CloudFormation CLI</a>.

-- | Publishes the specified extension to the CloudFormation registry as a
--   public extension in this region. Public extensions are available for
--   use by all CloudFormation users. For more information on publishing
--   extensions, see <a>Publishing extensions to make them available for
--   public use</a> in the <i>CloudFormation CLI User Guide</i>.
--   
--   To publish an extension, you must be registered as a publisher with
--   CloudFormation. For more information, see <a>RegisterPublisher</a>.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.PublishType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPublishType</a> smart constructor.
data PublishType
PublishType' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ThirdPartyType -> PublishType

-- | The name of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>Arn</tt>, or <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>.
[$sel:typeName:PublishType'] :: PublishType -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>Arn</tt>, or <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>.
[$sel:arn:PublishType'] :: PublishType -> Maybe Text

-- | The version number to assign to this version of the extension.
--   
--   Use the following format, and adhere to semantic versioning when
--   assigning a version number to your extension:
--   
--   <pre>
--   MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Semantic Versioning 2.0.0</a>.
--   
--   If you do not specify a version number, CloudFormation increments the
--   version number by one minor version release.
--   
--   The first time you publish a type, CloudFormation sets the version
--   number to <tt>1.0.0</tt>, regardless of the value you specify.
[$sel:publicVersionNumber:PublishType'] :: PublishType -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>Arn</tt>, or <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>.
[$sel:type':PublishType'] :: PublishType -> Maybe ThirdPartyType

-- | Create a value of <a>PublishType</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:PublishType'</a>, <a>publishType_typeName</a> - The
--   name of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>Arn</tt>, or <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:PublishType'</a>, <a>publishType_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Number (ARN) of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>Arn</tt>, or <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicVersionNumber:PublishType'</a>,
--   <a>publishType_publicVersionNumber</a> - The version number to assign
--   to this version of the extension.
--   
--   Use the following format, and adhere to semantic versioning when
--   assigning a version number to your extension:
--   
--   <pre>
--   MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Semantic Versioning 2.0.0</a>.
--   
--   If you do not specify a version number, CloudFormation increments the
--   version number by one minor version release.
--   
--   The first time you publish a type, CloudFormation sets the version
--   number to <tt>1.0.0</tt>, regardless of the value you specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':PublishType'</a>, <a>publishType_type</a> - The type of
--   the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>Arn</tt>, or <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>.
newPublishType :: PublishType

-- | The name of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>Arn</tt>, or <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>.
publishType_typeName :: Lens' PublishType (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>Arn</tt>, or <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>.
publishType_arn :: Lens' PublishType (Maybe Text)

-- | The version number to assign to this version of the extension.
--   
--   Use the following format, and adhere to semantic versioning when
--   assigning a version number to your extension:
--   
--   <pre>
--   MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Semantic Versioning 2.0.0</a>.
--   
--   If you do not specify a version number, CloudFormation increments the
--   version number by one minor version release.
--   
--   The first time you publish a type, CloudFormation sets the version
--   number to <tt>1.0.0</tt>, regardless of the value you specify.
publishType_publicVersionNumber :: Lens' PublishType (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify <tt>Arn</tt>, or <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>.
publishType_type :: Lens' PublishType (Maybe ThirdPartyType)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPublishTypeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data PublishTypeResponse
PublishTypeResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> PublishTypeResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) assigned to the public extension upon
--   publication.
[$sel:publicTypeArn:PublishTypeResponse'] :: PublishTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:PublishTypeResponse'] :: PublishTypeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>PublishTypeResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicTypeArn:PublishTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>publishTypeResponse_publicTypeArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Number
--   (ARN) assigned to the public extension upon publication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:PublishTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>publishTypeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newPublishTypeResponse :: Int -> PublishTypeResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) assigned to the public extension upon
--   publication.
publishTypeResponse_publicTypeArn :: Lens' PublishTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
publishTypeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PublishTypeResponse Int

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudFormation.PublishType.PublishType

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudFormation.PublishType.PublishType


-- | Returns summary information about extension that have been registered
--   with CloudFormation.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.ListTypes

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTypes</a> smart constructor.
data ListTypes
ListTypes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe DeprecatedStatus -> Maybe ProvisioningType -> Maybe Visibility -> Maybe TypeFilters -> Maybe RegistryType -> ListTypes

-- | If the previous paginated request didn't return all of the remaining
--   results, the response object's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter value is
--   set to a token. To retrieve the next set of results, call this action
--   again and assign that token to the request object's <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   parameter. If there are no remaining results, the previous response
--   object's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter is set to <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:nextToken:ListTypes'] :: ListTypes -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned with a single call. If
--   the number of available results exceeds this maximum, the response
--   includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can assign to the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter to get the next set of results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListTypes'] :: ListTypes -> Maybe Natural

-- | The deprecation status of the extension that you want to get summary
--   information about.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>LIVE</tt>: The extension is registered for use in
--   CloudFormation operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPRECATED</tt>: The extension has been deregistered and can
--   no longer be used in CloudFormation operations.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:deprecatedStatus:ListTypes'] :: ListTypes -> Maybe DeprecatedStatus

-- | For resource types, the provisioning behavior of the resource type.
--   CloudFormation determines the provisioning type during registration,
--   based on the types of handlers in the schema handler package
--   submitted.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FULLY_MUTABLE</tt>: The resource type includes an update
--   handler to process updates to the type during stack update
--   operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>IMMUTABLE</tt>: The resource type does not include an update
--   handler, so the type cannot be updated and must instead be replaced
--   during stack update operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>NON_PROVISIONABLE</tt>: The resource type does not include
--   create, read, and delete handlers, and therefore cannot actually be
--   provisioned.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The default is <tt>FULLY_MUTABLE</tt>.
[$sel:provisioningType:ListTypes'] :: ListTypes -> Maybe ProvisioningType

-- | The scope at which the extensions are visible and usable in
--   CloudFormation operations.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PRIVATE</tt>: Extensions that are visible and usable within
--   this account and region. This includes:<ul><li>Private extensions you
--   have registered in this account and region.</li><li>Public extensions
--   that you have activated in this account and region.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>PUBLIC</tt>: Extensions that are publicly visible and
--   available to be activated within any Amazon account. This includes
--   extensions from Amazon, as well as third-party publishers.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The default is <tt>PRIVATE</tt>.
[$sel:visibility:ListTypes'] :: ListTypes -> Maybe Visibility

-- | Filter criteria to use in determining which extensions to return.
--   
--   If you specify a filter, CloudFormation ignores any specified
--   <tt>Visibility</tt> value when returning the list of types.
[$sel:filters:ListTypes'] :: ListTypes -> Maybe TypeFilters

-- | The type of extension.
[$sel:type':ListTypes'] :: ListTypes -> Maybe RegistryType

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTypes</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListTypes'</a>, <a>listTypes_nextToken</a> - If the
--   previous paginated request didn't return all of the remaining results,
--   the response object's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter value is set to a
--   token. To retrieve the next set of results, call this action again and
--   assign that token to the request object's <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   parameter. If there are no remaining results, the previous response
--   object's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter is set to <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListTypes'</a>, <a>listTypes_maxResults</a> - The
--   maximum number of results to be returned with a single call. If the
--   number of available results exceeds this maximum, the response
--   includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can assign to the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter to get the next set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deprecatedStatus:ListTypes'</a>,
--   <a>listTypes_deprecatedStatus</a> - The deprecation status of the
--   extension that you want to get summary information about.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>LIVE</tt>: The extension is registered for use in
--   CloudFormation operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPRECATED</tt>: The extension has been deregistered and can
--   no longer be used in CloudFormation operations.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningType:ListTypes'</a>,
--   <a>listTypes_provisioningType</a> - For resource types, the
--   provisioning behavior of the resource type. CloudFormation determines
--   the provisioning type during registration, based on the types of
--   handlers in the schema handler package submitted.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FULLY_MUTABLE</tt>: The resource type includes an update
--   handler to process updates to the type during stack update
--   operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>IMMUTABLE</tt>: The resource type does not include an update
--   handler, so the type cannot be updated and must instead be replaced
--   during stack update operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>NON_PROVISIONABLE</tt>: The resource type does not include
--   create, read, and delete handlers, and therefore cannot actually be
--   provisioned.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The default is <tt>FULLY_MUTABLE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:visibility:ListTypes'</a>, <a>listTypes_visibility</a> - The
--   scope at which the extensions are visible and usable in CloudFormation
--   operations.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PRIVATE</tt>: Extensions that are visible and usable within
--   this account and region. This includes:<ul><li>Private extensions you
--   have registered in this account and region.</li><li>Public extensions
--   that you have activated in this account and region.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>PUBLIC</tt>: Extensions that are publicly visible and
--   available to be activated within any Amazon account. This includes
--   extensions from Amazon, as well as third-party publishers.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The default is <tt>PRIVATE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:ListTypes'</a>, <a>listTypes_filters</a> - Filter
--   criteria to use in determining which extensions to return.
--   
--   If you specify a filter, CloudFormation ignores any specified
--   <tt>Visibility</tt> value when returning the list of types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ListTypes'</a>, <a>listTypes_type</a> - The type of
--   extension.
newListTypes :: ListTypes

-- | If the previous paginated request didn't return all of the remaining
--   results, the response object's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter value is
--   set to a token. To retrieve the next set of results, call this action
--   again and assign that token to the request object's <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   parameter. If there are no remaining results, the previous response
--   object's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter is set to <tt>null</tt>.
listTypes_nextToken :: Lens' ListTypes (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned with a single call. If
--   the number of available results exceeds this maximum, the response
--   includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can assign to the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter to get the next set of results.
listTypes_maxResults :: Lens' ListTypes (Maybe Natural)

-- | The deprecation status of the extension that you want to get summary
--   information about.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>LIVE</tt>: The extension is registered for use in
--   CloudFormation operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPRECATED</tt>: The extension has been deregistered and can
--   no longer be used in CloudFormation operations.</li>
--   </ul>
listTypes_deprecatedStatus :: Lens' ListTypes (Maybe DeprecatedStatus)

-- | For resource types, the provisioning behavior of the resource type.
--   CloudFormation determines the provisioning type during registration,
--   based on the types of handlers in the schema handler package
--   submitted.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FULLY_MUTABLE</tt>: The resource type includes an update
--   handler to process updates to the type during stack update
--   operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>IMMUTABLE</tt>: The resource type does not include an update
--   handler, so the type cannot be updated and must instead be replaced
--   during stack update operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>NON_PROVISIONABLE</tt>: The resource type does not include
--   create, read, and delete handlers, and therefore cannot actually be
--   provisioned.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The default is <tt>FULLY_MUTABLE</tt>.
listTypes_provisioningType :: Lens' ListTypes (Maybe ProvisioningType)

-- | The scope at which the extensions are visible and usable in
--   CloudFormation operations.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PRIVATE</tt>: Extensions that are visible and usable within
--   this account and region. This includes:<ul><li>Private extensions you
--   have registered in this account and region.</li><li>Public extensions
--   that you have activated in this account and region.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>PUBLIC</tt>: Extensions that are publicly visible and
--   available to be activated within any Amazon account. This includes
--   extensions from Amazon, as well as third-party publishers.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The default is <tt>PRIVATE</tt>.
listTypes_visibility :: Lens' ListTypes (Maybe Visibility)

-- | Filter criteria to use in determining which extensions to return.
--   
--   If you specify a filter, CloudFormation ignores any specified
--   <tt>Visibility</tt> value when returning the list of types.
listTypes_filters :: Lens' ListTypes (Maybe TypeFilters)

-- | The type of extension.
listTypes_type :: Lens' ListTypes (Maybe RegistryType)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTypesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListTypesResponse
ListTypesResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [TypeSummary] -> Int -> ListTypesResponse

-- | If the request doesn't return all of the remaining results,
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> is set to a token. To retrieve the next set of
--   results, call this action again and assign that token to the request

--   results, <tt>NextToken</tt> is set to <tt>null</tt>.

-- | A list of <tt>TypeSummary</tt> structures that contain information
--   about the specified extensions.
[$sel:typeSummaries:ListTypesResponse'] :: ListTypesResponse -> Maybe [TypeSummary]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListTypesResponse'] :: ListTypesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTypesResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListTypes'</a>, <a>listTypesResponse_nextToken</a> -
--   If the request doesn't return all of the remaining results,

--   object's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter. If the request returns all

-- | Returns summary information about the versions of an extension.

--   information.
--

--   <tt>Type</tt>, or <tt>Arn</tt>.

--   Extensions published by Amazon are not assigned a publisher ID.

--   summary information about.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>LIVE</tt>: The extension version is registered and can be used
--   in CloudFormation operations, dependent on its provisioning behavior
--   and visibility scope.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPRECATED</tt>: The extension version has been deregistered
--   and can no longer be used in CloudFormation operations.</li>

-- | Returns the summary information for stacks whose status matches the
--   specified StackStatusFilter. Summary information for stacks that have
--   been deleted is kept for 90 days after the stack is deleted. If no
--   StackStatusFilter is specified, summary information for all stacks is
--   returned (including existing stacks and stacks that have been
--   deleted).
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.ListStacks

-- | The input for ListStacks action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListStacks</a> smart constructor.
data ListStacks
ListStacks' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [StackStatus] -> ListStacks

-- | A string that identifies the next page of stacks that you want to
--   retrieve.
[$sel:nextToken:ListStacks'] :: ListStacks -> Maybe Text

-- | Stack status to use as a filter. Specify one or more stack status
--   codes to list only stacks with the specified status codes. For a
--   complete list of stack status codes, see the <tt>StackStatus</tt>
--   parameter of the Stack data type.
[$sel:stackStatusFilter:ListStacks'] :: ListStacks -> Maybe [StackStatus]

-- | Create a value of <a>ListStacks</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   string that identifies the next page of stacks that you want to
--   retrieve.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackStatusFilter:ListStacks'</a>,

--   Specify one or more stack status codes to list only stacks with the
--   specified status codes. For a complete list of stack status codes, see
--   the <tt>StackStatus</tt> parameter of the Stack data type.
newListStacks :: ListStacks

-- | A string that identifies the next page of stacks that you want to
--   retrieve.
listStacks_nextToken :: Lens' ListStacks (Maybe Text)

-- | Stack status to use as a filter. Specify one or more stack status
--   codes to list only stacks with the specified status codes. For a
--   complete list of stack status codes, see the <tt>StackStatus</tt>
--   parameter of the Stack data type.
listStacks_stackStatusFilter :: Lens' ListStacks (Maybe [StackStatus])

-- | The output for ListStacks action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListStacksResponse</a> smart constructor.

-- | Returns summary information about stack sets that are associated with
--   the user.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>[Self-managed permissions] If you set the <tt>CallAs</tt>
--   parameter to <tt>SELF</tt> while signed in to your Amazon Web Services
--   account, <tt>ListStackSets</tt> returns all self-managed stack sets in
--   your Amazon Web Services account.</li>
--   <li>[Service-managed permissions] If you set the <tt>CallAs</tt>
--   parameter to <tt>SELF</tt> while signed in to the organization's
--   management account, <tt>ListStackSets</tt> returns all stack sets in
--   the management account.</li>
--   <li>[Service-managed permissions] If you set the <tt>CallAs</tt>
--   parameter to <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt> while signed in to your member
--   account, <tt>ListStackSets</tt> returns all stack sets with
--   service-managed permissions in the management account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.ListStackSets

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListStackSets</a> smart constructor.
data ListStackSets
ListStackSets' :: Maybe StackSetStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe CallAs -> ListStackSets

-- | The status of the stack sets that you want to get summary information
--   about.
[$sel:status:ListStackSets'] :: ListStackSets -> Maybe StackSetStatus

-- | If the previous paginated request didn't return all of the remaining
--   results, the response object's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter value is
--   set to a token. To retrieve the next set of results, call
--   <tt>ListStackSets</tt> again and assign that token to the request
--   object's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter. If there are no remaining
--   results, the previous response object's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter
--   is set to <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:nextToken:ListStackSets'] :: ListStackSets -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned with a single call. If
--   the number of available results exceeds this maximum, the response
--   includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can assign to the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter to get the next set of results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListStackSets'] :: ListStackSets -> Maybe Natural

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Specifies whether you are
--   acting as an account administrator in the management account or as a
--   delegated administrator in a member account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:callAs:ListStackSets'] :: ListStackSets -> Maybe CallAs

-- | Create a value of <a>ListStackSets</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Specifies whether you are
--   acting as an account administrator in the organization's management
--   account or as a delegated administrator in a member account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:callAs:ListStackSetOperationResults'] :: ListStackSetOperationResults -> Maybe CallAs

-- | Returns descriptions of all resources of the specified stack.
--   
--   For deleted stacks, ListStackResources returns resource information
--   for up to 90 days after the stack has been deleted.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.ListStackResources

-- | The input for the ListStackResource action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListStackResources</a> smart constructor.
data ListStackResources
ListStackResources' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> ListStackResources

-- | A string that identifies the next page of stack resources that you
--   want to retrieve.
[$sel:nextToken:ListStackResources'] :: ListStackResources -> Maybe Text

-- | The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack,
--   which are not always interchangeable:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its
--   unique stack ID.</li>
--   <li>Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
[$sel:stackName:ListStackResources'] :: ListStackResources -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListStackResources</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   that is associated with the stack, which are not always
--   interchangeable:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its
--   unique stack ID.</li>

-- | Returns summary information about stack instances that are associated
--   with the specified stack set. You can filter for stack instances that
--   are associated with a specific Amazon Web Services account name or
--   Region, or that have a specific status.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.ListStackInstances

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListStackInstances</a> smart constructor.
data ListStackInstances

--   account or as a delegated administrator in a member account.</li>

--   sets with self-managed permissions.

--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>

--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For

--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>

--   results, call <tt>ListStackInstances</tt> again and assign that token

--   <a>$sel:stackInstanceAccount:ListStackInstances'</a>,
--   <a>listStackInstances_stackInstanceAccount</a> - The name of the
--   Amazon Web Services account that you want to list stack instances for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListStackInstances'</a>,
--   <a>listStackInstances_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results
--   to be returned with a single call. If the number of available results
--   exceeds this maximum, the response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value
--   that you can assign to the <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter to get
--   the next set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAs:ListStackInstances'</a>,
--   <a>listStackInstances_callAs</a> - [Service-managed permissions]
--   Specifies whether you are acting as an account administrator in the
--   organization's management account or as a delegated administrator in a
--   member account.
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackInstanceRegion:ListStackInstances'</a>,
--   <a>listStackInstances_stackInstanceRegion</a> - The name of the Region
--   where you want to list stack instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:ListStackInstances'</a>,
--   <a>listStackInstances_filters</a> - The status that stack instances
--   are filtered by.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:ListStackInstances'</a>,
--   <a>listStackInstances_stackSetName</a> - The name or unique ID of the
--   stack set that you want to list stack instances for.
newListStackInstances :: Text -> ListStackInstances

-- | If the previous request didn't return all of the remaining results,
--   the response's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter value is set to a token.
--   To retrieve the next set of results, call <tt>ListStackInstances</tt>
--   again and assign that token to the request object's <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   parameter. If there are no remaining results, the previous response
--   object's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter is set to <tt>null</tt>.
listStackInstances_nextToken :: Lens' ListStackInstances (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to list
--   stack instances for.
listStackInstances_stackInstanceAccount :: Lens' ListStackInstances (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned with a single call. If
--   the number of available results exceeds this maximum, the response
--   includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can assign to the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter to get the next set of results.
listStackInstances_maxResults :: Lens' ListStackInstances (Maybe Natural)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Specifies whether you are
--   acting as an account administrator in the organization's management
--   account or as a delegated administrator in a member account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
listStackInstances_callAs :: Lens' ListStackInstances (Maybe CallAs)

-- | The name of the Region where you want to list stack instances.
listStackInstances_stackInstanceRegion :: Lens' ListStackInstances (Maybe Text)

-- | The status that stack instances are filtered by.
listStackInstances_filters :: Lens' ListStackInstances (Maybe [StackInstanceFilter])

-- | The name or unique ID of the stack set that you want to list stack
--   instances for.
listStackInstances_stackSetName :: Lens' ListStackInstances Text

-- | Lists all stacks that are importing an exported output value. To
--   modify or remove an exported output value, first use this action to
--   see which stacks are using it. To see the exported output values in
--   your account, see ListExports.
--   
--   For more information about importing an exported output value, see the
--   <a>Fn::ImportValue</a> function.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.ListImports

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListImports</a> smart constructor.
data ListImports
ListImports' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> ListImports

-- | A string (provided by the ListImports response output) that identifies
--   the next page of stacks that are importing the specified exported
--   output value.
[$sel:nextToken:ListImports'] :: ListImports -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the exported output value. CloudFormation returns the
--   stack names that are importing this value.
[$sel:exportName:ListImports'] :: ListImports -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListImports</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListImports'</a>, <a>listImports_nextToken</a> - A
--   string (provided by the ListImports response output) that identifies
--   the next page of stacks that are importing the specified exported
--   output value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exportName:ListImports'</a>, <a>listImports_exportName</a> -
--   The name of the exported output value. CloudFormation returns the
--   stack names that are importing this value.
newListImports :: Text -> ListImports

-- | A string (provided by the ListImports response output) that identifies
--   the next page of stacks that are importing the specified exported
--   output value.
listImports_nextToken :: Lens' ListImports (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the exported output value. CloudFormation returns the
--   stack names that are importing this value.
listImports_exportName :: Lens' ListImports Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListImportsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListImportsResponse
ListImportsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Int -> ListImportsResponse

-- | A string that identifies the next page of exports. If there is no
--   additional page, this value is null.
[$sel:nextToken:ListImportsResponse'] :: ListImportsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of stack names that are importing the specified exported output
--   value.
[$sel:imports:ListImportsResponse'] :: ListImportsResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListImportsResponse'] :: ListImportsResponse -> Int

--   null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imports:ListImportsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listImportsResponse_imports</a> - A list of stack names that are
--   importing the specified exported output value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListImportsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listImportsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newListImportsResponse :: Int -> ListImportsResponse
