--   additional page, this value is null.
listImportsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListImportsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Lists all exported output values in the account and Region in which

--   the <a>Fn::ImportValue</a> function.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>CloudFormation Export Stack Output
--   Values</a>.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | Returns the ID and status of each active change set for a stack. For
--   example, CloudFormation lists change sets that are in the
--   <tt>CREATE_IN_PROGRESS</tt> or <tt>CREATE_PENDING</tt> state.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.ListChangeSets

-- | The input for the ListChangeSets action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListChangeSets</a> smart constructor.
data ListChangeSets
ListChangeSets' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> ListChangeSets

-- | A string (provided by the ListChangeSets response output) that
--   identifies the next page of change sets that you want to retrieve.
[$sel:nextToken:ListChangeSets'] :: ListChangeSets -> Maybe Text

--   want to list change sets.

--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:ListChangeSets'</a>, <a>listChangeSets_stackName</a>
--   - The name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the stack for which

--   <a>listChangeSetsResponse_summaries</a> - A list of
--   <tt>ChangeSetSummary</tt> structures that provides the ID and status
--   of each change set for the specified stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListChangeSetsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listChangeSetsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status

-- | Import existing stacks into a new stack sets. Use the stack import
--   operation to import up to 10 stacks into a new stack set in the same
--   account as the source stack or in a different administrator account
--   and Region, by specifying the stack ID of the stack you intend to
--   import.
--   
--   <tt>ImportStacksToStackSet</tt> is only supported by self-managed
--   permissions.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.ImportStacksToStackSet

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newImportStacksToStackSet</a> smart constructor.
data ImportStacksToStackSet
ImportStacksToStackSet' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CallAs -> Maybe StackSetOperationPreferences -> Text -> [Text] -> ImportStacksToStackSet

-- | A unique, user defined, identifier for the stack set operation.
[$sel:operationId:ImportStacksToStackSet'] :: ImportStacksToStackSet -> Maybe Text

-- | By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>For service managed stack sets, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:callAs:ImportStacksToStackSet'] :: ImportStacksToStackSet -> Maybe CallAs
[$sel:operationPreferences:ImportStacksToStackSet'] :: ImportStacksToStackSet -> Maybe StackSetOperationPreferences

-- | The name of the stack set. The name must be unique in the Region where
--   you create your stack set.
[$sel:stackSetName:ImportStacksToStackSet'] :: ImportStacksToStackSet -> Text

-- | The IDs of the stacks you are importing into a stack set. You import
--   up to 10 stacks per stack set at a time.
[$sel:stackIds:ImportStacksToStackSet'] :: ImportStacksToStackSet -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ImportStacksToStackSet</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:operationId:ImportStacksToStackSet'</a>,
--   <a>importStacksToStackSet_operationId</a> - A unique, user defined,
--   identifier for the stack set operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAs:ImportStacksToStackSet'</a>,
--   <a>importStacksToStackSet_callAs</a> - By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is
--   specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack sets with self-managed
--   permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>For service managed stack sets, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:operationPreferences:ImportStacksToStackSet'</a>,
--   <a>importStacksToStackSet_operationPreferences</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:ImportStacksToStackSet'</a>,
--   <a>importStacksToStackSet_stackSetName</a> - The name of the stack
--   set. The name must be unique in the Region where you create your stack
--   set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackIds:ImportStacksToStackSet'</a>,
--   <a>importStacksToStackSet_stackIds</a> - The IDs of the stacks you are
--   importing into a stack set. You import up to 10 stacks per stack set
--   at a time.
newImportStacksToStackSet :: Text -> ImportStacksToStackSet

-- | A unique, user defined, identifier for the stack set operation.
importStacksToStackSet_operationId :: Lens' ImportStacksToStackSet (Maybe Text)

-- | By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>For service managed stack sets, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
importStacksToStackSet_callAs :: Lens' ImportStacksToStackSet (Maybe CallAs)

-- | Undocumented member.
importStacksToStackSet_operationPreferences :: Lens' ImportStacksToStackSet (Maybe StackSetOperationPreferences)

-- | The name of the stack set. The name must be unique in the Region where
--   you create your stack set.
importStacksToStackSet_stackSetName :: Lens' ImportStacksToStackSet Text

-- | The IDs of the stacks you are importing into a stack set. You import
--   up to 10 stacks per stack set at a time.
importStacksToStackSet_stackIds :: Lens' ImportStacksToStackSet [Text]

--   constructor.

-- | Returns information about a new or existing template. The
--   <tt>GetTemplateSummary</tt> action is useful for viewing parameter
--   information, such as default parameter values and parameter types,
--   before you create or update a stack or stack set.
--   
--   You can use the <tt>GetTemplateSummary</tt> action when you submit a
--   template, or you can get template information for a stack set, or a
--   running or deleted stack.
--   
--   For deleted stacks, <tt>GetTemplateSummary</tt> returns the template
--   information for up to 90 days after the stack has been deleted. If the
--   template does not exist, a <tt>ValidationError</tt> is returned.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.GetTemplateSummary

-- | The input for the GetTemplateSummary action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetTemplateSummary</a> smart constructor.
data GetTemplateSummary
GetTemplateSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CallAs -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> GetTemplateSummary

-- | The name or the stack ID that is associated with the stack, which are
--   not always interchangeable. For running stacks, you can specify either
--   the stack's name or its unique stack ID. For deleted stack, you must
--   specify the unique stack ID.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify only one of the following parameters:
--   <tt>StackName</tt>, <tt>StackSetName</tt>, <tt>TemplateBody</tt>, or
--   <tt>TemplateURL</tt>.
[$sel:stackName:GetTemplateSummary'] :: GetTemplateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a
--   template (max size: 460,800 bytes) that is located in an Amazon S3
--   bucket or a Systems Manager document. For more information about
--   templates, see <a>Template Anatomy</a> in the CloudFormation User
--   Guide.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify only one of the following parameters:
--   <tt>StackName</tt>, <tt>StackSetName</tt>, <tt>TemplateBody</tt>, or
--   <tt>TemplateURL</tt>.
[$sel:templateURL:GetTemplateSummary'] :: GetTemplateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Specifies whether you are
--   acting as an account administrator in the organization's management
--   account or as a delegated administrator in a member account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:callAs:GetTemplateSummary'] :: GetTemplateSummary -> Maybe CallAs

-- | The name or unique ID of the stack set from which the stack was
--   created.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify only one of the following parameters:
--   <tt>StackName</tt>, <tt>StackSetName</tt>, <tt>TemplateBody</tt>, or
--   <tt>TemplateURL</tt>.
[$sel:stackSetName:GetTemplateSummary'] :: GetTemplateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte
--   and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. For more information about
--   templates, see <a>Template Anatomy</a> in the CloudFormation User
--   Guide.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify only one of the following parameters:
--   <tt>StackName</tt>, <tt>StackSetName</tt>, <tt>TemplateBody</tt>, or
--   <tt>TemplateURL</tt>.
[$sel:templateBody:GetTemplateSummary'] :: GetTemplateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetTemplateSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:GetTemplateSummary'</a>,

--   
--   Conditional: You must specify only one of the following parameters:
--   <tt>StackName</tt>, <tt>StackSetName</tt>, <tt>TemplateBody</tt>, or
--   <tt>TemplateURL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateURL:GetTemplateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>getTemplateSummary_templateURL</a> - Location of file containing

--   Anatomy</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify only one of the following parameters:

--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be

--   <tt>TemplateURL</tt>.
newGetTemplateSummary :: GetTemplateSummary

-- | The name or the stack ID that is associated with the stack, which are

-- | The output for the GetTemplateSummary action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetTemplateSummaryResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetTemplateSummaryResponse
GetTemplateSummaryResponse' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Capability] -> Maybe [ResourceIdentifierSummary] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ParameterDeclaration] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> GetTemplateSummaryResponse

-- | A list of all the template resource types that are defined in the
--   template, such as <tt>AWS::EC2::Instance</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::Dynamo::Table</tt>, and <tt>Custom::MyCustomInstance</tt>.
[$sel:resourceTypes:GetTemplateSummaryResponse'] :: GetTemplateSummaryResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The capabilities found within the template. If your template contains
--   IAM resources, you must specify the <tt>CAPABILITY_IAM</tt> or
--   <tt>CAPABILITY_NAMED_IAM</tt> value for this parameter when you use
--   the CreateStack or UpdateStack actions with your template; otherwise,
--   those actions return an <tt>InsufficientCapabilities</tt> error.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Acknowledging IAM Resources in
--   CloudFormation Templates</a>.
[$sel:capabilities:GetTemplateSummaryResponse'] :: GetTemplateSummaryResponse -> Maybe [Capability]

-- | A list of resource identifier summaries that describe the target
--   resources of an import operation and the properties you can provide
--   during the import to identify the target resources. For example,
--   <tt>BucketName</tt> is a possible identifier property for an
--   <tt>AWS::S3::Bucket</tt> resource.
[$sel:resourceIdentifierSummaries:GetTemplateSummaryResponse'] :: GetTemplateSummaryResponse -> Maybe [ResourceIdentifierSummary]

-- | A list of the transforms that are declared in the template.
[$sel:declaredTransforms:GetTemplateSummaryResponse'] :: GetTemplateSummaryResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The value that is defined for the <tt>Metadata</tt> property of the
--   template.
[$sel:metadata:GetTemplateSummaryResponse'] :: GetTemplateSummaryResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services template format version, which identifies the
--   capabilities of the template.
[$sel:version:GetTemplateSummaryResponse'] :: GetTemplateSummaryResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The value that is defined in the <tt>Description</tt> property of the
--   template.
[$sel:description:GetTemplateSummaryResponse'] :: GetTemplateSummaryResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of parameter declarations that describe various properties for
--   each parameter.
[$sel:parameters:GetTemplateSummaryResponse'] :: GetTemplateSummaryResponse -> Maybe [ParameterDeclaration]

-- | The list of resources that generated the values in the
--   <tt>Capabilities</tt> response element.
[$sel:capabilitiesReason:GetTemplateSummaryResponse'] :: GetTemplateSummaryResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetTemplateSummaryResponse'] :: GetTemplateSummaryResponse -> Int

--   fields omitted.

-- | Returns the template body for a specified stack. You can get the
--   template for running or deleted stacks.
--   
--   For deleted stacks, GetTemplate returns the template for up to 90 days
--   after the stack has been deleted.
--   
--   If the template does not exist, a <tt>ValidationError</tt> is
--   returned.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.GetTemplate

-- | The input for a GetTemplate action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data GetTemplate
GetTemplate' :: Maybe TemplateStage -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> GetTemplate

-- | For templates that include transforms, the stage of the template that
--   CloudFormation returns. To get the user-submitted template, specify
--   <tt>Original</tt>. To get the template after CloudFormation has
--   processed all transforms, specify <tt>Processed</tt>.
--   
--   If the template doesn't include transforms, <tt>Original</tt> and
--   <tt>Processed</tt> return the same template. By default,
--   CloudFormation specifies <tt>Processed</tt>.
[$sel:templateStage:GetTemplate'] :: GetTemplate -> Maybe TemplateStage

-- | The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack,
--   which are not always interchangeable:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its
--   unique stack ID.</li>
--   <li>Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
[$sel:stackName:GetTemplate'] :: GetTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a change set for which
--   CloudFormation returns the associated template. If you specify a name,
--   you must also specify the <tt>StackName</tt>.
[$sel:changeSetName:GetTemplate'] :: GetTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetTemplate</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateStage:GetTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>getTemplate_templateStage</a> - For templates that include
--   transforms, the stage of the template that CloudFormation returns. To
--   get the user-submitted template, specify <tt>Original</tt>. To get the
--   template after CloudFormation has processed all transforms, specify
--   <tt>Processed</tt>.
--   
--   If the template doesn't include transforms, <tt>Original</tt> and
--   <tt>Processed</tt> return the same template. By default,
--   CloudFormation specifies <tt>Processed</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:GetTemplate'</a>, <a>getTemplate_stackName</a> - The
--   name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack, which
--   are not always interchangeable:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its
--   unique stack ID.</li>
--   <li>Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:changeSetName:GetTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>getTemplate_changeSetName</a> - The name or Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of a change set for which CloudFormation returns the associated
--   template. If you specify a name, you must also specify the
--   <tt>StackName</tt>.
newGetTemplate :: GetTemplate

-- | For templates that include transforms, the stage of the template that
--   CloudFormation returns. To get the user-submitted template, specify
--   <tt>Original</tt>. To get the template after CloudFormation has
--   processed all transforms, specify <tt>Processed</tt>.
--   
--   If the template doesn't include transforms, <tt>Original</tt> and
--   <tt>Processed</tt> return the same template. By default,
--   CloudFormation specifies <tt>Processed</tt>.
getTemplate_templateStage :: Lens' GetTemplate (Maybe TemplateStage)

-- | The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack,
--   which are not always interchangeable:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its
--   unique stack ID.</li>
--   <li>Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
getTemplate_stackName :: Lens' GetTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a change set for which
--   CloudFormation returns the associated template. If you specify a name,
--   you must also specify the <tt>StackName</tt>.
getTemplate_changeSetName :: Lens' GetTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The output for GetTemplate action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetTemplateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetTemplateResponse
GetTemplateResponse' :: Maybe [TemplateStage] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> GetTemplateResponse

-- | The stage of the template that you can retrieve. For stacks, the
--   <tt>Original</tt> and <tt>Processed</tt> templates are always
--   available. For change sets, the <tt>Original</tt> template is always
--   available. After CloudFormation finishes creating the change set, the
--   <tt>Processed</tt> template becomes available.
[$sel:stagesAvailable:GetTemplateResponse'] :: GetTemplateResponse -> Maybe [TemplateStage]

-- | Structure containing the template body. (For more information, go to
--   <a>Template Anatomy</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
--   
--   CloudFormation returns the same template that was used when the stack
--   was created.
[$sel:templateBody:GetTemplateResponse'] :: GetTemplateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetTemplateResponse'] :: GetTemplateResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetTemplateResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stagesAvailable:GetTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getTemplateResponse_stagesAvailable</a> - The stage of the template
--   that you can retrieve. For stacks, the <tt>Original</tt> and
--   <tt>Processed</tt> templates are always available. For change sets,
--   the <tt>Original</tt> template is always available. After
--   CloudFormation finishes creating the change set, the
--   <tt>Processed</tt> template becomes available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateBody:GetTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getTemplateResponse_templateBody</a> - Structure containing the
--   template body. (For more information, go to <a>Template Anatomy</a> in
--   the CloudFormation User Guide.)
--   
--   CloudFormation returns the same template that was used when the stack
--   was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getTemplateResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newGetTemplateResponse :: Int -> GetTemplateResponse

-- | The stage of the template that you can retrieve. For stacks, the
--   <tt>Original</tt> and <tt>Processed</tt> templates are always
--   available. For change sets, the <tt>Original</tt> template is always
--   available. After CloudFormation finishes creating the change set, the
--   <tt>Processed</tt> template becomes available.
getTemplateResponse_stagesAvailable :: Lens' GetTemplateResponse (Maybe [TemplateStage])

-- | Structure containing the template body. (For more information, go to
--   <a>Template Anatomy</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
--   
--   CloudFormation returns the same template that was used when the stack
--   was created.
getTemplateResponse_templateBody :: Lens' GetTemplateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getTemplateResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetTemplateResponse Int

-- | Returns the stack policy for a specified stack. If a stack doesn't

-- | Updates a stack using the input information that was provided when the
--   specified change set was created. After the call successfully
--   completes, CloudFormation starts updating the stack. Use the
--   DescribeStacks action to view the status of the update.
--   
--   When you execute a change set, CloudFormation deletes all other change
--   sets associated with the stack because they aren't valid for the
--   updated stack.
--   
--   If a stack policy is associated with the stack, CloudFormation
--   enforces the policy during the update. You can't specify a temporary
--   stack policy that overrides the current policy.
--   
--   To create a change set for the entire stack hierachy,
--   <tt>IncludeNestedStacks</tt> must have been set to <tt>True</tt>.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.ExecuteChangeSet

-- | The input for the ExecuteChangeSet action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExecuteChangeSet</a> smart constructor.
data ExecuteChangeSet
ExecuteChangeSet' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> ExecuteChangeSet

-- | If you specified the name of a change set, specify the stack name or
--   ID (ARN) that is associated with the change set you want to execute.
[$sel:stackName:ExecuteChangeSet'] :: ExecuteChangeSet -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for this <tt>ExecuteChangeSet</tt> request.
--   Specify this token if you plan to retry requests so that
--   CloudFormation knows that you're not attempting to execute a change
--   set to update a stack with the same name. You might retry
--   <tt>ExecuteChangeSet</tt> requests to ensure that CloudFormation
--   successfully received them.
[$sel:clientRequestToken:ExecuteChangeSet'] :: ExecuteChangeSet -> Maybe Text

-- | Preserves the state of previously provisioned resources when an
--   operation fails.
--   
--   Default: <tt>True</tt>
[$sel:disableRollback:ExecuteChangeSet'] :: ExecuteChangeSet -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name or ARN of the change set that you want use to update the
--   specified stack.
[$sel:changeSetName:ExecuteChangeSet'] :: ExecuteChangeSet -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExecuteChangeSet</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:ExecuteChangeSet'</a>,
--   <a>executeChangeSet_stackName</a> - If you specified the name of a
--   change set, specify the stack name or ID (ARN) that is associated with
--   the change set you want to execute.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientRequestToken:ExecuteChangeSet'</a>,
--   <a>executeChangeSet_clientRequestToken</a> - A unique identifier for
--   this <tt>ExecuteChangeSet</tt> request. Specify this token if you plan
--   to retry requests so that CloudFormation knows that you're not
--   attempting to execute a change set to update a stack with the same
--   name. You might retry <tt>ExecuteChangeSet</tt> requests to ensure
--   that CloudFormation successfully received them.
--   
--   <a>$sel:disableRollback:ExecuteChangeSet'</a>,
--   <a>executeChangeSet_disableRollback</a> - Preserves the state of
--   previously provisioned resources when an operation fails.
--   
--   Default: <tt>True</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:changeSetName:ExecuteChangeSet'</a>,
--   <a>executeChangeSet_changeSetName</a> - The name or ARN of the change
--   set that you want use to update the specified stack.
newExecuteChangeSet :: Text -> ExecuteChangeSet

-- | If you specified the name of a change set, specify the stack name or
--   ID (ARN) that is associated with the change set you want to execute.
executeChangeSet_stackName :: Lens' ExecuteChangeSet (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for this <tt>ExecuteChangeSet</tt> request.
--   Specify this token if you plan to retry requests so that
--   CloudFormation knows that you're not attempting to execute a change
--   set to update a stack with the same name. You might retry
--   <tt>ExecuteChangeSet</tt> requests to ensure that CloudFormation
--   successfully received them.
executeChangeSet_clientRequestToken :: Lens' ExecuteChangeSet (Maybe Text)

-- | Preserves the state of previously provisioned resources when an
--   operation fails.
--   
--   Default: <tt>True</tt>
executeChangeSet_disableRollback :: Lens' ExecuteChangeSet (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name or ARN of the change set that you want use to update the
--   specified stack.
executeChangeSet_changeSetName :: Lens' ExecuteChangeSet Text

-- | The output for the ExecuteChangeSet action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExecuteChangeSetResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ExecuteChangeSetResponse
ExecuteChangeSetResponse' :: Int -> ExecuteChangeSetResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ExecuteChangeSetResponse'] :: ExecuteChangeSetResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ExecuteChangeSetResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ExecuteChangeSetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>executeChangeSetResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http

newExecuteChangeSetResponse :: Int -> ExecuteChangeSetResponse

-- | Returns the estimated monthly cost of a template. The return value is
--   an Amazon Web Services Simple Monthly Calculator URL with a query
--   string that describes the resources required to run the template.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.EstimateTemplateCost

-- | The input for an EstimateTemplateCost action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEstimateTemplateCost</a> smart constructor.
data EstimateTemplateCost
EstimateTemplateCost' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Parameter] -> EstimateTemplateCost

-- | Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a
--   template that is located in an Amazon S3 bucket or a Systems Manager
--   document. For more information, go to <a>Template Anatomy</a> in the
--   CloudFormation User Guide.
--   
--   Conditional: You must pass <tt>TemplateURL</tt> or
--   <tt>TemplateBody</tt>. If both are passed, only <tt>TemplateBody</tt>
--   is used.
[$sel:templateURL:EstimateTemplateCost'] :: EstimateTemplateCost -> Maybe Text

-- | Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte
--   and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. (For more information, go to
--   <a>Template Anatomy</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
--   
--   Conditional: You must pass <tt>TemplateBody</tt> or
--   <tt>TemplateURL</tt>. If both are passed, only <tt>TemplateBody</tt>
--   is used.
[$sel:templateBody:EstimateTemplateCost'] :: EstimateTemplateCost -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of <tt>Parameter</tt> structures that specify input parameters.
[$sel:parameters:EstimateTemplateCost'] :: EstimateTemplateCost -> Maybe [Parameter]

-- | Create a value of <a>EstimateTemplateCost</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateURL:EstimateTemplateCost'</a>,
--   <a>estimateTemplateCost_templateURL</a> - Location of file containing
--   the template body. The URL must point to a template that is located in
--   an Amazon S3 bucket or a Systems Manager document. For more
--   information, go to <a>Template Anatomy</a> in the CloudFormation User
--   Guide.
--   
--   Conditional: You must pass <tt>TemplateURL</tt> or
--   <tt>TemplateBody</tt>. If both are passed, only <tt>TemplateBody</tt>
--   is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateBody:EstimateTemplateCost'</a>,
--   <a>estimateTemplateCost_templateBody</a> - Structure containing the
--   template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of
--   51,200 bytes. (For more information, go to <a>Template Anatomy</a> in
--   the CloudFormation User Guide.)
--   
--   Conditional: You must pass <tt>TemplateBody</tt> or
--   <tt>TemplateURL</tt>. If both are passed, only <tt>TemplateBody</tt>
--   is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:EstimateTemplateCost'</a>,
--   <a>estimateTemplateCost_parameters</a> - A list of <tt>Parameter</tt>
--   structures that specify input parameters.
newEstimateTemplateCost :: EstimateTemplateCost

-- | Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a
--   template that is located in an Amazon S3 bucket or a Systems Manager
--   document. For more information, go to <a>Template Anatomy</a> in the
--   CloudFormation User Guide.
--   
--   Conditional: You must pass <tt>TemplateURL</tt> or
--   <tt>TemplateBody</tt>. If both are passed, only <tt>TemplateBody</tt>
--   is used.
estimateTemplateCost_templateURL :: Lens' EstimateTemplateCost (Maybe Text)

-- | Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte
--   and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. (For more information, go to
--   <a>Template Anatomy</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
--   
--   Conditional: You must pass <tt>TemplateBody</tt> or
--   <tt>TemplateURL</tt>. If both are passed, only <tt>TemplateBody</tt>
--   is used.
estimateTemplateCost_templateBody :: Lens' EstimateTemplateCost (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of <tt>Parameter</tt> structures that specify input parameters.
estimateTemplateCost_parameters :: Lens' EstimateTemplateCost (Maybe [Parameter])

-- | The output for a EstimateTemplateCost action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEstimateTemplateCostResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EstimateTemplateCostResponse
EstimateTemplateCostResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> EstimateTemplateCostResponse

-- | An Amazon Web Services Simple Monthly Calculator URL with a query
--   string that describes the resources required to run the template.
[$sel:url:EstimateTemplateCostResponse'] :: EstimateTemplateCostResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:EstimateTemplateCostResponse'] :: EstimateTemplateCostResponse -> Int

--

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudFormation.EstimateTemplateCost.EstimateTemplateCost


-- | Detect drift on a stack set. When CloudFormation performs drift
--   detection on a stack set, it performs drift detection on the stack
--   associated with each stack instance in the stack set. For more
--   information, see <a>How CloudFormation Performs Drift Detection on a
--   Stack Set</a>.
--   
--   <tt>DetectStackSetDrift</tt> returns the <tt>OperationId</tt> of the
--   stack set drift detection operation. Use this operation id with <tt>
--   DescribeStackSetOperation </tt> to monitor the progress of the drift
--   detection operation. The drift detection operation may take some time,
--   depending on the number of stack instances included in the stack set,
--   as well as the number of resources included in each stack.
--   
--   Once the operation has completed, use the following actions to return
--   drift information:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use <tt> DescribeStackSet </tt> to return detailed information
--   about the stack set, including detailed information about the last
--   <i>completed</i> drift operation performed on the stack set.
--   (Information about drift operations that are in progress is not
--   included.)</li>
--   <li>Use <tt> ListStackInstances </tt> to return a list of stack
--   instances belonging to the stack set, including the drift status and
--   last drift time checked of each instance.</li>
--   <li>Use <tt> DescribeStackInstance </tt> to return detailed
--   information about a specific stack instance, including its drift
--   status and last drift time checked.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on performing a drift detection operation on a
--   stack set, see <a>Detecting Unmanaged Changes in Stack Sets</a>.
--   
--   You can only run a single drift detection operation on a given stack
--   set at one time.
--   
--   To stop a drift detection stack set operation, use <tt>
--   StopStackSetOperation </tt>.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DetectStackSetDrift

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDetectStackSetDrift</a> smart constructor.
data DetectStackSetDrift
DetectStackSetDrift' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CallAs -> Maybe StackSetOperationPreferences -> Text -> DetectStackSetDrift

-- | <i>The ID of the stack set operation.</i>
[$sel:operationId:DetectStackSetDrift'] :: DetectStackSetDrift -> Maybe Text

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Specifies whether you are
--   acting as an account administrator in the organization's management
--   account or as a delegated administrator in a member account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:callAs:DetectStackSetDrift'] :: DetectStackSetDrift -> Maybe CallAs
[$sel:operationPreferences:DetectStackSetDrift'] :: DetectStackSetDrift -> Maybe StackSetOperationPreferences

-- | The name of the stack set on which to perform the drift detection
--   operation.
[$sel:stackSetName:DetectStackSetDrift'] :: DetectStackSetDrift -> Text

-- | Returns information about whether a resource's actual configuration
--   differs, or has <i>drifted</i>, from it's expected configuration, as
--   defined in the stack template and any values specified as template
--   parameters. This information includes actual and expected property
--   values for resources in which CloudFormation detects drift. Only
--   resource properties explicitly defined in the stack template are
--   checked for drift. For more information about stack and resource
--   drift, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration Changes to Stacks
--   and Resources</a>.
--   
--   Use <tt>DetectStackResourceDrift</tt> to detect drift on individual
--   resources, or DetectStackDrift to detect drift on all resources in a
--   given stack that support drift detection.
--   
--   Resources that do not currently support drift detection cannot be
--   checked. For a list of resources that support drift detection, see
--   <a>Resources that Support Drift Detection</a>.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DetectStackResourceDrift

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDetectStackResourceDrift</a> smart constructor.
data DetectStackResourceDrift
DetectStackResourceDrift' :: Text -> Text -> DetectStackResourceDrift

-- | The name of the stack to which the resource belongs.
[$sel:stackName:DetectStackResourceDrift'] :: DetectStackResourceDrift -> Text

-- | The logical name of the resource for which to return drift
--   information.
[$sel:logicalResourceId:DetectStackResourceDrift'] :: DetectStackResourceDrift -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DetectStackResourceDrift</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:DetectStackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>detectStackResourceDrift_stackName</a> - The name of the stack to
--   which the resource belongs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:DetectStackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>detectStackResourceDrift_logicalResourceId</a> - The logical name
--   of the resource for which to return drift information.
newDetectStackResourceDrift :: Text -> Text -> DetectStackResourceDrift

-- | The name of the stack to which the resource belongs.
detectStackResourceDrift_stackName :: Lens' DetectStackResourceDrift Text

-- | The logical name of the resource for which to return drift
--   information.
detectStackResourceDrift_logicalResourceId :: Lens' DetectStackResourceDrift Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDetectStackResourceDriftResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DetectStackResourceDriftResponse
DetectStackResourceDriftResponse' :: Int -> StackResourceDrift -> DetectStackResourceDriftResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DetectStackResourceDriftResponse'] :: DetectStackResourceDriftResponse -> Int

-- | Information about whether the resource's actual configuration has
--   drifted from its expected template configuration, including actual and
--   expected property values and any differences detected.
[$sel:stackResourceDrift:DetectStackResourceDriftResponse'] :: DetectStackResourceDriftResponse -> StackResourceDrift

--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackResourceDrift:DetectStackResourceDriftResponse'</a>,
--   <a>detectStackResourceDriftResponse_stackResourceDrift</a> -
--   Information about whether the resource's actual configuration has
--   drifted from its expected template configuration, including actual and
--   expected property values and any differences detected.
newDetectStackResourceDriftResponse :: Int -> StackResourceDrift -> DetectStackResourceDriftResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DetectStackResourceDrift.DetectStackResourceDrift


-- | Detects whether a stack's actual configuration differs, or has
--   <i>drifted</i>, from it's expected configuration, as defined in the
--   stack template and any values specified as template parameters. For
--   each resource in the stack that supports drift detection,
--   CloudFormation compares the actual configuration of the resource with
--   its expected template configuration. Only resource properties
--   explicitly defined in the stack template are checked for drift. A
--   stack is considered to have drifted if one or more of its resources
--   differ from their expected template configurations. For more
--   information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration Changes to
--   Stacks and Resources</a>.
--   
--   Use <tt>DetectStackDrift</tt> to detect drift on all supported
--   resources for a given stack, or DetectStackResourceDrift to detect
--   drift on individual resources.
--   
--   For a list of stack resources that currently support drift detection,
--   see <a>Resources that Support Drift Detection</a>.
--   
--   <tt>DetectStackDrift</tt> can take up to several minutes, depending on
--   the number of resources contained within the stack. Use
--   DescribeStackDriftDetectionStatus to monitor the progress of a detect
--   stack drift operation. Once the drift detection operation has
--   completed, use DescribeStackResourceDrifts to return drift information
--   about the stack and its resources.
--   
--   When detecting drift on a stack, CloudFormation does not detect drift
--   on any nested stacks belonging to that stack. Perform
--   <tt>DetectStackDrift</tt> directly on the nested stack itself.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DetectStackDrift

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDetectStackDrift</a> smart constructor.
data DetectStackDrift
DetectStackDrift' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Text -> DetectStackDrift

-- | The logical names of any resources you want to use as filters.
[$sel:logicalResourceIds:DetectStackDrift'] :: DetectStackDrift -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The name of the stack for which you want to detect drift.
[$sel:stackName:DetectStackDrift'] :: DetectStackDrift -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DetectStackDrift</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceIds:DetectStackDrift'</a>,
--   <a>detectStackDrift_logicalResourceIds</a> - The logical names of any
--   resources you want to use as filters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:DetectStackDrift'</a>,
--   <a>detectStackDrift_stackName</a> - The name of the stack for which
--   you want to detect drift.
newDetectStackDrift :: Text -> DetectStackDrift

-- | The logical names of any resources you want to use as filters.
detectStackDrift_logicalResourceIds :: Lens' DetectStackDrift (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The name of the stack for which you want to detect drift.
detectStackDrift_stackName :: Lens' DetectStackDrift Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDetectStackDriftResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DetectStackDriftResponse
DetectStackDriftResponse' :: Int -> Text -> DetectStackDriftResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DetectStackDriftResponse'] :: DetectStackDriftResponse -> Int

-- | The ID of the drift detection results of this operation.
--   
--   CloudFormation generates new results, with a new drift detection ID,
--   each time this operation is run. However, the number of drift results
--   CloudFormation retains for any given stack, and for how long, may
--   vary.
[$sel:stackDriftDetectionId:DetectStackDriftResponse'] :: DetectStackDriftResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DetectStackDriftResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DetectStackDriftResponse'</a>,
--   <a>detectStackDriftResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackDriftDetectionId:DetectStackDriftResponse'</a>,
--   <a>detectStackDriftResponse_stackDriftDetectionId</a> - The ID of the
--   drift detection results of this operation.
--   
--   CloudFormation generates new results, with a new drift detection ID,
--   each time this operation is run. However, the number of drift results
--   CloudFormation retains for any given stack, and for how long, may
--   vary.
newDetectStackDriftResponse :: Int -> Text -> DetectStackDriftResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
detectStackDriftResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DetectStackDriftResponse Int

-- | The ID of the drift detection results of this operation.
--   
--   CloudFormation generates new results, with a new drift detection ID,
--   each time this operation is run. However, the number of drift results
--   CloudFormation retains for any given stack, and for how long, may
--   vary.
detectStackDriftResponse_stackDriftDetectionId :: Lens' DetectStackDriftResponse Text

-- | Returns information about an extension's registration, including its
--   current status and type and version identifiers.
--   
--   When you initiate a registration request using <tt> RegisterType
--   </tt>, you can then use <tt> DescribeTypeRegistration </tt> to monitor
--   the progress of that registration request.
--   
--   Once the registration request has completed, use <tt> DescribeType
--   </tt> to return detailed information about an extension.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeTypeRegistration
