-- | Returns detailed information about an extension that has been
--   registered.
--   
--   If you specify a <tt>VersionId</tt>, <tt>DescribeType</tt> returns
--   information about that specific extension version. Otherwise, it
--   returns information about the default extension version.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeType</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeType
DescribeType' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RegistryType -> DescribeType

-- | The name of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>, or <tt>Arn</tt>.
[$sel:typeName:DescribeType'] :: DescribeType -> Maybe Text

-- | The publisher ID of the extension publisher.
--   
--   Extensions provided by Amazon are not assigned a publisher ID.
[$sel:publisherId:DescribeType'] :: DescribeType -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>, or <tt>Arn</tt>.
[$sel:arn:DescribeType'] :: DescribeType -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of a specific version of the extension. The version ID is the
--   value at the end of the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the
--   extension version when it is registered.
--   
--   If you specify a <tt>VersionId</tt>, <tt>DescribeType</tt> returns
--   information about that specific extension version. Otherwise, it
--   returns information about the default extension version.
[$sel:versionId:DescribeType'] :: DescribeType -> Maybe Text

-- | The version number of a public third-party extension.
[$sel:publicVersionNumber:DescribeType'] :: DescribeType -> Maybe Text

-- | The kind of extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>, or <tt>Arn</tt>.
[$sel:type':DescribeType'] :: DescribeType -> Maybe RegistryType

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:DescribeType'</a>, <a>describeType_typeName</a> - The
--   name of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>, or <tt>Arn</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publisherId:DescribeType'</a>, <a>describeType_publisherId</a>
--   - The publisher ID of the extension publisher.
--   
--   Extensions provided by Amazon are not assigned a publisher ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:DescribeType'</a>, <a>describeType_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>, or <tt>Arn</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:DescribeType'</a>, <a>describeType_versionId</a> -
--   The ID of a specific version of the extension. The version ID is the
--   value at the end of the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the
--   extension version when it is registered.
--   
--   If you specify a <tt>VersionId</tt>, <tt>DescribeType</tt> returns
--   information about that specific extension version. Otherwise, it
--   returns information about the default extension version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicVersionNumber:DescribeType'</a>,
--   <a>describeType_publicVersionNumber</a> - The version number of a
--   public third-party extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':DescribeType'</a>, <a>describeType_type</a> - The kind
--   of extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>, or <tt>Arn</tt>.
newDescribeType :: DescribeType

-- | The name of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>, or <tt>Arn</tt>.
describeType_typeName :: Lens' DescribeType (Maybe Text)

-- | The publisher ID of the extension publisher.
--   
--   Extensions provided by Amazon are not assigned a publisher ID.
describeType_publisherId :: Lens' DescribeType (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>, or <tt>Arn</tt>.
describeType_arn :: Lens' DescribeType (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of a specific version of the extension. The version ID is the
--   value at the end of the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the
--   extension version when it is registered.
--   
--   If you specify a <tt>VersionId</tt>, <tt>DescribeType</tt> returns
--   information about that specific extension version. Otherwise, it
--   returns information about the default extension version.
describeType_versionId :: Lens' DescribeType (Maybe Text)

-- | The version number of a public third-party extension.
describeType_publicVersionNumber :: Lens' DescribeType (Maybe Text)

-- | The kind of extension.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>TypeName</tt> and
--   <tt>Type</tt>, or <tt>Arn</tt>.
describeType_type :: Lens' DescribeType (Maybe RegistryType)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeTypeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeTypeResponse
DescribeTypeResponse' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LoggingConfig -> Maybe TypeTestsStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DeprecatedStatus -> Maybe [RequiredActivatedType] -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ProvisioningType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Visibility -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RegistryType -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Int -> DescribeTypeResponse

-- | Whether or not the extension is activated in the account and region.
--   
--   This only applies to public third-party extensions. For all other
--   extensions, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:isActivated:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The description of the test status. To return the extension test
--   status of a specifc extension version, you must specify
--   <tt>VersionId</tt>.
--   
--   This applies only to registered private extension versions.
--   CloudFormation does not return this information for public extensions,
--   whether or not they are activated in your account.
[$sel:typeTestsStatusDescription:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the extension.
--   
--   If the extension is a public third-party type you have activated with
--   a type name alias, CloudFormation returns the type name alias. For
--   more information, see <a>ActivateType</a>.
[$sel:typeName:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | For public extensions that have been activated for this account and
--   region, the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the public extension.
[$sel:originalTypeArn:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains logging configuration information for private extensions.
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account. For public extensions, both those provided by Amazon and
--   published by third parties, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>. For
--   more information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.
[$sel:loggingConfig:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe LoggingConfig

-- | The contract test status of the registered extension version. To
--   return the extension test status of a specifc extension version, you
--   must specify <tt>VersionId</tt>.
--   
--   This applies only to registered private extension versions.
--   CloudFormation does not return this information for public extensions,
--   whether or not they are activated in your account.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PASSED</tt>: The extension has passed all its contract
--   tests.An extension must have a test status of <tt>PASSED</tt> before
--   it can be published. For more information, see <a>Publishing
--   extensions to make them available for public use</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation Command Line Interface User Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The extension has failed one or more contract
--   tests.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>: Contract tests are currently being performed
--   on the extension.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_TESTED</tt>: Contract tests have not been performed on the
--   extension.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:typeTestsStatus:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe TypeTestsStatus

-- | A JSON string that represent the current configuration data for the
--   extension in this account and region.
--   
--   To set the configuration data for an extension, use
--   <a>SetTypeConfiguration</a>. For more information, see <a>Configuring
--   extensions at the account level</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:configurationSchema:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The schema that defines the extension.
--   
--   For more information on extension schemas, see <a>Resource Provider
--   Schema</a> in the <i>CloudFormation CLI User Guide</i>.
[$sel:schema:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The publisher ID of the extension publisher.
--   
--   This applies only to public third-party extensions. For private
--   registered extensions, and extensions provided by Amazon,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:publisherId:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM execution role used to
--   register the extension. This applies only to private extensions you
--   have registered in your account. For more information, see
--   <a>RegisterType</a>.
--   
--   If the registered extension calls any Amazon Web Services APIs, you
--   must create an
--   <i>&lt;https:</i><i>docs.aws.amazon.com</i>IAM<i>latest</i>UserGuide<i>id_roles.html
--   IAM execution role&gt;</i> that includes the necessary permissions to
--   call those Amazon Web Services APIs, and provision that execution role
--   in your account. CloudFormation then assumes that execution role to
--   provide your extension with the appropriate credentials.
[$sel:executionRoleArn:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The latest version of a public extension <i>that is available</i> for
--   use.
--   
--   This only applies if you specify a public extension, and you do not
--   specify a version. For all other requests, CloudFormation returns
--   <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:latestPublicVersion:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the extension.
[$sel:arn:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The deprecation status of the extension version.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>LIVE</tt>: The extension is activated or registered and can be
--   used in CloudFormation operations, dependent on its provisioning
--   behavior and visibility scope.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPRECATED</tt>: The extension has been deactivated or
--   deregistered and can no longer be used in CloudFormation
--   operations.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For public third-party extensions, CloudFormation returns
--   <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:deprecatedStatus:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe DeprecatedStatus

-- | For extensions that are modules, the public third-party extensions
--   that must be activated in your account in order for the module itself
--   to be activated.
[$sel:requiredActivatedTypes:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe [RequiredActivatedType]

-- | When the specified extension version was registered. This applies only
--   to:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Private extensions you have registered in your account. For more
--   information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.</li>
--   <li>Public extensions you have activated in your account with
--   auto-update specified. For more information, see
--   <a>ActivateType</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:lastUpdated:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The ID of the default version of the extension. The default version is
--   used when the extension version is not specified.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account. For public extensions, both those provided by Amazon and
--   published by third parties, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>. For
--   more information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.
--   
--   To set the default version of an extension, use <tt>
--   SetTypeDefaultVersion </tt>.
[$sel:defaultVersionId:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL of a page providing detailed documentation for this extension.
[$sel:documentationUrl:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | For resource type extensions, the provisioning behavior of the
--   resource type. CloudFormation determines the provisioning type during
--   registration, based on the types of handlers in the schema handler
--   package submitted.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FULLY_MUTABLE</tt>: The resource type includes an update
--   handler to process updates to the type during stack update
--   operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>IMMUTABLE</tt>: The resource type does not include an update
--   handler, so the type cannot be updated and must instead be replaced
--   during stack update operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>NON_PROVISIONABLE</tt>: The resource type does not include all
--   of the following handlers, and therefore cannot actually be
--   provisioned.<ul><li>create</li><li>read</li><li>delete</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:provisioningType:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe ProvisioningType

-- | The URL of the source code for the extension.
[$sel:sourceUrl:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the extension.
[$sel:description:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extension in this
--   account and region when a new <i>minor</i> version is published by the
--   extension publisher. Major versions released by the publisher must be
--   manually updated. For more information, see <a>Activating public
--   extensions for use in your account</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:autoUpdate:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | For public extensions that have been activated for this account and
--   region, the type name of the public extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when enabling the extension
--   in this account and region, CloudFormation treats that alias as the
--   extension's type name within the account and region, not the type name
--   of the public extension. For more information, see <a>Specifying
--   aliases to refer to extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:originalTypeName:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The scope at which the extension is visible and usable in
--   CloudFormation operations.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PRIVATE</tt>: The extension is only visible and usable within
--   the account in which it is registered. CloudFormation marks any
--   extensions you register as <tt>PRIVATE</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>PUBLIC</tt>: The extension is publically visible and usable
--   within any Amazon account.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:visibility:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Visibility

-- | Whether the specified extension version is set as the default version.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account, and extensions published by Amazon. For public third-party
--   extensions, whether or not they are activated in your account,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:isDefaultVersion:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The version number of a public third-party extension.
--   
--   This applies only if you specify a public extension you have activated
--   in your account, or specify a public extension without specifying a
--   version. For all other extensions, CloudFormation returns
--   <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:publicVersionNumber:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The kind of extension.
[$sel:type':DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe RegistryType

-- | When the specified private extension version was registered or
--   activated in your account.
[$sel:timeCreated:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeTypeResponse'] :: DescribeTypeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeTypeResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isActivated:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_isActivated</a> - Whether or not the extension
--   is activated in the account and region.
--   
--   This only applies to public third-party extensions. For all other
--   extensions, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeTestsStatusDescription:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_typeTestsStatusDescription</a> - The
--   description of the test status. To return the extension test status of
--   a specifc extension version, you must specify <tt>VersionId</tt>.
--   
--   This applies only to registered private extension versions.
--   CloudFormation does not return this information for public extensions,
--   whether or not they are activated in your account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:DescribeType'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_typeName</a> - The name of the extension.
--   
--   If the extension is a public third-party type you have activated with
--   a type name alias, CloudFormation returns the type name alias. For
--   more information, see <a>ActivateType</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originalTypeArn:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_originalTypeArn</a> - For public extensions
--   that have been activated for this account and region, the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the public extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loggingConfig:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_loggingConfig</a> - Contains logging
--   configuration information for private extensions. This applies only to
--   private extensions you have registered in your account. For public
--   extensions, both those provided by Amazon and published by third
--   parties, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>. For more information,
--   see <a>RegisterType</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeTestsStatus:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_typeTestsStatus</a> - The contract test status
--   of the registered extension version. To return the extension test
--   status of a specifc extension version, you must specify
--   <tt>VersionId</tt>.
--   
--   This applies only to registered private extension versions.
--   CloudFormation does not return this information for public extensions,
--   whether or not they are activated in your account.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PASSED</tt>: The extension has passed all its contract
--   tests.An extension must have a test status of <tt>PASSED</tt> before
--   it can be published. For more information, see <a>Publishing
--   extensions to make them available for public use</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation Command Line Interface User Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The extension has failed one or more contract
--   tests.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>: Contract tests are currently being performed
--   on the extension.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_TESTED</tt>: Contract tests have not been performed on the
--   extension.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSchema:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_configurationSchema</a> - A JSON string that
--   represent the current configuration data for the extension in this
--   account and region.
--   
--   To set the configuration data for an extension, use
--   <a>SetTypeConfiguration</a>. For more information, see <a>Configuring
--   extensions at the account level</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schema:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_schema</a> - The schema that defines the
--   extension.
--   
--   For more information on extension schemas, see <a>Resource Provider
--   Schema</a> in the <i>CloudFormation CLI User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publisherId:DescribeType'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_publisherId</a> - The publisher ID of the
--   extension publisher.
--   
--   This applies only to public third-party extensions. For private
--   registered extensions, and extensions provided by Amazon,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionRoleArn:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_executionRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM execution role used to register the extension.
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account. For more information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.
--   
--   If the registered extension calls any Amazon Web Services APIs, you
--   must create an
--   <i>&lt;https:</i><i>docs.aws.amazon.com</i>IAM<i>latest</i>UserGuide<i>id_roles.html
--   IAM execution role&gt;</i> that includes the necessary permissions to
--   call those Amazon Web Services APIs, and provision that execution role
--   in your account. CloudFormation then assumes that execution role to
--   provide your extension with the appropriate credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestPublicVersion:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_latestPublicVersion</a> - The latest version
--   of a public extension <i>that is available</i> for use.
--   
--   This only applies if you specify a public extension, and you do not
--   specify a version. For all other requests, CloudFormation returns
--   <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:DescribeType'</a>, <a>describeTypeResponse_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deprecatedStatus:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_deprecatedStatus</a> - The deprecation status
--   of the extension version.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>LIVE</tt>: The extension is activated or registered and can be
--   used in CloudFormation operations, dependent on its provisioning
--   behavior and visibility scope.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPRECATED</tt>: The extension has been deactivated or
--   deregistered and can no longer be used in CloudFormation
--   operations.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For public third-party extensions, CloudFormation returns
--   <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requiredActivatedTypes:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_requiredActivatedTypes</a> - For extensions
--   that are modules, the public third-party extensions that must be
--   activated in your account in order for the module itself to be
--   activated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdated:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_lastUpdated</a> - When the specified extension
--   version was registered. This applies only to:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Private extensions you have registered in your account. For more
--   information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.</li>
--   <li>Public extensions you have activated in your account with
--   auto-update specified. For more information, see
--   <a>ActivateType</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultVersionId:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_defaultVersionId</a> - The ID of the default
--   version of the extension. The default version is used when the
--   extension version is not specified.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account. For public extensions, both those provided by Amazon and
--   published by third parties, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>. For
--   more information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.
--   
--   To set the default version of an extension, use <tt>
--   SetTypeDefaultVersion </tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentationUrl:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_documentationUrl</a> - The URL of a page
--   providing detailed documentation for this extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningType:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_provisioningType</a> - For resource type
--   extensions, the provisioning behavior of the resource type.
--   CloudFormation determines the provisioning type during registration,
--   based on the types of handlers in the schema handler package
--   submitted.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FULLY_MUTABLE</tt>: The resource type includes an update
--   handler to process updates to the type during stack update
--   operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>IMMUTABLE</tt>: The resource type does not include an update
--   handler, so the type cannot be updated and must instead be replaced
--   during stack update operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>NON_PROVISIONABLE</tt>: The resource type does not include all
--   of the following handlers, and therefore cannot actually be
--   provisioned.<ul><li>create</li><li>read</li><li>delete</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceUrl:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_sourceUrl</a> - The URL of the source code for
--   the extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_description</a> - The description of the
--   extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoUpdate:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_autoUpdate</a> - Whether CloudFormation
--   automatically updates the extension in this account and region when a
--   new <i>minor</i> version is published by the extension publisher.
--   Major versions released by the publisher must be manually updated. For
--   more information, see <a>Activating public extensions for use in your
--   account</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originalTypeName:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_originalTypeName</a> - For public extensions
--   that have been activated for this account and region, the type name of
--   the public extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when enabling the extension
--   in this account and region, CloudFormation treats that alias as the
--   extension's type name within the account and region, not the type name
--   of the public extension. For more information, see <a>Specifying
--   aliases to refer to extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:visibility:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_visibility</a> - The scope at which the
--   extension is visible and usable in CloudFormation operations.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PRIVATE</tt>: The extension is only visible and usable within
--   the account in which it is registered. CloudFormation marks any
--   extensions you register as <tt>PRIVATE</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>PUBLIC</tt>: The extension is publically visible and usable
--   within any Amazon account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDefaultVersion:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_isDefaultVersion</a> - Whether the specified
--   extension version is set as the default version.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account, and extensions published by Amazon. For public third-party
--   extensions, whether or not they are activated in your account,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicVersionNumber:DescribeType'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_publicVersionNumber</a> - The version number
--   of a public third-party extension.
--   
--   This applies only if you specify a public extension you have activated
--   in your account, or specify a public extension without specifying a
--   version. For all other extensions, CloudFormation returns
--   <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':DescribeType'</a>, <a>describeTypeResponse_type</a> -
--   The kind of extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeCreated:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_timeCreated</a> - When the specified private
--   extension version was registered or activated in your account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeTypeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDescribeTypeResponse :: Int -> DescribeTypeResponse

-- | Whether or not the extension is activated in the account and region.
--   
--   This only applies to public third-party extensions. For all other
--   extensions, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
describeTypeResponse_isActivated :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The description of the test status. To return the extension test
--   status of a specifc extension version, you must specify
--   <tt>VersionId</tt>.
--   
--   This applies only to registered private extension versions.
--   CloudFormation does not return this information for public extensions,
--   whether or not they are activated in your account.
describeTypeResponse_typeTestsStatusDescription :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the extension.
--   
--   If the extension is a public third-party type you have activated with
--   a type name alias, CloudFormation returns the type name alias. For
--   more information, see <a>ActivateType</a>.
describeTypeResponse_typeName :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | For public extensions that have been activated for this account and
--   region, the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the public extension.
describeTypeResponse_originalTypeArn :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains logging configuration information for private extensions.
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account. For public extensions, both those provided by Amazon and
--   published by third parties, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>. For
--   more information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.
describeTypeResponse_loggingConfig :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe LoggingConfig)

-- | The contract test status of the registered extension version. To
--   return the extension test status of a specifc extension version, you
--   must specify <tt>VersionId</tt>.
--   
--   This applies only to registered private extension versions.
--   CloudFormation does not return this information for public extensions,
--   whether or not they are activated in your account.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PASSED</tt>: The extension has passed all its contract
--   tests.An extension must have a test status of <tt>PASSED</tt> before
--   it can be published. For more information, see <a>Publishing
--   extensions to make them available for public use</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation Command Line Interface User Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The extension has failed one or more contract
--   tests.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>: Contract tests are currently being performed
--   on the extension.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_TESTED</tt>: Contract tests have not been performed on the
--   extension.</li>
--   </ul>
describeTypeResponse_typeTestsStatus :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe TypeTestsStatus)

-- | A JSON string that represent the current configuration data for the
--   extension in this account and region.
--   
--   To set the configuration data for an extension, use
--   <a>SetTypeConfiguration</a>. For more information, see <a>Configuring
--   extensions at the account level</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
describeTypeResponse_configurationSchema :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The schema that defines the extension.
--   
--   For more information on extension schemas, see <a>Resource Provider
--   Schema</a> in the <i>CloudFormation CLI User Guide</i>.
describeTypeResponse_schema :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The publisher ID of the extension publisher.
--   
--   This applies only to public third-party extensions. For private
--   registered extensions, and extensions provided by Amazon,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
describeTypeResponse_publisherId :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM execution role used to
--   register the extension. This applies only to private extensions you
--   have registered in your account. For more information, see
--   <a>RegisterType</a>.
--   
--   If the registered extension calls any Amazon Web Services APIs, you
--   must create an
--   <i>&lt;https:</i><i>docs.aws.amazon.com</i>IAM<i>latest</i>UserGuide<i>id_roles.html
--   IAM execution role&gt;</i> that includes the necessary permissions to
--   call those Amazon Web Services APIs, and provision that execution role
--   in your account. CloudFormation then assumes that execution role to
--   provide your extension with the appropriate credentials.
describeTypeResponse_executionRoleArn :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The latest version of a public extension <i>that is available</i> for
--   use.
--   
--   This only applies if you specify a public extension, and you do not
--   specify a version. For all other requests, CloudFormation returns
--   <tt>null</tt>.
describeTypeResponse_latestPublicVersion :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the extension.
describeTypeResponse_arn :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The deprecation status of the extension version.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>LIVE</tt>: The extension is activated or registered and can be
--   used in CloudFormation operations, dependent on its provisioning
--   behavior and visibility scope.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPRECATED</tt>: The extension has been deactivated or
--   deregistered and can no longer be used in CloudFormation
--   operations.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For public third-party extensions, CloudFormation returns
--   <tt>null</tt>.
describeTypeResponse_deprecatedStatus :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe DeprecatedStatus)

-- | For extensions that are modules, the public third-party extensions
--   that must be activated in your account in order for the module itself
--   to be activated.
describeTypeResponse_requiredActivatedTypes :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe [RequiredActivatedType])

-- | When the specified extension version was registered. This applies only
--   to:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Private extensions you have registered in your account. For more
--   information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.</li>
--   <li>Public extensions you have activated in your account with
--   auto-update specified. For more information, see
--   <a>ActivateType</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
describeTypeResponse_lastUpdated :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the default version of the extension. The default version is
--   used when the extension version is not specified.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account. For public extensions, both those provided by Amazon and
--   published by third parties, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>. For
--   more information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.
--   
--   To set the default version of an extension, use <tt>
--   SetTypeDefaultVersion </tt>.
describeTypeResponse_defaultVersionId :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL of a page providing detailed documentation for this extension.
describeTypeResponse_documentationUrl :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | For resource type extensions, the provisioning behavior of the
--   resource type. CloudFormation determines the provisioning type during
--   registration, based on the types of handlers in the schema handler
--   package submitted.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FULLY_MUTABLE</tt>: The resource type includes an update
--   handler to process updates to the type during stack update
--   operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>IMMUTABLE</tt>: The resource type does not include an update
--   handler, so the type cannot be updated and must instead be replaced
--   during stack update operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>NON_PROVISIONABLE</tt>: The resource type does not include all
--   of the following handlers, and therefore cannot actually be
--   provisioned.<ul><li>create</li><li>read</li><li>delete</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
describeTypeResponse_provisioningType :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe ProvisioningType)

-- | The URL of the source code for the extension.
describeTypeResponse_sourceUrl :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the extension.
describeTypeResponse_description :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extension in this
--   account and region when a new <i>minor</i> version is published by the
--   extension publisher. Major versions released by the publisher must be
--   manually updated. For more information, see <a>Activating public
--   extensions for use in your account</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
describeTypeResponse_autoUpdate :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | For public extensions that have been activated for this account and
--   region, the type name of the public extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when enabling the extension
--   in this account and region, CloudFormation treats that alias as the
--   extension's type name within the account and region, not the type name
--   of the public extension. For more information, see <a>Specifying
--   aliases to refer to extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
describeTypeResponse_originalTypeName :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The scope at which the extension is visible and usable in
--   CloudFormation operations.
--   
--   Valid values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PRIVATE</tt>: The extension is only visible and usable within
--   the account in which it is registered. CloudFormation marks any
--   extensions you register as <tt>PRIVATE</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>PUBLIC</tt>: The extension is publically visible and usable
--   within any Amazon account.</li>
--   </ul>
describeTypeResponse_visibility :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Visibility)

-- | Whether the specified extension version is set as the default version.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account, and extensions published by Amazon. For public third-party
--   extensions, whether or not they are activated in your account,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
describeTypeResponse_isDefaultVersion :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The version number of a public third-party extension.
--   
--   This applies only if you specify a public extension you have activated
--   in your account, or specify a public extension without specifying a
--   version. For all other extensions, CloudFormation returns
--   <tt>null</tt>.
describeTypeResponse_publicVersionNumber :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The kind of extension.
describeTypeResponse_type :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe RegistryType)

-- | When the specified private extension version was registered or
--   activated in your account.
describeTypeResponse_timeCreated :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeTypeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeTypeResponse Int

-- | Returns the description for the specified stack; if no stack name was
--   specified, then it returns the description for all the stacks created.
--   
--   If the stack does not exist, an <tt>ValidationError</tt> is returned.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeStacks

-- | The input for DescribeStacks action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeStacks</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeStacks
DescribeStacks' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DescribeStacks

-- | A string that identifies the next page of stacks that you want to
--   retrieve.
[$sel:nextToken:DescribeStacks'] :: DescribeStacks -> Maybe Text

-- | The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack,
--   which are not always interchangeable:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its
--   unique stack ID.</li>
--   <li>Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
[$sel:stackName:DescribeStacks'] :: DescribeStacks -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeStacks</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   retrieve.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:DescribeStacks'</a>, <a>describeStacks_stackName</a>
--   - The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack,
--   which are not always interchangeable:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its
--   unique stack ID.</li>
--   <li>Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
newDescribeStacks :: DescribeStacks

-- | A string that identifies the next page of stacks that you want to
--   retrieve.
describeStacks_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeStacks (Maybe Text)

-- | The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack,
--   which are not always interchangeable:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its
--   unique stack ID.</li>
--   <li>Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
describeStacks_stackName :: Lens' DescribeStacks (Maybe Text)

-- | Returns the description of the specified stack set operation.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeStackSetOperation

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeStackSetOperation</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeStackSetOperation
DescribeStackSetOperation' :: Maybe CallAs -> Text -> Text -> DescribeStackSetOperation

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Specifies whether you are
--   acting as an account administrator in the organization's management
--   account or as a delegated administrator in a member account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:callAs:DescribeStackSetOperation'] :: DescribeStackSetOperation -> Maybe CallAs

-- | The name or the unique stack ID of the stack set for the stack
--   operation.
[$sel:stackSetName:DescribeStackSetOperation'] :: DescribeStackSetOperation -> Text

-- | The unique ID of the stack set operation.
[$sel:operationId:DescribeStackSetOperation'] :: DescribeStackSetOperation -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeStackSetOperation</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAs:DescribeStackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackSetOperation_callAs</a> - [Service-managed
--   permissions] Specifies whether you are acting as an account
--   administrator in the organization's management account or as a
--   delegated administrator in a member account.
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:DescribeStackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackSetOperation_stackSetName</a> - The name or the unique
--   stack ID of the stack set for the stack operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operationId:DescribeStackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackSetOperation_operationId</a> - The unique ID of the
--   stack set operation.
newDescribeStackSetOperation :: Text -> Text -> DescribeStackSetOperation

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Specifies whether you are
--   acting as an account administrator in the organization's management
--   account or as a delegated administrator in a member account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
describeStackSetOperation_callAs :: Lens' DescribeStackSetOperation (Maybe CallAs)

--   operation.
describeStackSetOperation_stackSetName :: Lens' DescribeStackSetOperation Text

-- | Returns the description of the specified stack set.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeStackSet

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeStackSet</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeStackSet
DescribeStackSet' :: Maybe CallAs -> Text -> DescribeStackSet

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Specifies whether you are
--   acting as an account administrator in the organization's management
--   account or as a delegated administrator in a member account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:callAs:DescribeStackSet'] :: DescribeStackSet -> Maybe CallAs

-- | The name or unique ID of the stack set whose description you want.
[$sel:stackSetName:DescribeStackSet'] :: DescribeStackSet -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeStackSet</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAs:DescribeStackSet'</a>, <a>describeStackSet_callAs</a> -
--   [Service-managed permissions] Specifies whether you are acting as an
--   account administrator in the organization's management account or as a
--   delegated administrator in a member account.
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:DescribeStackSet'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackSet_stackSetName</a> - The name or unique ID of the
--   stack set whose description you want.
newDescribeStackSet :: Text -> DescribeStackSet

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Specifies whether you are
--   acting as an account administrator in the organization's management
--   account or as a delegated administrator in a member account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
describeStackSet_callAs :: Lens' DescribeStackSet (Maybe CallAs)

-- | The name or unique ID of the stack set whose description you want.
describeStackSet_stackSetName :: Lens' DescribeStackSet Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeStackSetResponse</a> smart constructor.

DescribeStackSetResponse' :: Maybe StackSet -> Int -> DescribeStackSetResponse

-- | Returns Amazon Web Services resource descriptions for running and
--   deleted stacks. If <tt>StackName</tt> is specified, all the associated
--   resources that are part of the stack are returned. If
--   <tt>PhysicalResourceId</tt> is specified, the associated resources of
--   the stack that the resource belongs to are returned.
--   
--   Only the first 100 resources will be returned. If your stack has more
--   resources than this, you should use <tt>ListStackResources</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   For deleted stacks, <tt>DescribeStackResources</tt> returns resource
--   information for up to 90 days after the stack has been deleted.
--   
--   You must specify either <tt>StackName</tt> or
--   <tt>PhysicalResourceId</tt>, but not both. In addition, you can
--   specify <tt>LogicalResourceId</tt> to filter the returned result. For
--   more information about resources, the <tt>LogicalResourceId</tt> and
--   <tt>PhysicalResourceId</tt>, go to the <a>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   A <tt>ValidationError</tt> is returned if you specify both
--   <tt>StackName</tt> and <tt>PhysicalResourceId</tt> in the same
--   request.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeStackResources

-- | The input for DescribeStackResources action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeStackResources</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeStackResources
DescribeStackResources' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DescribeStackResources

-- | The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack,
--   which are not always interchangeable:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its
--   unique stack ID.</li>
--   <li>Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
--   
--   Required: Conditional. If you do not specify <tt>StackName</tt>, you
--   must specify <tt>PhysicalResourceId</tt>.
[$sel:stackName:DescribeStackResources'] :: DescribeStackResources -> Maybe Text

-- | The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance
--   ID of a resource supported by CloudFormation.
--   
--   For example, for an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instance,
--   <tt>PhysicalResourceId</tt> corresponds to the <tt>InstanceId</tt>.
--   You can pass the EC2 <tt>InstanceId</tt> to
--   <tt>DescribeStackResources</tt> to find which stack the instance
--   belongs to and what other resources are part of the stack.
--   
--   Required: Conditional. If you do not specify
--   <tt>PhysicalResourceId</tt>, you must specify <tt>StackName</tt>.
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
[$sel:physicalResourceId:DescribeStackResources'] :: DescribeStackResources -> Maybe Text

-- | The logical name of the resource as specified in the template.
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
[$sel:logicalResourceId:DescribeStackResources'] :: DescribeStackResources -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeStackResources</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:DescribeStackResources'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackResources_stackName</a> - The name or the unique stack
--   ID that is associated with the stack, which are not always
--   interchangeable:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its
--   unique stack ID.</li>
--   <li>Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
--   
--   Required: Conditional. If you do not specify <tt>StackName</tt>, you
--   must specify <tt>PhysicalResourceId</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:physicalResourceId:DescribeStackResources'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackResources_physicalResourceId</a> - The name or unique
--   identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of a resource
--   supported by CloudFormation.
--   
--   For example, for an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instance,
--   <tt>PhysicalResourceId</tt> corresponds to the <tt>InstanceId</tt>.
--   You can pass the EC2 <tt>InstanceId</tt> to
--   <tt>DescribeStackResources</tt> to find which stack the instance
--   belongs to and what other resources are part of the stack.
--   
--   Required: Conditional. If you do not specify
--   <tt>PhysicalResourceId</tt>, you must specify <tt>StackName</tt>.
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:DescribeStackResources'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackResources_logicalResourceId</a> - The logical name of
--   the resource as specified in the template.
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
newDescribeStackResources :: DescribeStackResources

-- | The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack,
--   which are not always interchangeable:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its
--   unique stack ID.</li>
--   <li>Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
--   
--   Required: Conditional. If you do not specify <tt>StackName</tt>, you
--   must specify <tt>PhysicalResourceId</tt>.
describeStackResources_stackName :: Lens' DescribeStackResources (Maybe Text)

-- | The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance
--   ID of a resource supported by CloudFormation.
--   
--   For example, for an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instance,
--   <tt>PhysicalResourceId</tt> corresponds to the <tt>InstanceId</tt>.
--   You can pass the EC2 <tt>InstanceId</tt> to
--   <tt>DescribeStackResources</tt> to find which stack the instance
--   belongs to and what other resources are part of the stack.
--   
--   Required: Conditional. If you do not specify
--   <tt>PhysicalResourceId</tt>, you must specify <tt>StackName</tt>.
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
describeStackResources_physicalResourceId :: Lens' DescribeStackResources (Maybe Text)

-- | The logical name of the resource as specified in the template.
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
describeStackResources_logicalResourceId :: Lens' DescribeStackResources (Maybe Text)

-- | Returns drift information for the resources that have been checked for
--   drift in the specified stack. This includes actual and expected
--   configuration values for resources where CloudFormation detects
--   configuration drift.
--   
--   For a given stack, there will be one <tt>StackResourceDrift</tt> for
--   each stack resource that has been checked for drift. Resources that
--   haven't yet been checked for drift are not included. Resources that do
--   not currently support drift detection are not checked, and so not
--   included. For a list of resources that support drift detection, see
--   <a>Resources that Support Drift Detection</a>.
--   
--   Use DetectStackResourceDrift to detect drift on individual resources,
--   or DetectStackDrift to detect drift on all supported resources for a
--   given stack.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeStackResourceDrifts

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeStackResourceDrifts</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeStackResourceDrifts
DescribeStackResourceDrifts' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe (NonEmpty StackResourceDriftStatus) -> Text -> DescribeStackResourceDrifts

-- | A string that identifies the next page of stack resource drift
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:DescribeStackResourceDrifts'] :: DescribeStackResourceDrifts -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned with a single call. If
--   the number of available results exceeds this maximum, the response
--   includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can assign to the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter to get the next set of results.
[$sel:maxResults:DescribeStackResourceDrifts'] :: DescribeStackResourceDrifts -> Maybe Natural

-- | The resource drift status values to use as filters for the resource
--   drift results returned.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected template
--   configuration in that the resource has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: One or more resource properties differ from
--   their expected template values.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected template configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation does not currently return
--   this value.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:stackResourceDriftStatusFilters:DescribeStackResourceDrifts'] :: DescribeStackResourceDrifts -> Maybe (NonEmpty StackResourceDriftStatus)

-- | The name of the stack for which you want drift information.
[$sel:stackName:DescribeStackResourceDrifts'] :: DescribeStackResourceDrifts -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeStackResourceDrifts</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeStackResourceDrifts'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackResourceDrifts_nextToken</a> - A string that
--   identifies the next page of stack resource drift results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:DescribeStackResourceDrifts'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackResourceDrifts_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   results to be returned with a single call. If the number of available
--   results exceeds this maximum, the response includes a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can assign to the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter to get the next set of results.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackResourceDriftStatusFilters:DescribeStackResourceDrifts'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackResourceDrifts_stackResourceDriftStatusFilters</a> -
--   The resource drift status values to use as filters for the resource
--   drift results returned.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected template
--   configuration in that the resource has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: One or more resource properties differ from
--   their expected template values.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected template configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation does not currently return
--   this value.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:DescribeStackResourceDrifts'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackResourceDrifts_stackName</a> - The name of the stack
--   for which you want drift information.
newDescribeStackResourceDrifts :: Text -> DescribeStackResourceDrifts

-- | A string that identifies the next page of stack resource drift
--   results.
describeStackResourceDrifts_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeStackResourceDrifts (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned with a single call. If
--   the number of available results exceeds this maximum, the response
--   includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you can assign to the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter to get the next set of results.
describeStackResourceDrifts_maxResults :: Lens' DescribeStackResourceDrifts (Maybe Natural)

-- | The resource drift status values to use as filters for the resource
--   drift results returned.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected template
--   configuration in that the resource has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: One or more resource properties differ from
--   their expected template values.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected template configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation does not currently return
--   this value.</li>
--   </ul>
describeStackResourceDrifts_stackResourceDriftStatusFilters :: Lens' DescribeStackResourceDrifts (Maybe (NonEmpty StackResourceDriftStatus))

-- | The name of the stack for which you want drift information.
describeStackResourceDrifts_stackName :: Lens' DescribeStackResourceDrifts Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeStackResourceDriftsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeStackResourceDriftsResponse
DescribeStackResourceDriftsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [StackResourceDrift] -> DescribeStackResourceDriftsResponse

-- | If the request doesn't return all of the remaining results,
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> is set to a token. To retrieve the next set of
--   results, call <tt>DescribeStackResourceDrifts</tt> again and assign
--   that token to the request object's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter. If
--   the request returns all results, <tt>NextToken</tt> is set to
--   <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:nextToken:DescribeStackResourceDriftsResponse'] :: DescribeStackResourceDriftsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeStackResourceDriftsResponse'] :: DescribeStackResourceDriftsResponse -> Int

-- | Drift information for the resources that have been checked for drift
--   in the specified stack. This includes actual and expected
--   configuration values for resources where CloudFormation detects drift.
--   
--   For a given stack, there will be one <tt>StackResourceDrift</tt> for
--   each stack resource that has been checked for drift. Resources that
--   have not yet been checked for drift are not included. Resources that
--   do not currently support drift detection are not checked, and so not
--   included. For a list of resources that support drift detection, see
--   <a>Resources that Support Drift Detection</a>.
[$sel:stackResourceDrifts:DescribeStackResourceDriftsResponse'] :: DescribeStackResourceDriftsResponse -> [StackResourceDrift]

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeStackResourceDriftsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--

--   doesn't return all of the remaining results, <tt>NextToken</tt> is set
--   to a token. To retrieve the next set of results, call
--   <tt>DescribeStackResourceDrifts</tt> again and assign that token to
--   the request object's <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter. If the request
--   returns all results, <tt>NextToken</tt> is set to <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeStackResourceDriftsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackResourceDriftsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackResourceDrifts:DescribeStackResourceDriftsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackResourceDriftsResponse_stackResourceDrifts</a> - Drift
--   information for the resources that have been checked for drift in the
--   specified stack. This includes actual and expected configuration
--   values for resources where CloudFormation detects drift.
--   
--   For a given stack, there will be one <tt>StackResourceDrift</tt> for
--   each stack resource that has been checked for drift. Resources that
--   have not yet been checked for drift are not included. Resources that
--   do not currently support drift detection are not checked, and so not
--   included. For a list of resources that support drift detection, see

--

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeStackResourceDrifts.DescribeStackResourceDrifts
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeStackResourceDrifts.DescribeStackResourceDrifts

instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeStackResourceDrifts.DescribeStackResourceDrifts
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeStackResourceDrifts.DescribeStackResourceDrifts


-- | Returns a description of the specified resource in the specified
--   stack.
--   
--   For deleted stacks, DescribeStackResource returns resource information
--   for up to 90 days after the stack has been deleted.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeStackResource

-- | The input for DescribeStackResource action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeStackResource</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeStackResource
DescribeStackResource' :: Text -> Text -> DescribeStackResource

-- | The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack,
--   which are not always interchangeable:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its
--   unique stack ID.</li>
--   <li>Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
[$sel:stackName:DescribeStackResource'] :: DescribeStackResource -> Text

-- | Returns the stack instance that's associated with the specified stack
--   set, Amazon Web Services account, and Region.
--   
--   For a list of stack instances that are associated with a specific
--   stack set, use ListStackInstances.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeStackInstance

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeStackInstance</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeStackInstance
DescribeStackInstance' :: Maybe CallAs -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribeStackInstance

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Specifies whether you are
--   acting as an account administrator in the organization's management
--   account or as a delegated administrator in a member account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:callAs:DescribeStackInstance'] :: DescribeStackInstance -> Maybe CallAs

-- | The name or the unique stack ID of the stack set that you want to get
--   stack instance information for.
[$sel:stackSetName:DescribeStackInstance'] :: DescribeStackInstance -> Text

-- | The ID of an Amazon Web Services account that's associated with this
--   stack instance.
[$sel:stackInstanceAccount:DescribeStackInstance'] :: DescribeStackInstance -> Text

-- | The name of a Region that's associated with this stack instance.
[$sel:stackInstanceRegion:DescribeStackInstance'] :: DescribeStackInstance -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeStackInstance</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:callAs:DescribeStackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackInstance_callAs</a> - [Service-managed permissions]
--   Specifies whether you are acting as an account administrator in the
--   organization's management account or as a delegated administrator in a
--   member account.
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>

--   
--   <a>$sel:stackInstanceRegion:DescribeStackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>describeStackInstance_stackInstanceRegion</a> - The name of a
--   Region that's associated with this stack instance.
newDescribeStackInstance :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribeStackInstance

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> Specifies whether you are
--   acting as an account administrator in the organization's management
--   account or as a delegated administrator in a member account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   By default, <tt>SELF</tt> is specified. Use <tt>SELF</tt> for stack
--   sets with self-managed permissions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you are signed in to the management account, specify
--   <tt>SELF</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If you are signed in to a delegated administrator account, specify
--   <tt>DELEGATED_ADMIN</tt>.Your Amazon Web Services account must be
--   registered as a delegated administrator in the management account. For
--   more information, see <a>Register a delegated administrator</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
describeStackInstance_callAs :: Lens' DescribeStackInstance (Maybe CallAs)

-- | Returns all stack related events for a specified stack in reverse
--   chronological order. For more information about a stack's event
--   history, go to <a>Stacks</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.
--   
--   You can list events for stacks that have failed to create or have been
--   deleted by specifying the unique stack identifier (stack ID).
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CloudFormation.DescribeStackEvents

-- | The input for DescribeStackEvents action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeStackEvents</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeStackEvents
DescribeStackEvents' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DescribeStackEvents

-- | A string that identifies the next page of events that you want to
--   retrieve.
[$sel:nextToken:DescribeStackEvents'] :: DescribeStackEvents -> Maybe Text

--   which are not always interchangeable:
--   
--   <ul>

--   unique stack ID.</li>
--   <li>Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: There is no default value.
