-- | Create a value of <a>BatchDescribeTypeConfigurationsError</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeConfigurationIdentifier:BatchDescribeTypeConfigurationsError'</a>,
--   <a>batchDescribeTypeConfigurationsError_typeConfigurationIdentifier</a>
--   - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:BatchDescribeTypeConfigurationsError'</a>,
--   <a>batchDescribeTypeConfigurationsError_errorMessage</a> - The error
--   message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:BatchDescribeTypeConfigurationsError'</a>,
--   <a>batchDescribeTypeConfigurationsError_errorCode</a> - The error
--   code.
newBatchDescribeTypeConfigurationsError :: BatchDescribeTypeConfigurationsError

-- | The <tt>Change</tt> structure describes the changes CloudFormation
--   will perform if you execute the change set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChange</a> smart constructor.
data Change
Change' :: Maybe ResourceChange -> Maybe ChangeType -> Change

-- | Create a value of <a>Change</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceChange:Change'</a>, <a>change_resourceChange</a> - A
--   <tt>ResourceChange</tt> structure that describes the resource and
--   action that CloudFormation will perform.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Change'</a>, <a>change_type</a> - The type of entity
--   that CloudFormation changes. Currently, the only entity type is
--   <tt>Resource</tt>.
newChange :: Change

-- | The <tt>ChangeSetSummary</tt> structure describes a change set, its
--   status, and the stack with which it's associated.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChangeSetSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ChangeSetSummary
ChangeSetSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe ChangeSetStatus -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ChangeSetSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>ChangeSetSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rootChangeSetId:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_rootChangeSetId</a> - The root change set ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_creationTime</a> - The start time when the change
--   set was created, in UTC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ChangeSetSummary'</a>, <a>changeSetSummary_status</a> -
--   The state of the change set, such as <tt>CREATE_IN_PROGRESS</tt>,
--   <tt>CREATE_COMPLETE</tt>, or <tt>FAILED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeNestedStacks:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_includeNestedStacks</a> - Specifies the current
--   setting of <tt>IncludeNestedStacks</tt> for the change set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_stackName</a> - The name of the stack with which
--   the change set is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionStatus:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_executionStatus</a> - If the change set execution
--   status is <tt>AVAILABLE</tt>, you can execute the change set. If you
--   can’t execute the change set, the status indicates why. For example, a
--   change set might be in an <tt>UNAVAILABLE</tt> state because
--   CloudFormation is still creating it or in an <tt>OBSOLETE</tt> state
--   because the stack was already updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:ChangeSetSummary'</a>, <a>changeSetSummary_stackId</a>
--   - The ID of the stack with which the change set is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentChangeSetId:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_parentChangeSetId</a> - The parent change set ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:changeSetId:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_changeSetId</a> - The ID of the change set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_description</a> - Descriptive information about
--   the change set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:changeSetName:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_changeSetName</a> - The name of the change set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusReason:ChangeSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>changeSetSummary_statusReason</a> - A description of the change
--   set's status. For example, if your change set is in the
--   <tt>FAILED</tt> state, CloudFormation shows the error message.
newChangeSetSummary :: ChangeSetSummary

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Service-managed permissions</i> The Organizations accounts to
--   which StackSets deploys. StackSets does not deploy stack instances to
--   the organization management account, even if the organization
--   management account is in your organization or in an OU in your
--   organization.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For update operations, you can specify either <tt>Accounts</tt> or
--   <tt>OrganizationalUnitIds</tt>. For create and delete operations,
--   specify <tt>OrganizationalUnitIds</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeploymentTargets</a> smart constructor.
data DeploymentTargets
DeploymentTargets' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> DeploymentTargets

-- | Create a value of <a>DeploymentTargets</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitIds:DeploymentTargets'</a>,
--   <a>deploymentTargets_organizationalUnitIds</a> - The organization root
--   ID or organizational unit (OU) IDs to which StackSets deploys.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accounts:DeploymentTargets'</a>,
--   <a>deploymentTargets_accounts</a> - The names of one or more Amazon
--   Web Services accounts for which you want to deploy stack set updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountsUrl:DeploymentTargets'</a>,
--   <a>deploymentTargets_accountsUrl</a> - Returns the value of the
--   <tt>AccountsUrl</tt> property.
newDeploymentTargets :: DeploymentTargets

-- | The <tt>Export</tt> structure describes the exported output values for
--   a stack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExport</a> smart constructor.
data Export
Export' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Export

-- | Create a value of <a>Export</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Export'</a>, <a>export_name</a> - The name of exported
--   output value. Use this name and the <tt>Fn::ImportValue</tt> function
--   to import the associated value into other stacks. The name is defined
--   in the <tt>Export</tt> field in the associated stack's
--   <tt>Outputs</tt> section.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exportingStackId:Export'</a>, <a>export_exportingStackId</a> -
--   The stack that contains the exported output name and value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Export'</a>, <a>export_value</a> - The value of the
--   exported output, such as a resource physical ID. This value is defined
--   in the <tt>Export</tt> field in the associated stack's
--   <tt>Outputs</tt> section.
newExport :: Export

-- | Contains logging configuration information for an extension.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoggingConfig</a> smart constructor.
data LoggingConfig
LoggingConfig' :: Text -> Text -> LoggingConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>LoggingConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:logRoleArn:LoggingConfig'</a>, <a>loggingConfig_logRoleArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the role that CloudFormation should assume when sending
--   log entries to CloudWatch logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logGroupName:LoggingConfig'</a>,
--   <a>loggingConfig_logGroupName</a> - The Amazon CloudWatch log group to
--   which CloudFormation sends error logging information when invoking the
--   extension's handlers.
newLoggingConfig :: Text -> Text -> LoggingConfig

-- | Contains information about the module from which the resource was
--   created, if the resource was created from a module included in the
--   stack template.
--   
--   For more information on modules, see <a>Using modules to encapsulate
--   and reuse resource configurations</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newModuleInfo</a> smart constructor.
data ModuleInfo
ModuleInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ModuleInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>ModuleInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalIdHierarchy:ModuleInfo'</a>,
--   <a>moduleInfo_logicalIdHierarchy</a> - A concantenated list of the
--   logical IDs of the module or modules containing the resource. Modules
--   are listed starting with the inner-most nested module, and separated
--   by <tt>/</tt>.
--   
--   In the following example, the resource was created from a module,
--   <tt>moduleA</tt>, that is nested inside a parent module,
--   <tt>moduleB</tt>.
--   
--   <pre>
--   moduleA/moduleB
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Referencing resources in a module</a> in
--   the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeHierarchy:ModuleInfo'</a>, <a>moduleInfo_typeHierarchy</a>
--   - A concantenated list of the the module type or types containing the
--   resource. Module types are listed starting with the inner-most nested
--   module, and separated by <tt>/</tt>.
--   
--   In the following example, the resource was created from a module of
--   type <tt>AWS::First::Example::MODULE</tt>, that is nested inside a
--   parent module of type <tt>AWS::Second::Example::MODULE</tt>.
--   
--   <pre>
--   AWS::First::Example::MODULE/AWS::Second::Example::MODULE
--   </pre>
newModuleInfo :: ModuleInfo

-- | The Output data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutput</a> smart constructor.
data Output
Output' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Output

-- | Create a value of <a>Output</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputKey:Output'</a>, <a>output_outputKey</a> - The key
--   associated with the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputValue:Output'</a>, <a>output_outputValue</a> - The value
--   associated with the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Output'</a>, <a>output_description</a> - User
--   defined description associated with the output.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exportName:Output'</a>, <a>output_exportName</a> - The name of
--   the export associated with the output.
newOutput :: Output

-- | The Parameter data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParameter</a> smart constructor.
data Parameter
Parameter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Parameter

-- | Create a value of <a>Parameter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterValue:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_parameterValue</a>
--   - The input value associated with the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:usePreviousValue:Parameter'</a>,
--   <a>parameter_usePreviousValue</a> - During a stack update, use the
--   existing parameter value that the stack is using for a given parameter
--   key. If you specify <tt>true</tt>, do not specify a parameter value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterKey:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_parameterKey</a> -
--   The key associated with the parameter. If you don't specify a key and
--   value for a particular parameter, CloudFormation uses the default
--   value that is specified in your template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resolvedValue:Parameter'</a>, <a>parameter_resolvedValue</a> -
--   Read-only. The value that corresponds to a Systems Manager parameter
--   key. This field is returned only for <a>SSM parameter types</a> in the
--   template.
newParameter :: Parameter

-- | A set of criteria that CloudFormation uses to validate parameter
--   values. Although other constraints might be defined in the stack
--   template, CloudFormation returns only the <tt>AllowedValues</tt>
--   property.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParameterConstraints</a> smart constructor.
data ParameterConstraints
ParameterConstraints' :: Maybe [Text] -> ParameterConstraints

-- | Create a value of <a>ParameterConstraints</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedValues:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_allowedValues</a> - A list of values that are
--   permitted for a parameter.
newParameterConstraints :: ParameterConstraints

-- | The ParameterDeclaration data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParameterDeclaration</a> smart constructor.
data ParameterDeclaration
ParameterDeclaration' :: Maybe ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> ParameterDeclaration

-- | Create a value of <a>ParameterDeclaration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterConstraints:ParameterDeclaration'</a>,
--   <a>parameterDeclaration_parameterConstraints</a> - The criteria that
--   CloudFormation uses to validate parameter values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterType:ParameterDeclaration'</a>,
--   <a>parameterDeclaration_parameterType</a> - The type of parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ParameterDeclaration'</a>,
--   <a>parameterDeclaration_description</a> - The description that is
--   associate with the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterKey:ParameterDeclaration'</a>,
--   <a>parameterDeclaration_parameterKey</a> - The name that is associated
--   with the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultValue:ParameterDeclaration'</a>,
--   <a>parameterDeclaration_defaultValue</a> - The default value of the
--   parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noEcho:ParameterDeclaration'</a>,
--   <a>parameterDeclaration_noEcho</a> - Flag that indicates whether the
--   parameter value is shown as plain text in logs and in the Amazon Web
--   Services Management Console.
newParameterDeclaration :: ParameterDeclaration

-- | Context information that enables CloudFormation to uniquely identify a
--   resource. CloudFormation uses context key-value pairs in cases where a
--   resource's logical and physical IDs are not enough to uniquely
--   identify that resource. Each context key-value pair specifies a
--   resource that contains the targeted resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair
PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair' :: Text -> Text -> PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair

-- | Create a value of <a>PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair'</a>,
--   <a>physicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair_key</a> - The resource
--   context key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair'</a>,
--   <a>physicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair_value</a> - The resource
--   context value.
newPhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair :: Text -> Text -> PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair

-- | Information about a resource property whose actual value differs from
--   its expected value, as defined in the stack template and any values
--   specified as template parameters. These will be present only for
--   resources whose <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is
--   <tt>MODIFIED</tt>. For more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated
--   Configuration Changes to Stacks and Resources</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPropertyDifference</a> smart constructor.
data PropertyDifference
PropertyDifference' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DifferenceType -> PropertyDifference

-- | Create a value of <a>PropertyDifference</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyPath:PropertyDifference'</a>,
--   <a>propertyDifference_propertyPath</a> - The fully-qualified path to
--   the resource property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedValue:PropertyDifference'</a>,
--   <a>propertyDifference_expectedValue</a> - The expected property value
--   of the resource property, as defined in the stack template and any
--   values specified as template parameters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actualValue:PropertyDifference'</a>,
--   <a>propertyDifference_actualValue</a> - The actual property value of
--   the resource property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:differenceType:PropertyDifference'</a>,
--   <a>propertyDifference_differenceType</a> - The type of property
--   difference.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ADD</tt>: A value has been added to a resource property that
--   is an array or list data type.</li>
--   <li><tt>REMOVE</tt>: The property has been removed from the current
--   resource configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_EQUAL</tt>: The current property value differs from its
--   expected value (as defined in the stack template and any values
--   specified as template parameters).</li>
--   </ul>
newPropertyDifference :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DifferenceType -> PropertyDifference

-- | For extensions that are modules, a public third-party extension that
--   must be activated in your account in order for the module itself to be
--   activated.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Activating public modules for use in your
--   account</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRequiredActivatedType</a> smart constructor.
data RequiredActivatedType
RequiredActivatedType' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Natural] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RequiredActivatedType

-- | Create a value of <a>RequiredActivatedType</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:publisherId:RequiredActivatedType'</a>,
--   <a>requiredActivatedType_publisherId</a> - The publisher ID of the
--   extension publisher.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportedMajorVersions:RequiredActivatedType'</a>,
--   <a>requiredActivatedType_supportedMajorVersions</a> - A list of the
--   major versions of the extension type that the macro supports.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeNameAlias:RequiredActivatedType'</a>,
--   <a>requiredActivatedType_typeNameAlias</a> - An alias assigned to the
--   public extension, in this account and region. If you specify an alias
--   for the extension, CloudFormation treats the alias as the extension
--   type name within this account and region. You must use the alias to
--   refer to the extension in your templates, API calls, and
--   CloudFormation console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originalTypeName:RequiredActivatedType'</a>,
--   <a>requiredActivatedType_originalTypeName</a> - The type name of the
--   public extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when enabling the extension
--   in this account and region, CloudFormation treats that alias as the
--   extension's type name within the account and region, not the type name
--   of the public extension. For more information, see <a>Specifying
--   aliases to refer to extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
newRequiredActivatedType :: RequiredActivatedType

-- | The <tt>ResourceChange</tt> structure describes the resource and the
--   action that CloudFormation will perform on it if you execute this
--   change set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceChange</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceChange
ResourceChange' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ResourceChangeDetail] -> Maybe [ResourceAttribute] -> Maybe ModuleInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChangeAction -> Maybe Replacement -> ResourceChange

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceChange</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ResourceChange'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChange_resourceType</a> - The type of CloudFormation
--   resource, such as <tt>AWS::S3::Bucket</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:physicalResourceId:ResourceChange'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChange_physicalResourceId</a> - The resource's physical ID
--   (resource name). Resources that you are adding don't have physical IDs
--   because they haven't been created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:details:ResourceChange'</a>, <a>resourceChange_details</a> -
--   For the <tt>Modify</tt> action, a list of
--   <tt>ResourceChangeDetail</tt> structures that describes the changes
--   that CloudFormation will make to the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scope:ResourceChange'</a>, <a>resourceChange_scope</a> - For
--   the <tt>Modify</tt> action, indicates which resource attribute is
--   triggering this update, such as a change in the resource attribute's
--   <tt>Metadata</tt>, <tt>Properties</tt>, or <tt>Tags</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:moduleInfo:ResourceChange'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChange_moduleInfo</a> - Contains information about the
--   module from which the resource was created, if the resource was
--   created from a module included in the stack template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:ResourceChange'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChange_logicalResourceId</a> - The resource's logical ID,
--   which is defined in the stack's template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:changeSetId:ResourceChange'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChange_changeSetId</a> - The change set ID of the nested
--   change set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:ResourceChange'</a>, <a>resourceChange_action</a> - The
--   action that CloudFormation takes on the resource, such as <tt>Add</tt>
--   (adds a new resource), <tt>Modify</tt> (changes a resource),
--   <tt>Remove</tt> (deletes a resource), <tt>Import</tt> (imports a
--   resource), or <tt>Dynamic</tt> (exact action for the resource cannot
--   be determined).
--   
--   <a>$sel:replacement:ResourceChange'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChange_replacement</a> - For the <tt>Modify</tt> action,
--   indicates whether CloudFormation will replace the resource by creating
--   a new one and deleting the old one. This value depends on the value of
--   the <tt>RequiresRecreation</tt> property in the
--   <tt>ResourceTargetDefinition</tt> structure. For example, if the
--   <tt>RequiresRecreation</tt> field is <tt>Always</tt> and the
--   <tt>Evaluation</tt> field is <tt>Static</tt>, <tt>Replacement</tt> is
--   <tt>True</tt>. If the <tt>RequiresRecreation</tt> field is
--   <tt>Always</tt> and the <tt>Evaluation</tt> field is <tt>Dynamic</tt>,
--   <tt>Replacement</tt> is <tt>Conditionally</tt>.
--   
--   If you have multiple changes with different
--   <tt>RequiresRecreation</tt> values, the <tt>Replacement</tt> value
--   depends on the change with the most impact. A
--   <tt>RequiresRecreation</tt> value of <tt>Always</tt> has the most
--   impact, followed by <tt>Conditionally</tt>, and then <tt>Never</tt>.
newResourceChange :: ResourceChange

-- | For a resource with <tt>Modify</tt> as the action, the
--   <tt>ResourceChange</tt> structure describes the changes CloudFormation
--   will make to that resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceChangeDetail</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceChangeDetail
ResourceChangeDetail' :: Maybe EvaluationType -> Maybe ChangeSource -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceTargetDefinition -> ResourceChangeDetail

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceChangeDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluation:ResourceChangeDetail'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChangeDetail_evaluation</a> - Indicates whether
--   CloudFormation can determine the target value, and whether the target
--   value will change before you execute a change set.
--   
--   For <tt>Static</tt> evaluations, CloudFormation can determine that the
--   target value will change, and its value. For example, if you directly
--   modify the <tt>InstanceType</tt> property of an EC2 instance,
--   CloudFormation knows that this property value will change, and its
--   value, so this is a <tt>Static</tt> evaluation.
--   
--   For <tt>Dynamic</tt> evaluations, cannot determine the target value
--   because it depends on the result of an intrinsic function, such as a
--   <tt>Ref</tt> or <tt>Fn::GetAtt</tt> intrinsic function, when the stack
--   is updated. For example, if your template includes a reference to a
--   resource that is conditionally recreated, the value of the reference
--   (the physical ID of the resource) might change, depending on if the
--   resource is recreated. If the resource is recreated, it will have a
--   new physical ID, so all references to that resource will also be
--   updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:changeSource:ResourceChangeDetail'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChangeDetail_changeSource</a> - The group to which the
--   <tt>CausingEntity</tt> value belongs. There are five entity groups:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ResourceReference</tt> entities are <tt>Ref</tt> intrinsic
--   functions that refer to resources in the template, such as <tt>{ "Ref"
--   : "MyEC2InstanceResource" }</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>ParameterReference</tt> entities are <tt>Ref</tt> intrinsic
--   functions that get template parameter values, such as <tt>{ "Ref" :
--   "MyPasswordParameter" }</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>ResourceAttribute</tt> entities are <tt>Fn::GetAtt</tt>
--   intrinsic functions that get resource attribute values, such as <tt>{
--   "Fn::GetAtt" : [ "MyEC2InstanceResource", "PublicDnsName" ]
--   }</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>DirectModification</tt> entities are changes that are made
--   directly to the template.</li>
--   <li><tt>Automatic</tt> entities are
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFormation::Stack</tt> resource types, which are also
--   known as nested stacks. If you made no changes to the
--   <tt>AWS::CloudFormation::Stack</tt> resource, CloudFormation sets the
--   <tt>ChangeSource</tt> to <tt>Automatic</tt> because the nested stack's
--   template might have changed. Changes to a nested stack's template
--   aren't visible to CloudFormation until you run an update on the parent
--   stack.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:causingEntity:ResourceChangeDetail'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChangeDetail_causingEntity</a> - The identity of the entity
--   that triggered this change. This entity is a member of the group that
--   is specified by the <tt>ChangeSource</tt> field. For example, if you
--   modified the value of the <tt>KeyPairName</tt> parameter, the
--   <tt>CausingEntity</tt> is the name of the parameter
--   (<tt>KeyPairName</tt>).
--   
--   If the <tt>ChangeSource</tt> value is <tt>DirectModification</tt>, no
--   value is given for <tt>CausingEntity</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:target:ResourceChangeDetail'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChangeDetail_target</a> - A
--   <tt>ResourceTargetDefinition</tt> structure that describes the field
--   that CloudFormation will change and whether the resource will be
--   recreated.
newResourceChangeDetail :: ResourceChangeDetail

-- | Describes the target resources of a specific type in your import
--   template (for example, all <tt>AWS::S3::Bucket</tt> resources) and the
--   properties you can provide during the import to identify resources of
--   that type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceIdentifierSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceIdentifierSummary
ResourceIdentifierSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> ResourceIdentifierSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceIdentifierSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ResourceIdentifierSummary'</a>,
--   <a>resourceIdentifierSummary_resourceType</a> - The template resource
--   type of the target resources, such as <tt>AWS::S3::Bucket</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceIdentifiers:ResourceIdentifierSummary'</a>,
--   <a>resourceIdentifierSummary_resourceIdentifiers</a> - The resource
--   properties you can provide during the import to identify your target
--   resources. For example, <tt>BucketName</tt> is a possible identifier
--   property for <tt>AWS::S3::Bucket</tt> resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceIds:ResourceIdentifierSummary'</a>,
--   <a>resourceIdentifierSummary_logicalResourceIds</a> - The logical IDs
--   of the target resources of the specified <tt>ResourceType</tt>, as
--   defined in the import template.
newResourceIdentifierSummary :: ResourceIdentifierSummary

-- | The field that CloudFormation will change, such as the name of a
--   resource's property, and whether the resource will be recreated.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceTargetDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceTargetDefinition
ResourceTargetDefinition' :: Maybe RequiresRecreation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceAttribute -> ResourceTargetDefinition

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceTargetDefinition</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requiresRecreation:ResourceTargetDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>resourceTargetDefinition_requiresRecreation</a> - If the
--   <tt>Attribute</tt> value is <tt>Properties</tt>, indicates whether a
--   change to this property causes the resource to be recreated. The value
--   can be <tt>Never</tt>, <tt>Always</tt>, or <tt>Conditionally</tt>. To
--   determine the conditions for a <tt>Conditionally</tt> recreation, see
--   the update behavior for that <a>property</a> in the CloudFormation
--   User Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ResourceTargetDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>resourceTargetDefinition_name</a> - If the <tt>Attribute</tt> value
--   is <tt>Properties</tt>, the name of the property. For all other
--   attributes, the value is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attribute:ResourceTargetDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>resourceTargetDefinition_attribute</a> - Indicates which resource
--   attribute is triggering this update, such as a change in the resource
--   attribute's <tt>Metadata</tt>, <tt>Properties</tt>, or <tt>Tags</tt>.
newResourceTargetDefinition :: ResourceTargetDefinition

-- | Describes the target resource of an import operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceToImport</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceToImport
ResourceToImport' :: Text -> Text -> HashMap Text Text -> ResourceToImport

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceToImport</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ResourceToImport'</a>,
--   <a>resourceToImport_resourceType</a> - The type of resource to import
--   into your stack, such as <tt>AWS::S3::Bucket</tt>. For a list of
--   supported resource types, see <a>Resources that support import
--   operations</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:ResourceToImport'</a>,
--   <a>resourceToImport_logicalResourceId</a> - The logical ID of the
--   target resource as specified in the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceIdentifier:ResourceToImport'</a>,
--   <a>resourceToImport_resourceIdentifier</a> - A key-value pair that
--   identifies the target resource. The key is an identifier property (for
--   example, <tt>BucketName</tt> for <tt>AWS::S3::Bucket</tt> resources)
--   and the value is the actual property value (for example,
--   <tt>MyS3Bucket</tt>).
newResourceToImport :: Text -> Text -> ResourceToImport

-- | Structure containing the rollback triggers for CloudFormation to
--   monitor during stack creation and updating operations, and for the
--   specified monitoring period afterwards.
--   
--   Rollback triggers enable you to have CloudFormation monitor the state
--   of your application during stack creation and updating, and to roll
--   back that operation if the application breaches the threshold of any
--   of the alarms you've specified. For more information, see <a>Monitor
--   and Roll Back Stack Operations</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRollbackConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data RollbackConfiguration
RollbackConfiguration' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe [RollbackTrigger] -> RollbackConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>RollbackConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitoringTimeInMinutes:RollbackConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>rollbackConfiguration_monitoringTimeInMinutes</a> - The amount of
--   time, in minutes, during which CloudFormation should monitor all the
--   rollback triggers after the stack creation or update operation deploys
--   all necessary resources.
--   
--   The default is 0 minutes.
--   
--   If you specify a monitoring period but do not specify any rollback
--   triggers, CloudFormation still waits the specified period of time
--   before cleaning up old resources after update operations. You can use
--   this monitoring period to perform any manual stack validation desired,
--   and manually cancel the stack creation or update (using
--   <a>CancelUpdateStack</a>, for example) as necessary.
--   
--   If you specify 0 for this parameter, CloudFormation still monitors the
--   specified rollback triggers during stack creation and update
--   operations. Then, for update operations, it begins disposing of old
--   resources immediately once the operation completes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rollbackTriggers:RollbackConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>rollbackConfiguration_rollbackTriggers</a> - The triggers to
--   monitor during stack creation or update actions.
--   
--   By default, CloudFormation saves the rollback triggers specified for a
--   stack and applies them to any subsequent update operations for the
--   stack, unless you specify otherwise. If you do specify rollback
--   triggers for this parameter, those triggers replace any list of
--   triggers previously specified for the stack. This means:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>To use the rollback triggers previously specified for this stack,
--   if any, don't specify this parameter.</li>
--   <li>To specify new or updated rollback triggers, you must specify
--   <i>all</i> the triggers that you want used for this stack, even
--   triggers you've specifed before (for example, when creating the stack
--   or during a previous stack update). Any triggers that you don't
--   include in the updated list of triggers are no longer applied to the
--   stack.</li>
--   <li>To remove all currently specified triggers, specify an empty list
--   for this parameter.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If a specified trigger is missing, the entire stack operation fails
--   and is rolled back.
newRollbackConfiguration :: RollbackConfiguration

-- | A rollback trigger CloudFormation monitors during creation and
--   updating of stacks. If any of the alarms you specify goes to ALARM
--   state during the stack operation or within the specified monitoring
--   period afterwards, CloudFormation rolls back the entire stack
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRollbackTrigger</a> smart constructor.
data RollbackTrigger
RollbackTrigger' :: Text -> Text -> RollbackTrigger

-- | Create a value of <a>RollbackTrigger</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:RollbackTrigger'</a>, <a>rollbackTrigger_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the rollback trigger.
--   
--   If a specified trigger is missing, the entire stack operation fails
--   and is rolled back.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':RollbackTrigger'</a>, <a>rollbackTrigger_type</a> - The
--   resource type of the rollback trigger. Currently,
--   <a>AWS::CloudWatch::Alarm</a> is the only supported resource type.
newRollbackTrigger :: Text -> Text -> RollbackTrigger

-- | The Stack data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStack</a> smart constructor.
data Stack
Stack' :: Maybe [Output] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe StackDriftInformation -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Capability] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RollbackConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe [Parameter] -> Text -> ISO8601 -> StackStatus -> Stack

-- | Create a value of <a>Stack</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputs:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_outputs</a> - A list of output
--   structures.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_roleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of an Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that is
--   associated with the stack. During a stack operation, CloudFormation
--   uses this role's credentials to make calls on your behalf.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionTime:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_deletionTime</a> - The time
--   the stack was deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftInformation:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_driftInformation</a> -
--   Information on whether a stack's actual configuration differs, or has
--   <i>drifted</i>, from it's expected configuration, as defined in the
--   stack template and any values specified as template parameters. For
--   more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration Changes
--   to Stacks and Resources</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableTerminationProtection:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_enableTerminationProtection</a> - Whether termination
--   protection is enabled for the stack.
--   
--   For <a>nested stacks</a>, termination protection is set on the root
--   stack and cannot be changed directly on the nested stack. For more
--   information, see <a>Protecting a Stack From Being Deleted</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackStatusReason:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_stackStatusReason</a> -
--   Success/failure message associated with the stack status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilities:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_capabilities</a> - The
--   capabilities allowed in the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_stackId</a> - Unique identifier
--   of the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationARNs:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_notificationARNs</a> -
--   SNS topic ARNs to which stack related events are published.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rootId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_rootId</a> - For nested
--   stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the stack ID of
--   the top-level stack to which the nested stack ultimately belongs.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_tags</a> - A list of <tt>Tag</tt>s
--   that specify information about the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:changeSetId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_changeSetId</a> - The unique
--   ID of the change set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutInMinutes:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_timeoutInMinutes</a> -
--   The amount of time within which stack creation should complete.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_parentId</a> - For nested
--   stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the stack ID of
--   the direct parent of this stack. For the first level of nested stacks,
--   the root stack is also the parent stack.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rollbackConfiguration:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_rollbackConfiguration</a> - The rollback triggers for
--   CloudFormation to monitor during stack creation and updating
--   operations, and for the specified monitoring period afterwards.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_description</a> - A
--   user-defined description associated with the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:disableRollback:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_disableRollback</a> -
--   Boolean to enable or disable rollback on stack creation failures:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>true</tt>: disable rollback</li>
--   <li><tt>false</tt>: enable rollback</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTime:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_lastUpdatedTime</a> - The
--   time the stack was last updated. This field will only be returned if
--   the stack has been updated at least once.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_parameters</a> - A list of
--   <tt>Parameter</tt> structures.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_stackName</a> - The name
--   associated with the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_creationTime</a> - The time
--   at which the stack was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackStatus:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_stackStatus</a> - Current
--   status of the stack.
newStack :: Text -> UTCTime -> StackStatus -> Stack

-- | Contains information about whether the stack's actual configuration
--   differs, or has <i>drifted</i>, from its expected configuration, as
--   defined in the stack template and any values specified as template
--   parameters. A stack is considered to have drifted if one or more of
--   its resources have drifted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackDriftInformation</a> smart constructor.
data StackDriftInformation
StackDriftInformation' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> StackDriftStatus -> StackDriftInformation

-- | Create a value of <a>StackDriftInformation</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastCheckTimestamp:StackDriftInformation'</a>,
--   <a>stackDriftInformation_lastCheckTimestamp</a> - Most recent time
--   when a drift detection operation was initiated on the stack, or any of
--   its individual resources that support drift detection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackDriftStatus:StackDriftInformation'</a>,
--   <a>stackDriftInformation_stackDriftStatus</a> - Status of the stack's
--   actual configuration compared to its expected template configuration.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: The stack differs from its expected template
--   configuration. A stack is considered to have drifted if one or more of
--   its resources have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the stack
--   differs from its expected template configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The stack's actual configuration matches its
--   expected template configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
newStackDriftInformation :: StackDriftStatus -> StackDriftInformation

-- | Contains information about whether the stack's actual configuration
--   differs, or has <i>drifted</i>, from its expected configuration, as
--   defined in the stack template and any values specified as template
--   parameters. A stack is considered to have drifted if one or more of
--   its resources have drifted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackDriftInformationSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StackDriftInformationSummary
StackDriftInformationSummary' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> StackDriftStatus -> StackDriftInformationSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>StackDriftInformationSummary</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastCheckTimestamp:StackDriftInformationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackDriftInformationSummary_lastCheckTimestamp</a> - Most recent
--   time when a drift detection operation was initiated on the stack, or
--   any of its individual resources that support drift detection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackDriftStatus:StackDriftInformationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackDriftInformationSummary_stackDriftStatus</a> - Status of the
--   stack's actual configuration compared to its expected template
--   configuration.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: The stack differs from its expected template
--   configuration. A stack is considered to have drifted if one or more of
--   its resources have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the stack
--   differs from its expected template configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The stack's actual configuration matches its
--   expected template configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
newStackDriftInformationSummary :: StackDriftStatus -> StackDriftInformationSummary

-- | The StackEvent data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackEvent</a> smart constructor.
data StackEvent
StackEvent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceStatus -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ISO8601 -> StackEvent

-- | Create a value of <a>StackEvent</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceProperties:StackEvent'</a>,
--   <a>stackEvent_resourceProperties</a> - BLOB of the properties used to
--   create the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:StackEvent'</a>, <a>stackEvent_resourceType</a> -
--   Type of resource. (For more information, go to <a>Amazon Web Services
--   Resource Types Reference</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:physicalResourceId:StackEvent'</a>,
--   <a>stackEvent_physicalResourceId</a> - The name or unique identifier
--   associated with the physical instance of the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceStatusReason:StackEvent'</a>,
--   <a>stackEvent_resourceStatusReason</a> - Success/failure message
--   associated with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:StackEvent'</a>,
--   <a>stackEvent_logicalResourceId</a> - The logical name of the resource
--   specified in the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceStatus:StackEvent'</a>,
--   <a>stackEvent_resourceStatus</a> - Current status of the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientRequestToken:StackEvent'</a>,
--   <a>stackEvent_clientRequestToken</a> - The token passed to the
--   operation that generated this event.
--   
--   All events triggered by a given stack operation are assigned the same
--   client request token, which you can use to track operations. For
--   example, if you execute a <tt>CreateStack</tt> operation with the
--   token <tt>token1</tt>, then all the <tt>StackEvents</tt> generated by
--   that operation will have <tt>ClientRequestToken</tt> set as
--   <tt>token1</tt>.
--   
--   In the console, stack operations display the client request token on
--   the Events tab. Stack operations that are initiated from the console
--   use the token format <i>Console-StackOperation-ID</i>, which helps you
--   easily identify the stack operation . For example, if you create a
--   stack using the console, each stack event would be assigned the same
--   token in the following format:
--   <tt>Console-CreateStack-7f59c3cf-00d2-40c7-b2ff-e75db0987002</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:StackEvent'</a>, <a>stackEvent_stackId</a> - The
--   unique ID name of the instance of the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventId:StackEvent'</a>, <a>stackEvent_eventId</a> - The
--   unique ID of this event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:StackEvent'</a>, <a>stackEvent_stackName</a> - The
--   name associated with a stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:StackEvent'</a>, <a>stackEvent_timestamp</a> - Time
--   the status was updated.
newStackEvent :: Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> StackEvent

-- | An CloudFormation stack, in a specific account and Region, that's part
--   of a stack set operation. A stack instance is a reference to an
--   attempted or actual stack in a given account within a given Region. A
--   stack instance can exist without a stack—for example, if the stack
--   couldn't be created for some reason. A stack instance is associated
--   with only one stack set. Each stack instance contains the ID of its
--   associated stack set, as well as the ID of the actual stack and the
--   stack status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackInstance</a> smart constructor.
data StackInstance
StackInstance' :: Maybe StackInstanceStatus -> Maybe [Parameter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackDriftStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StackInstance

-- | Create a value of <a>StackInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_status</a> - The
--   status of the stack instance, in terms of its synchronization with its
--   associated stack set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to <tt>true</tt>, to delete the stack
--   instance, and then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because:<ul><li>The associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation.</li><li>The stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or
--   <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation that failed or was stopped before
--   the stack was created or updated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterOverrides:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_parameterOverrides</a> - A list of parameters from
--   the stack set template whose values have been overridden in this stack
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_stackId</a> - The
--   ID of the stack instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackInstanceStatus:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_stackInstanceStatus</a> - The detailed status of the
--   stack instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitId:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_organizationalUnitId</a> - [Service-managed
--   permissions] The organization root ID or organizational unit (OU) IDs
--   that you specified for <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastDriftCheckTimestamp:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_lastDriftCheckTimestamp</a> - Most recent time when
--   CloudFormation performed a drift detection operation on the stack
--   instance. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for any stack instance on
--   which drift detection has not yet been performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetId:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_stackSetId</a>
--   - The name or unique ID of the stack set that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftStatus:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_driftStatus</a> - Status of the stack instance's
--   actual configuration compared to the expected template and parameter
--   configuration of the stack set to which it belongs.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: The stack differs from the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set to which it belongs. A stack
--   instance is considered to have drifted if one or more of the resources
--   in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the stack
--   instance differs from its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The stack instance's actual configuration
--   matches its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:account:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_account</a> -
--   [Self-managed permissions] The name of the Amazon Web Services account
--   that the stack instance is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_region</a> - The
--   name of the Amazon Web Services Region that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusReason:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_statusReason</a> - The explanation for the specific
--   status code that is assigned to this stack instance.
newStackInstance :: StackInstance

-- | The detailed status of the stack instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackInstanceComprehensiveStatus</a> smart
--   constructor.
data StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus
StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus' :: Maybe StackInstanceDetailedStatus -> StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:detailedStatus:StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceComprehensiveStatus_detailedStatus</a> - -
--   <tt>CANCELLED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and Region
--   has been cancelled. This is either because a user has stopped the
--   stack set operation, or because the failure tolerance of the stack set
--   operation has been exceeded.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and Region
--   failed. If the stack set operation fails in enough accounts within a
--   Region, the failure tolerance for the stack set operation as a whole
--   might be exceeded.</li>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to <tt>true</tt>, to delete the stack
--   instance, and then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region has yet to start.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region is currently in progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region completed successfully.</li>
--   </ul>
newStackInstanceComprehensiveStatus :: StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus

-- | The status that stack instances are filtered by.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackInstanceFilter</a> smart constructor.
data StackInstanceFilter
StackInstanceFilter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe StackInstanceFilterName -> StackInstanceFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>StackInstanceFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:StackInstanceFilter'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceFilter_values</a> - The status to filter by.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StackInstanceFilter'</a>, <a>stackInstanceFilter_name</a>
--   - The type of filter to apply.
newStackInstanceFilter :: StackInstanceFilter

-- | The structure that contains summary information about a stack
--   instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackInstanceSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StackInstanceSummary
StackInstanceSummary' :: Maybe StackInstanceStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackInstanceComprehensiveStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackDriftStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StackInstanceSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>StackInstanceSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_status</a> - The status of the stack instance,
--   in terms of its synchronization with its associated stack set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to <tt>true</tt>, to delete the stack
--   instance, and then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because:<ul><li>The associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation.</li><li>The stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or
--   <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation that failed or was stopped before
--   the stack was created or updated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_stackId</a> - The ID of the stack instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackInstanceStatus:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_stackInstanceStatus</a> - The detailed status
--   of the stack instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitId:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_organizationalUnitId</a> - [Service-managed
--   permissions] The organization root ID or organizational unit (OU) IDs
--   that you specified for <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastDriftCheckTimestamp:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_lastDriftCheckTimestamp</a> - Most recent time
--   when CloudFormation performed a drift detection operation on the stack
--   instance. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for any stack instance on
--   which drift detection has not yet been performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetId:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_stackSetId</a> - The name or unique ID of the
--   stack set that the stack instance is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftStatus:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_driftStatus</a> - Status of the stack
--   instance's actual configuration compared to the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set to which it belongs.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: The stack differs from the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set to which it belongs. A stack
--   instance is considered to have drifted if one or more of the resources
--   in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the stack
--   instance differs from its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The stack instance's actual configuration
--   matches its expected stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:account:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_account</a> - [Self-managed permissions] The
--   name of the Amazon Web Services account that the stack instance is
--   associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_region</a> - The name of the Amazon Web
--   Services Region that the stack instance is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusReason:StackInstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstanceSummary_statusReason</a> - The explanation for the
--   specific status code assigned to this stack instance.
newStackInstanceSummary :: StackInstanceSummary

-- | The StackResource data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackResource</a> smart constructor.
data StackResource
StackResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe StackResourceDriftInformation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ModuleInfo -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> ISO8601 -> ResourceStatus -> StackResource

-- | Create a value of <a>StackResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:StackResource'</a>, <a>stackResource_stackName</a> -
--   The name associated with the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftInformation:StackResource'</a>,
--   <a>stackResource_driftInformation</a> - Information about whether the
--   resource's actual configuration differs, or has <i>drifted</i>, from
--   its expected configuration, as defined in the stack template and any
--   values specified as template parameters. For more information, see
--   <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration Changes to Stacks and
--   Resources</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:StackResource'</a>, <a>stackResource_stackId</a> -
--   Unique identifier of the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:physicalResourceId:StackResource'</a>,
--   <a>stackResource_physicalResourceId</a> - The name or unique
--   identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of a resource
--   supported by CloudFormation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceStatusReason:StackResource'</a>,
--   <a>stackResource_resourceStatusReason</a> - Success/failure message
--   associated with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:moduleInfo:StackResource'</a>, <a>stackResource_moduleInfo</a>
--   - Contains information about the module from which the resource was
--   created, if the resource was created from a module included in the
--   stack template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StackResource'</a>,
--   <a>stackResource_description</a> - User defined description associated
--   with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:StackResource'</a>,
--   <a>stackResource_logicalResourceId</a> - The logical name of the
--   resource specified in the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:StackResource'</a>,
--   <a>stackResource_resourceType</a> - Type of resource. (For more
--   information, go to <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types Reference</a>
--   in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:StackResource'</a>, <a>stackResource_timestamp</a> -
--   Time the status was updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceStatus:StackResource'</a>,
--   <a>stackResource_resourceStatus</a> - Current status of the resource.
newStackResource :: Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> ResourceStatus -> StackResource

-- | Contains detailed information about the specified stack resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackResourceDetail</a> smart constructor.
data StackResourceDetail
StackResourceDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe StackResourceDriftInformation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ModuleInfo -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> ISO8601 -> ResourceStatus -> StackResourceDetail

-- | Create a value of <a>StackResourceDetail</a> with all optional fields

--   stack template and any values specified as template parameters. For

--   information, see <a>Metadata Attribute</a> in the CloudFormation User
--   Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:physicalResourceId:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_physicalResourceId</a> - The name or unique
--   identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of a resource
--   supported by CloudFormation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceStatusReason:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_resourceStatusReason</a> - Success/failure
--   message associated with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:moduleInfo:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_moduleInfo</a> - Contains information about the
--   module from which the resource was created, if the resource was
--   created from a module included in the stack template.

--

--   resource specified in the template.
