--   information, go to <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types Reference</a>
--   in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_lastUpdatedTimestamp</a> - Time the status was
--   updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceStatus:StackResourceDetail'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDetail_resourceStatus</a> - Current status of the
--   resource.
newStackResourceDetail :: Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> ResourceStatus -> StackResourceDetail

-- | Contains the drift information for a resource that has been checked
--   for drift. This includes actual and expected property values for
--   resources in which CloudFormation has detected drift. Only resource
--   properties explicitly defined in the stack template are checked for
--   drift. For more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated
--   Configuration Changes to Stacks and Resources</a>.
--   
--   Resources that do not currently support drift detection cannot be
--   checked. For a list of resources that support drift detection, see
--   <a>Resources that Support Drift Detection</a>.
--   
--   Use DetectStackResourceDrift to detect drift on individual resources,
--   or DetectStackDrift to detect drift on all resources in a given stack
--   that support drift detection.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackResourceDrift</a> smart constructor.
data StackResourceDrift
StackResourceDrift' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [PhysicalResourceIdContextKeyValuePair] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ModuleInfo -> Maybe [PropertyDifference] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StackResourceDriftStatus -> ISO8601 -> StackResourceDrift

-- | Create a value of <a>StackResourceDrift</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actualProperties:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_actualProperties</a> - A JSON structure
--   containing the actual property values of the stack resource.
--   
--   For resources whose <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>, this structure will not be present.
--   
--   <a>$sel:physicalResourceIdContext:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_physicalResourceIdContext</a> - Context
--   information that enables CloudFormation to uniquely identify a
--   resource. CloudFormation uses context key-value pairs in cases where a
--   resource's logical and physical IDs are not enough to uniquely
--   identify that resource. Each context key-value pair specifies a unique
--   resource that contains the targeted resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:physicalResourceId:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_physicalResourceId</a> - The name or unique
--   identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of a resource
--   supported by CloudFormation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedProperties:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_expectedProperties</a> - A JSON structure
--   containing the expected property values of the stack resource, as
--   defined in the stack template and any values specified as template
--   parameters.
--   
--   For resources whose <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is
--   <tt>DELETED</tt>, this structure will not be present.
--   
--   <a>$sel:moduleInfo:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_moduleInfo</a> - Contains information about the
--   module from which the resource was created, if the resource was
--   created from a module included in the stack template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyDifferences:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_propertyDifferences</a> - A collection of the
--   resource properties whose actual values differ from their expected
--   values. These will be present only for resources whose
--   <tt>StackResourceDriftStatus</tt> is <tt>MODIFIED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_stackId</a> - The ID of the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_logicalResourceId</a> - The logical name of the
--   resource specified in the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_resourceType</a> - The type of the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackResourceDriftStatus:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_stackResourceDriftStatus</a> - Status of the
--   resource's actual configuration compared to its expected configuration
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected template
--   configuration because the resource has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: One or more resource properties differ from
--   their expected values (as defined in the stack template and any values
--   specified as template parameters).</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected template configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation does not currently return
--   this value.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:StackResourceDrift'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDrift_timestamp</a> - Time at which CloudFormation
--   performed drift detection on the stack resource.
newStackResourceDrift :: Text -> Text -> Text -> StackResourceDriftStatus -> UTCTime -> StackResourceDrift

-- | Contains information about whether the resource's actual configuration
--   differs, or has <i>drifted</i>, from its expected configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackResourceDriftInformation</a> smart constructor.
data StackResourceDriftInformation
StackResourceDriftInformation' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> StackResourceDriftStatus -> StackResourceDriftInformation

-- | Create a value of <a>StackResourceDriftInformation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastCheckTimestamp:StackResourceDriftInformation'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDriftInformation_lastCheckTimestamp</a> - When
--   CloudFormation last checked if the resource had drifted from its
--   expected configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackResourceDriftStatus:StackResourceDriftInformation'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDriftInformation_stackResourceDriftStatus</a> - Status
--   of the resource's actual configuration compared to its expected
--   configuration
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration in that it has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the
--   resource differs from its expected configuration.Any resources that do
--   not currently support drift detection have a status of
--   <tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>. For more information, see <a>Resources that
--   Support Drift Detection</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
newStackResourceDriftInformation :: StackResourceDriftStatus -> StackResourceDriftInformation

-- | Summarizes information about whether the resource's actual
--   configuration differs, or has <i>drifted</i>, from its expected
--   configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackResourceDriftInformationSummary</a> smart
--   constructor.
data StackResourceDriftInformationSummary
StackResourceDriftInformationSummary' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> StackResourceDriftStatus -> StackResourceDriftInformationSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>StackResourceDriftInformationSummary</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastCheckTimestamp:StackResourceDriftInformationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDriftInformationSummary_lastCheckTimestamp</a> - When
--   CloudFormation last checked if the resource had drifted from its
--   expected configuration.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackResourceDriftStatus:StackResourceDriftInformationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceDriftInformationSummary_stackResourceDriftStatus</a> -
--   Status of the resource's actual configuration compared to its expected
--   configuration
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DELETED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration in that it has been deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>MODIFIED</tt>: The resource differs from its expected
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked if the
--   resource differs from its expected configuration.Any resources that do
--   not currently support drift detection have a status of
--   <tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>. For more information, see <a>Resources that
--   Support Drift Detection</a>. If you performed an
--   ContinueUpdateRollback operation on a stack, any resources included in
--   <tt>ResourcesToSkip</tt> will also have a status of
--   <tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>. For more information on skipping resources
--   during rollback operations, see <a>Continue Rolling Back an Update</a>
--   in the CloudFormation User Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: The resources's actual configuration matches its
--   expected configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
newStackResourceDriftInformationSummary :: StackResourceDriftStatus -> StackResourceDriftInformationSummary

-- | Contains high-level information about the specified stack resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackResourceSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StackResourceSummary
StackResourceSummary' :: Maybe StackResourceDriftInformationSummary -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ModuleInfo -> Text -> Text -> ISO8601 -> ResourceStatus -> StackResourceSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>StackResourceSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftInformation:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_driftInformation</a> - Information about
--   whether the resource's actual configuration differs, or has
--   <i>drifted</i>, from its expected configuration, as defined in the
--   stack template and any values specified as template parameters. For
--   more information, see <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration Changes
--   to Stacks and Resources</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:physicalResourceId:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_physicalResourceId</a> - The name or unique
--   identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceStatusReason:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_resourceStatusReason</a> - Success/failure
--   message associated with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:moduleInfo:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_moduleInfo</a> - Contains information about
--   the module from which the resource was created, if the resource was
--   created from a module included in the stack template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_logicalResourceId</a> - The logical name of
--   the resource specified in the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_resourceType</a> - Type of resource. (For more
--   information, go to <a>Amazon Web Services Resource Types Reference</a>
--   in the CloudFormation User Guide.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_lastUpdatedTimestamp</a> - Time the status was
--   updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceStatus:StackResourceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackResourceSummary_resourceStatus</a> - Current status of the
--   resource.
newStackResourceSummary :: Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> ResourceStatus -> StackResourceSummary

-- | A structure that contains information about a stack set. A stack set
--   enables you to provision stacks into Amazon Web Services accounts and
--   across Regions by using a single CloudFormation template. In the stack
--   set, you specify the template to use, as well as any parameters and
--   capabilities that the template requires.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSet</a> smart constructor.
data StackSet
StackSet' :: Maybe StackSetStatus -> Maybe PermissionModels -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Capability] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackSetDriftDetectionDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe AutoDeployment -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Parameter] -> StackSet

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSet</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_status</a> - The status of
--   the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionModel:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_permissionModel</a>
--   - Describes how the IAM roles required for stack set operations are
--   created.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>With <tt>self-managed</tt> permissions, you must create the
--   administrator and execution roles required to deploy to target
--   accounts. For more information, see <a>Grant Self-Managed Stack Set
--   Permissions</a>.</li>
--   <li>With <tt>service-managed</tt> permissions, StackSets automatically
--   creates the IAM roles required to deploy to accounts managed by
--   Organizations. For more information, see <a>Grant Service-Managed
--   Stack Set Permissions</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionRoleName:StackSet'</a>,
--   <a>stackSet_executionRoleName</a> - The name of the IAM execution role
--   used to create or update the stack set.
--   
--   Use customized execution roles to control which stack resources users
--   and groups can include in their stack sets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilities:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_capabilities</a> - The
--   capabilities that are allowed in the stack set. Some stack set
--   templates might include resources that can affect permissions in your
--   Amazon Web Services account—for example, by creating new Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) users. For more information, see
--   <a>Acknowledging IAM Resources in CloudFormation Templates.</a>
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitIds:StackSet'</a>,
--   <a>stackSet_organizationalUnitIds</a> - [Service-managed permissions]
--   The organization root ID or organizational unit (OU) IDs that you
--   specified for <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:administrationRoleARN:StackSet'</a>,
--   <a>stackSet_administrationRoleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Number
--   (ARN) of the IAM role used to create or update the stack set.
--   
--   Use customized administrator roles to control which users or groups
--   can manage specific stack sets within the same administrator account.
--   For more information, see <a>Prerequisites: Granting Permissions for
--   Stack Set Operations</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetDriftDetectionDetails:StackSet'</a>,
--   <a>stackSet_stackSetDriftDetectionDetails</a> - Detailed information
--   about the drift status of the stack set.
--   
--   For stack sets, contains information about the last <i>completed</i>
--   drift operation performed on the stack set. Information about drift
--   operations currently in progress is not included.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetARN:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_stackSetARN</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetId:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_stackSetId</a> - The ID
--   of the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_tags</a> - A list of tags that
--   specify information about the stack set. A maximum number of 50 tags
--   can be specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoDeployment:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_autoDeployment</a> -
--   [Service-managed permissions] Describes whether StackSets
--   automatically deploys to Organizations accounts that are added to a
--   target organization or organizational unit (OU).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_description</a> - A
--   description of the stack set that you specify when the stack set is
--   created or updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_stackSetName</a> - The
--   name that's associated with the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateBody:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_templateBody</a> - The
--   structure that contains the body of the template that was used to
--   create or update the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:StackSet'</a>, <a>stackSet_parameters</a> - A list
--   of input parameters for a stack set.
newStackSet :: StackSet

-- | Detailed information about the drift status of the stack set.
--   
--   For stack sets, contains information about the last <i>completed</i>
--   drift operation performed on the stack set. Information about drift
--   operations in-progress is not included.
--   
--   For stack set operations, includes information about drift operations
--   currently being performed on the stack set.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Detecting Unmanaged Changes in Stack
--   Sets</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSetDriftDetectionDetails</a> smart constructor.
data StackSetDriftDetectionDetails
StackSetDriftDetectionDetails' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe StackSetDriftStatus -> Maybe StackSetDriftDetectionStatus -> Maybe Natural -> StackSetDriftDetectionDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSetDriftDetectionDetails</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inSyncStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_inSyncStackInstancesCount</a> - The
--   number of stack instances which match the expected template and
--   parameter configuration of the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_failedStackInstancesCount</a> - The
--   number of stack instances for which the drift detection operation
--   failed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftedStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_driftedStackInstancesCount</a> - The
--   number of stack instances that have drifted from the expected template
--   and parameter configuration of the stack set. A stack instance is
--   considered to have drifted if one or more of the resources in the
--   associated stack do not match their expected configuration.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:inProgressStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_inProgressStackInstancesCount</a> -
--   The number of stack instances that are currently being checked for
--   drift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastDriftCheckTimestamp:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_lastDriftCheckTimestamp</a> - Most
--   recent time when CloudFormation performed a drift detection operation
--   on the stack set. This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for any stack set
--   on which drift detection has not yet been performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftStatus:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_driftStatus</a> - Status of the stack
--   set's actual configuration compared to its expected template and
--   parameter configuration. A stack set is considered to have drifted if
--   one or more of its stack instances have drifted from their expected
--   template and parameter configuration.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: One or more of the stack instances belonging to
--   the stack set stack differs from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration. A stack instance is considered to have drifted if one
--   or more of the resources in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked the stack set
--   for drift.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: All of the stack instances belonging to the
--   stack set stack match from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftDetectionStatus:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_driftDetectionStatus</a> - The status
--   of the stack set drift detection operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLETED</tt>: The drift detection operation completed
--   without failing on any stack instances.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The drift detection operation exceeded the
--   specified failure tolerance.</li>
--   <li><tt>PARTIAL_SUCCESS</tt>: The drift detection operation completed
--   without exceeding the failure tolerance for the operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>: The drift detection operation is currently
--   being performed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt>: The user has cancelled the drift detection
--   operation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalStackInstancesCount:StackSetDriftDetectionDetails'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetDriftDetectionDetails_totalStackInstancesCount</a> - The
--   total number of stack instances belonging to this stack set.
--   
--   The total number of stack instances is equal to the total of:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Stack instances that match the stack set configuration.</li>
--   <li>Stack instances that have drifted from the stack set
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li>Stack instances where the drift detection operation has
--   failed.</li>
--   <li>Stack instances currently being checked for drift.</li>
--   </ul>
newStackSetDriftDetectionDetails :: StackSetDriftDetectionDetails

-- | The structure that contains information about a stack set operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSetOperation</a> smart constructor.
data StackSetOperation
StackSetOperation' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe StackSetOperationStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe DeploymentTargets -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackSetOperationPreferences -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackSetDriftDetectionDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackSetOperationAction -> Maybe Bool -> StackSetOperation

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSetOperation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTimestamp:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_creationTimestamp</a> - The time at which the
--   operation was initiated. Note that the creation times for the stack
--   set operation might differ from the creation time of the individual
--   stacks themselves. This is because CloudFormation needs to perform
--   preparatory work for the operation, such as dispatching the work to
--   the requested Regions, before actually creating the first stacks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackSetOperation'</a>, <a>stackSetOperation_status</a>
--   - The status of the operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The operation exceeded the specified failure
--   tolerance. The failure tolerance value that you've set for an
--   operation is applied for each Region during stack create and update
--   operations. If the number of failed stacks within a Region exceeds the
--   failure tolerance, the status of the operation in the Region is set to
--   <tt>FAILED</tt>. This in turn sets the status of the operation as a
--   whole to <tt>FAILED</tt>, and CloudFormation cancels the operation in
--   any remaining Regions.</li>
--   <li><tt>QUEUED</tt>: [Service-managed permissions] For automatic
--   deployments that require a sequence of operations, the operation is
--   queued to be performed. For more information, see the <a>stack set
--   operation status codes</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>: The operation is currently being performed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt>: The user has cancelled the operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt>: The operation is in the process of stopping, at
--   user request.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The operation completed creating or updating
--   all the specified stacks without exceeding the failure tolerance for
--   the operation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionRoleName:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_executionRoleName</a> - The name of the IAM
--   execution role used to create or update the stack set.
--   
--   Use customized execution roles to control which stack resources users
--   and groups can include in their stack sets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTimestamp:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_endTimestamp</a> - The time at which the stack
--   set operation ended, across all accounts and Regions specified. Note
--   that this doesn't necessarily mean that the stack set operation was
--   successful, or even attempted, in each account or Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploymentTargets:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_deploymentTargets</a> - [Service-managed
--   permissions] The Organizations accounts affected by the stack
--   operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operationId:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_operationId</a> - The unique ID of a stack set
--   operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operationPreferences:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_operationPreferences</a> - The preferences for
--   how CloudFormation performs this stack set operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:administrationRoleARN:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_administrationRoleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Number (ARN) of the IAM role used to perform this stack set operation.
--   
--   Use customized administrator roles to control which users or groups
--   can manage specific stack sets within the same administrator account.
--   For more information, see <a>Define Permissions for Multiple
--   Administrators</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetDriftDetectionDetails:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_stackSetDriftDetectionDetails</a> - Detailed
--   information about the drift status of the stack set. This includes
--   information about drift operations currently being performed on the
--   stack set.
--   
--   this information will only be present for stack set operations whose
--   <tt>Action</tt> type is <tt>DETECT_DRIFT</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Detecting Unmanaged Changes in Stack
--   Sets</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetId:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_stackSetId</a> - The ID of the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:StackSetOperation'</a>, <a>stackSetOperation_action</a>
--   - The type of stack set operation: <tt>CREATE</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>,
--   or <tt>DELETE</tt>. Create and delete operations affect only the
--   specified stack set instances that are associated with the specified
--   stack set. Update operations affect both the stack set itself, as well
--   as <i>all</i> associated stack set instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retainStacks:StackSetOperation'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperation_retainStacks</a> - For stack set operations of
--   action type <tt>DELETE</tt>, specifies whether to remove the stack
--   instances from the specified stack set, but doesn't delete the stacks.
--   You can't reassociate a retained stack, or add an existing, saved
--   stack to a new stack set.
newStackSetOperation :: StackSetOperation

-- | The user-specified preferences for how CloudFormation performs a stack
--   set operation.
--   
--   For more information on maximum concurrent accounts and failure
--   tolerance, see <a>Stack set operation options</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSetOperationPreferences</a> smart constructor.
data StackSetOperationPreferences
StackSetOperationPreferences' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe RegionConcurrencyType -> StackSetOperationPreferences

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSetOperationPreferences</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxConcurrentPercentage:StackSetOperationPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationPreferences_maxConcurrentPercentage</a> - The
--   maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this operation at
--   one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, CloudFormation rounds down to the next whole number. This
--   is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero. In
--   this case, CloudFormation sets the number as one instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the <i>maximum</i> for
--   operations. For large deployments, under certain circumstances the
--   actual number of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to
--   service throttling.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>MaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>MaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   By default, <tt>1</tt> is specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:regionOrder:StackSetOperationPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationPreferences_regionOrder</a> - The order of the
--   Regions in where you want to perform the stack operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureToleranceCount:StackSetOperationPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationPreferences_failureToleranceCount</a> - The number
--   of accounts, per Region, for which this operation can fail before
--   CloudFormation stops the operation in that Region. If the operation is
--   stopped in a Region, CloudFormation doesn't attempt the operation in
--   any subsequent Regions.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>FailureTolerancePercentage</tt> (but not both).
--   
--   By default, <tt>0</tt> is specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxConcurrentCount:StackSetOperationPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationPreferences_maxConcurrentCount</a> - The maximum
--   number of accounts in which to perform this operation at one time.
--   This is dependent on the value of <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   <tt>MaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most one more than the
--   <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the <i>maximum</i> for
--   operations. For large deployments, under certain circumstances the
--   actual number of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to
--   service throttling.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>MaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>MaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   By default, <tt>1</tt> is specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureTolerancePercentage:StackSetOperationPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationPreferences_failureTolerancePercentage</a> - The
--   percentage of accounts, per Region, for which this stack operation can
--   fail before CloudFormation stops the operation in that Region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a Region, CloudFormation doesn't attempt the
--   operation in any subsequent Regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, CloudFormation rounds <i>down</i> to the next whole
--   number.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either <tt>FailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>FailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   By default, <tt>0</tt> is specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:regionConcurrencyType:StackSetOperationPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationPreferences_regionConcurrencyType</a> - The
--   concurrency type of deploying StackSets operations in Regions, could
--   be in parallel or one Region at a time.
newStackSetOperationPreferences :: StackSetOperationPreferences

-- | The structure that contains information about a specified operation's
--   results for a given account in a given Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSetOperationResultSummary</a> smart
--   constructor.
data StackSetOperationResultSummary
StackSetOperationResultSummary' :: Maybe AccountGateResult -> Maybe StackSetOperationResultStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StackSetOperationResultSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSetOperationResultSummary</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountGateResult:StackSetOperationResultSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationResultSummary_accountGateResult</a> - The results
--   of the account gate function CloudFormation invokes, if present,
--   before proceeding with stack set operations in an account
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackSetOperationResultSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationResultSummary_status</a> - The result status of
--   the stack set operation for the given account in the given Region.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CANCELLED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region has been cancelled. This is either because a user has stopped
--   the stack set operation, or because the failure tolerance of the stack
--   set operation has been exceeded.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and Region
--   failed.If the stack set operation fails in enough accounts within a
--   Region, the failure tolerance for the stack set operation as a whole
--   might be exceeded.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region is currently in progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region has yet to start.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The operation in the specified account and
--   Region completed successfully.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitId:StackSetOperationResultSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationResultSummary_organizationalUnitId</a> -
--   [Service-managed permissions] The organization root ID or
--   organizational unit (OU) IDs that you specified for
--   <a>DeploymentTargets</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:account:StackSetOperationResultSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationResultSummary_account</a> - [Self-managed
--   permissions] The name of the Amazon Web Services account for this
--   operation result.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:StackSetOperationResultSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationResultSummary_region</a> - The name of the Amazon
--   Web Services Region for this operation result.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusReason:StackSetOperationResultSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationResultSummary_statusReason</a> - The reason for
--   the assigned result status.
newStackSetOperationResultSummary :: StackSetOperationResultSummary

-- | The structures that contain summary information about the specified
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSetOperationSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StackSetOperationSummary
StackSetOperationSummary' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe StackSetOperationStatus -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackSetOperationAction -> StackSetOperationSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSetOperationSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTimestamp:StackSetOperationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationSummary_creationTimestamp</a> - The time at which
--   the operation was initiated. Note that the creation times for the
--   stack set operation might differ from the creation time of the
--   individual stacks themselves. This is because CloudFormation needs to
--   perform preparatory work for the operation, such as dispatching the
--   work to the requested Regions, before actually creating the first
--   stacks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackSetOperationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationSummary_status</a> - The overall status of the
--   operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>: The operation exceeded the specified failure
--   tolerance. The failure tolerance value that you've set for an
--   operation is applied for each Region during stack create and update
--   operations. If the number of failed stacks within a Region exceeds the
--   failure tolerance, the status of the operation in the Region is set to
--   <tt>FAILED</tt>. This in turn sets the status of the operation as a
--   whole to <tt>FAILED</tt>, and CloudFormation cancels the operation in
--   any remaining Regions.</li>
--   <li><tt>QUEUED</tt>: [Service-managed permissions] For automatic
--   deployments that require a sequence of operations, the operation is
--   queued to be performed. For more information, see the <a>stack set
--   operation status codes</a> in the CloudFormation User Guide.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt>: The operation is currently being performed.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPED</tt>: The user has cancelled the operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>STOPPING</tt>: The operation is in the process of stopping, at
--   user request.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt>: The operation completed creating or updating
--   all the specified stacks without exceeding the failure tolerance for
--   the operation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTimestamp:StackSetOperationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationSummary_endTimestamp</a> - The time at which the
--   stack set operation ended, across all accounts and Regions specified.
--   Note that this doesn't necessarily mean that the stack set operation
--   was successful, or even attempted, in each account or Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operationId:StackSetOperationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationSummary_operationId</a> - The unique ID of the
--   stack set operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:StackSetOperationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetOperationSummary_action</a> - The type of operation:
--   <tt>CREATE</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>, or <tt>DELETE</tt>. Create and
--   delete operations affect only the specified stack instances that are
--   associated with the specified stack set. Update operations affect both
--   the stack set itself as well as <i>all</i> associated stack set
--   instances.
newStackSetOperationSummary :: StackSetOperationSummary

-- | The structures that contain summary information about the specified
--   stack set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSetSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StackSetSummary
StackSetSummary' :: Maybe StackSetStatus -> Maybe PermissionModels -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackDriftStatus -> Maybe AutoDeployment -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StackSetSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSetSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:StackSetSummary'</a>, <a>stackSetSummary_status</a> -
--   The status of the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionModel:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_permissionModel</a> - Describes how the IAM roles
--   required for stack set operations are created.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>With <tt>self-managed</tt> permissions, you must create the
--   administrator and execution roles required to deploy to target
--   accounts. For more information, see <a>Grant Self-Managed Stack Set
--   Permissions</a>.</li>
--   <li>With <tt>service-managed</tt> permissions, StackSets automatically
--   creates the IAM roles required to deploy to accounts managed by
--   Organizations. For more information, see <a>Grant Service-Managed
--   Stack Set Permissions</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastDriftCheckTimestamp:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_lastDriftCheckTimestamp</a> - Most recent time when
--   CloudFormation performed a drift detection operation on the stack set.
--   This value will be <tt>NULL</tt> for any stack set on which drift
--   detection has not yet been performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetId:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_stackSetId</a> - The ID of the stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftStatus:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_driftStatus</a> - Status of the stack set's actual
--   configuration compared to its expected template and parameter
--   configuration. A stack set is considered to have drifted if one or
--   more of its stack instances have drifted from their expected template
--   and parameter configuration.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DRIFTED</tt>: One or more of the stack instances belonging to
--   the stack set stack differs from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration. A stack instance is considered to have drifted if one
--   or more of the resources in the associated stack have drifted.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_CHECKED</tt>: CloudFormation has not checked the stack set
--   for drift.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt>: All of the stack instances belonging to the
--   stack set stack match from the expected template and parameter
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNKNOWN</tt>: This value is reserved for future use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoDeployment:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_autoDeployment</a> - [Service-managed permissions]
--   Describes whether StackSets automatically deploys to Organizations
--   accounts that are added to a target organizational unit (OU).
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_description</a> - A description of the stack set
--   that you specify when the stack set is created or updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetName:StackSetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSetSummary_stackSetName</a> - The name of the stack set.
newStackSetSummary :: StackSetSummary

-- | The StackSummary Data Type
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StackSummary
StackSummary' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe StackDriftInformationSummary -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Text -> ISO8601 -> StackStatus -> StackSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionTime:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_deletionTime</a> - The time the stack was deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:driftInformation:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_driftInformation</a> - Summarizes information on
--   whether a stack's actual configuration differs, or has <i>drifted</i>,
--   from it's expected configuration, as defined in the stack template and
--   any values specified as template parameters. For more information, see
--   <a>Detecting Unregulated Configuration Changes to Stacks and
--   Resources</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateDescription:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_templateDescription</a> - The template description of
--   the template used to create the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackStatusReason:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_stackStatusReason</a> - Success/Failure message
--   associated with the stack status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_stackId</a> -
--   Unique stack identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rootId:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_rootId</a> - For
--   nested stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the
--   stack ID of the top-level stack to which the nested stack ultimately
--   belongs.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentId:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_parentId</a> - For
--   nested stacks--stacks created as resources for another stack--the
--   stack ID of the direct parent of this stack. For the first level of
--   nested stacks, the root stack is also the parent stack.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Working with Nested Stacks</a> in the
--   <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTime:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_lastUpdatedTime</a> - The time the stack was last
--   updated. This field will only be returned if the stack has been
--   updated at least once.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackName:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_stackName</a> -
--   The name associated with the stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_creationTime</a> - The time the stack was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackStatus:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_stackStatus</a>
--   - The current status of the stack.
newStackSummary :: Text -> UTCTime -> StackStatus -> StackSummary

-- | The Tag type enables you to specify a key-value pair that can be used
--   to store information about an CloudFormation stack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - <i>Required</i>. A string used
--   to identify this tag. You can specify a maximum of 128 characters for
--   a tag key. Tags owned by Amazon Web Services (Amazon Web Services)
--   have the reserved prefix: <tt>aws:</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - <i>Required</i>. A string
--   containing the value for this tag. You can specify a maximum of 256
--   characters for a tag value.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Detailed information concerning the specification of a CloudFormation

data TypeConfigurationDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>TypeConfigurationDetails</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:TypeConfigurationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>typeConfigurationDetails_typeName</a> - The name of the extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alias:TypeConfigurationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>typeConfigurationDetails_alias</a> - The alias specified for this
--   configuration, if one was specified when the configuration was set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configuration:TypeConfigurationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>typeConfigurationDetails_configuration</a> - A JSON string
--   specifying the configuration data for the extension, in this account
--   and region.
--

--   CloudFormation returns <tt>{}</tt>.

--   for the configuration data, in this account and region.

--   <a>typeConfigurationDetails_lastUpdated</a> - When the configuration
--   data was last updated for this extension.
--   
--   If a configuration has not been set for a specified extension,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.

--   <a>typeConfigurationDetails_isDefaultConfiguration</a> - Whether or
--   not this configuration data is the default configuration for the
--   extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeArn:TypeConfigurationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>typeConfigurationDetails_typeArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) for the extension, in this account and region.
--   
--   For public extensions, this will be the ARN assigned when you
--   <a>activate the type</a> in this account and region. For private
--   extensions, this will be the ARN assigned when you <a>register the
--   type</a> in this account and region.
newTypeConfigurationDetails :: TypeConfigurationDetails

-- | Filter criteria to use in determining which extensions to return.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTypeFilters</a> smart constructor.
data TypeFilters
TypeFilters' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Category -> TypeFilters

-- | Create a value of <a>TypeFilters</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeNamePrefix:TypeFilters'</a>,
--   <a>typeFilters_typeNamePrefix</a> - A prefix to use as a filter for
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publisherId:TypeFilters'</a>, <a>typeFilters_publisherId</a> -
--   The id of the publisher of the extension.
--   
--   Extensions published by Amazon are not assigned a publisher ID. Use
--   the <tt>AWS-TYPES</tt> category to specify a list of types published
--   by Amazon.
--   
--   <a>$sel:category:TypeFilters'</a>, <a>typeFilters_category</a> - The
--   category of extensions to return.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>REGISTERED</tt>: Private extensions that have been registered
--   for this account and region.</li>
--   <li><tt>ACTIVATED</tt>: Public extensions that have been activated for
--   this account and region.</li>
--   <li><tt>THIRD-PARTY</tt>: Extensions available for use from publishers
--   other than Amazon. This includes:<ul><li>Private extensions registered
--   in the account.</li><li>Public extensions from publishers other than
--   Amazon, whether activated or not.</li></ul></li>
--   <li><tt>AWS-TYPES</tt>: Extensions available for use from Amazon.</li>
--   </ul>
newTypeFilters :: TypeFilters

-- | Contains summary information about the specified CloudFormation
--   extension.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTypeSummary</a> smart constructor.
data TypeSummary
TypeSummary' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IdentityProvider -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RegistryType -> Maybe Text -> TypeSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>TypeSummary</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isActivated:TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_isActivated</a> -
--   Whether or not the extension is activated for this account and region.
--   
--   This applies only to third-party public extensions. Extensions
--   published by Amazon are activated by default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_typeName</a> - The
--   name of the extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when you <a>activate this
--   extension</a> in your account and region, CloudFormation considers
--   that alias as the type name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publisherName:TypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeSummary_publisherName</a> - The publisher name, as defined in
--   the public profile for that publisher in the service used to verify
--   the publisher identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publisherId:TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_publisherId</a> -
--   The ID of the extension publisher, if the extension is published by a
--   third party. Extensions published by Amazon do not return a publisher
--   ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestPublicVersion:TypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeSummary_latestPublicVersion</a> - For public extensions that
--   have been activated for this account and region, the latest version of
--   the public extension <i>that is available</i>. For any extensions
--   other than activated third-arty extensions, CloudFormation returns
--   <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   How you specified <tt>AutoUpdate</tt> when enabling the extension
--   affects whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extention in
--   this account and region when a new version is released. For more
--   information, see <a>Setting CloudFormation to automatically use new
--   versions of extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdated:TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_lastUpdated</a> -
--   When the specified extension version was registered. This applies only
--   to:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Private extensions you have registered in your account. For more
--   information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.</li>
--   <li>Public extensions you have activated in your account with
--   auto-update specified. For more information, see
--   <a>ActivateType</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For all other extension types, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultVersionId:TypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeSummary_defaultVersionId</a> - The ID of the default version of
--   the extension. The default version is used when the extension version
--   is not specified.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account. For public extensions, both those provided by Amazon and
--   published by third parties, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>. For
--   more information, see <a>RegisterType</a>.
--   
--   To set the default version of an extension, use <tt>
--   SetTypeDefaultVersion </tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_description</a> -
--   The description of the extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originalTypeName:TypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeSummary_originalTypeName</a> - For public extensions that have
--   been activated for this account and region, the type name of the
--   public extension.
--   
--   If you specified a <tt>TypeNameAlias</tt> when enabling the extension
--   in this account and region, CloudFormation treats that alias as the
--   extension's type name within the account and region, not the type name
--   of the public extension. For more information, see <a>Specifying
--   aliases to refer to extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publisherIdentity:TypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeSummary_publisherIdentity</a> - The service used to verify the
--   publisher identity.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Registering your account to publish
--   CloudFormation extensions</a> in the <i>CFN-CLI User Guide for
--   Extension Development</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicVersionNumber:TypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeSummary_publicVersionNumber</a> - For public extensions that
--   have been activated for this account and region, the version of the
--   public extension to be used for CloudFormation operations in this
--   account and region.
--   
--   How you specified <tt>AutoUpdate</tt> when enabling the extension
--   affects whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extention in
--   this account and region when a new version is released. For more
--   information, see <a>Setting CloudFormation to automatically use new
--   versions of extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_type</a> - The kind of
--   extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeArn:TypeSummary'</a>, <a>typeSummary_typeArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the extension.
newTypeSummary :: TypeSummary

-- | Contains summary information about a specific version of a
--   CloudFormation extension.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTypeVersionSummary</a> smart constructor.
data TypeVersionSummary
TypeVersionSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RegistryType -> Maybe ISO8601 -> TypeVersionSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>TypeVersionSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:TypeVersionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeVersionSummary_typeName</a> - The name of the extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:TypeVersionSummary'</a>, <a>typeVersionSummary_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the extension version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:TypeVersionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeVersionSummary_versionId</a> - The ID of a specific version of
--   the extension. The version ID is the value at the end of the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the extension version when it is
--   registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:TypeVersionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeVersionSummary_description</a> - The description of the
--   extension version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDefaultVersion:TypeVersionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeVersionSummary_isDefaultVersion</a> - Whether the specified
--   extension version is set as the default version.
--   
--   This applies only to private extensions you have registered in your
--   account, and extensions published by Amazon. For public third-party
--   extensions, whether or not they are activated in your account,
--   CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicVersionNumber:TypeVersionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeVersionSummary_publicVersionNumber</a> - For public extensions
--   that have been activated for this account and region, the version of
--   the public extension to be used for CloudFormation operations in this
--   account and region. For any extensions other than activated third-arty
--   extensions, CloudFormation returns <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   How you specified <tt>AutoUpdate</tt> when enabling the extension
--   affects whether CloudFormation automatically updates the extention in
--   this account and region when a new version is released. For more
--   information, see <a>Setting CloudFormation to automatically use new
--   versions of extensions</a> in the <i>CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':TypeVersionSummary'</a>, <a>typeVersionSummary_type</a>
--   - The kind of extension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeCreated:TypeVersionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>typeVersionSummary_timeCreated</a> - When the version was
--   registered.
newTypeVersionSummary :: TypeVersionSummary
